loans.name: William Ernesto

texts.es:
William, vive con su familia en casa familiar,con sus padres, esta soltero, es empleado como encargado de una granja de pollos, hace 3 años su horario es rotativo ya tiene experiencia.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar materiales como: cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro, para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, de esa manera su familia tendrá más seguridad.
El objetivo de William es siempre tener salud para seguir trabajando  y darles lo necesario a su familia .
texts.en:
William is single, he lives with his parents in their home, and is employed as the manager of a chicken farm. For three years he has worked a rotating shift and now has experience.
He needs the loan to purchase materials such as cement, sand, bricks, and iron rebar to improve the condition of his home. In this way, his family will have more security.
William’s goal is to always have good health to be able to continue working and provide whatever is necessary for his family.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, and iron rebar.

loans.name: Damaris Del Pilar

texts.es:
Damaris, vive con su esposo y su hija en casa familiar, ella en su casa tiene su negocio de productos de primera necesidad como: maíz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite y por la tardes se dedica a vender pupusas dos días por semana los negocios lo inicio por iniciativa propia debido a la necesidad de mantener a su familia.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar la materia prima para las pupusas y para la tienda como: quesillo, chicharrón, maíz, aceite, azúcar y agregar otros productos como: gaseosas, gatorade, jugos de esa manara podrá obtener mejores ingresos y podrá darles lo necesario a su familia.
El sueño de Damaris es mantener estable su negocio crecer en clientes y siempre obtener préstamos con nuestra institución crediticia para a si mantener su buen recot y darles lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
Damaris lives with her husband and daughter in their home. She runs her business selling basic necessities such as corn, beans, sugar, and oil from her home. During the afternoons she sells pupusas [stuffed tortillas] two days a week. She started her business on her own initiative out of a need to provide for her family.
She will use the loan to purchase ingredients for the pupusas as well as items for her store. These include quesillo [cream cheese-stuffed tortillas], chicharrón [pork skins], corn, oil, and sugar as well as soda pop, Gatorade, and juice. In this way she will be able to earn more revenue and be able to provide for her family’s needs.
Damaris’ dream is to stabilize her business, increase her customer base, and continue to receive loans through the credit institution so as to be able to maintain her business and provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase soda pop, Gatorade, juice, quesillo [cream-cheese stuffed tortillas],chicharrón [pork skins], corn, and oil.

loans.name: Vanessa Alexandra

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo que se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de la ciudad de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su artesanía como  los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Vanessa, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 8, 6 y 2 años de edad, los  dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es controlador de un bus.

Ella es una muy buena esposa que  para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también trabaja a base de pedidos que le realizan  sus clientes. Trabaja tres días de la semana pero sobre todo por las mañanas ya que a estas horas aprovecha que sus hijos están en la escuela y ya en la tardes no sale porque tiene que ayudar a sus hijos con las tareas de la escuela.  Deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada fin de semana. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita, lleva dos años dedicada al comercio y le ha ido bien con sus ventas.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que su negocio ha estado muy bueno y mucho más en este último mes, razón por lo cual necesita de mucha urgencia del crédito para ir a comprar más mercadería  como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños ya que tiene varios pedidos y espera quedar bien para ganar más clientela. Ella en  los pagos no tuvo ningún problema y que  le gusta cumplir para seguir adelante con los créditos, con lo que gano del crédito anterior hizo varios arreglos en su cocina con lo cual ha mejorado mucho su vida, ella siempre utiliza sus ganancias para mejoras en su hogar.

Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 6 ciclos  y le gusta porque es muy fácil conseguir los créditos.

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo” (Toward Development with Love and Faith) meets every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its rich culture and its handicrafts. For example, its straw hats are known within and outside of the country.

Here we met Sra. Vanessa who is 24 years old, married, and has three children (ages 8, 5, and 2). The two older children are in school. Her husband is a bus driver.

Vanessa is a good wife who helps her husband with the household expenses by selling clothing of all types. She sells by going door-to-door and taking orders from her customers. Vanessa works three days a week, but only in the mornings so that she can take advantage of the time while her children are at school. She does not sell in the afternoons so that she can help her children with their schoolwork. Vanessa extends credit to her customers and collects payment at the end of the week. She travels to Guayaquil to purchase her merchandise as often as needed. Vanessa has been in business for two years and has done very well with her sales.

She is taking out another loan because her business has done very well and even more so in the last month, so she wanted to get an urgent loan to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothes since she has several orders to fill and she wants to live up to expectation so she can gain more customers.  She has never had a problem making payments on the loan and is committed to making payments on time so she can take out future loans.  She used the earnings from the last loan to fix up her kitchen which has improved her lifestyle.  She always uses the money she earns to carry out home improvement. She has been with the Communal Bank for six loan cycles and likes being a member because the loans are very easy to obtain. Her dream is to give her children the best she can.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothes.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es una mujer luchadora de 33 años de edad, el vive en la ciudad de Nasca, Perú. La ciudad es famosa por la legendaria Líneas de Nazca, una serie de antiguos, inmenso e inexplicable geroglíficos  grabados en el desierto que rodea la ciudad, generalmente atribuidos a la cultura Nazca, que habitaron en la región de 300 a 800 AD. Como tal, la ciudad atrae a una cantidad considerable de turismo. Pero Nazca también es conocida por su gente trabajadora, que han conservado  la calma a pesar de los frecuentes terremotos, tsunamis, y un alto nivel de pobreza en la región. Delia es conviviente, su pareja trabaja actualmente como recepcionista en un Hotel de su ciudad, el cual la apoya mucho en todo lo que ella emprende y sobre todo que juntos aportan en los gastos del hogar, asimismo juntos tienen 2 hijos, el mayor tiene 9 años de edad y cursa el segundo año de primaria y el menor tiene 2 años, no va a la escuela por lo pequeño que es pero es muy travieso y jugueton, nos comenta Delia.

Delia se dedica a su negocio de venta de bebidas gaseosas y cervezas, viene trabajando en este negocio alrededor de 1 año, el cual ha tenido el apoyo constante de su esposo, quien fue que la animo ya que esta clase de negocio tenia acogida en su barrio, y porque quería un trabajo que le permitiera estar cerca a sus hijos ya que quería estar muy al pendiente de ellos. Delia labora en su negocio alrededor de 8 horas diarias, pero los fines de semana labora hasta 12 horas ya que hay mayor movimiento en la venta de estos productos por estos días.

Delia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá compara materiales para construir un Kiosco (bodega) en las afueras de la casa de su suegra, esta mejora ayudara mucho en su negocio ya que tendrá un mejor espacio para colocar sus productos y sean mejor vistos por los clientes, asimismo le generara mayores ingresos y con ello seguirá ahorrando para mas adelante cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia y sobre todo darle una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Delia is a determined 33-year-old woman who lives in the city of Nasca, Perú.  The city is famous for the legendary Líneas de Nazca (Nazca Lines), a series of ancient, immense and unexplainable hieroglyphics carved in the desert that surrounds the city.  Generally they are attributed to the Nazca culture that inhabited the region between 300 and 800 AD.  As such, the city attracts considerable tourism.  But Nazca is also known for its hard-working people who have remained calm despite the frequent earthquakes, tsunamis and high level of poverty in the region.  Delia's common-law husband who works as a receptionist at a hotel in the city.  He supports her in everything she does and together they take care of the household expenses.  They have two children, the eldest of which is 9 and in second grade.  The youngest is 2 and too young for school but, according to Delia, he is mischievous and playful.

Delia sells sodas and beer for a living and has been in business for about a year.  She has had constant support from her husband who encouraged her to get started since this type of business is well received in the neighborhood.  Her work also allows her to be near her children.  She works about eight hours a day and on weekends sometimes up to 12 hours because of the high demand.

Delia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since their support has helped her buy materials to build a convenience store outside her mother-in-law's house.  This will enhance the business greatly since there will be much more space for product display for the benefit of the customers.  It will also increase her income so he can continue to save for her future goal which is: "To have her own house and, especially, give her children a good quality of life".

loans.use: To build a convenience store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy strawberries, apples, pineapple, cabbage, lettuce and broccoli.

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Verónica, vive con su esposo, no tienen hijos, ella es comerciante de queso y ropa, este negocio lo tiene en el mercado municipal desde hace 5 años, tiene buena ubicación para atender a la clientela.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de blusas, camisas, faldas, y queso al por mayor, esta inversión le ayudara para mejorar el negocio, fortaleciéndolo para obtener mejores ventas.
El objetivo de Verónica es tener un mejor negocio, con la mercadería necesaria para abastecer la demanda, dándole una mayor seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Verónica lives with her husband and they have no children.  She is a merchant and sells cheese and clothing.  Her 5-year-old business is set up in the municipal market and well-located to attend to customers.

She is requesting a loan to buy blouses, shirts, skirts and cheese, wholesale.  This investment will help her improve and strengthen her business so she can increase sales.

Verónica's goal is to have a better business and enough merchandise to meet demand, which will give her a more stable economy.

loans.use: To buy blouses, shirts, skirts and cheese.

loans.name: Jose Abel

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa en casa propia, el tiene su taller automotriz el cual repara los automóviles, él aprendió el oficio de su padre quien le enseño, trabaja todos los días con un ayudante no tiene un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar herramientas que necesita para el taller como: llaves de diferentes medidas, repuestos para vehículos, tambien para alquilar un nuevo local, con el que podrá tener mas capacidad y lo necesario para atender mejor a sus clientes y los ingresos cada día serán mejores.
El sueño de José es fortalecer cada día su negocio tener las herramientas necesaria para su trabajo y tener una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife in his own home.  He has an auto repair shop where he fixes cars.  He learned the trade from his father.  He works every day, with an assistant, and doesn't work fixed hours. 

José will use this loan to buy tools that he needs for his workshop such as wrenches in different sizes, and car parts.  He will also use the loan to rent new premises so that he has more capacity and what he needs to better serve his customers.  As a result, his daily income will improve.  José's dream is to continue to strengthen his business, to have available the tools he needs for his work and for himself and his family to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy different-sized wrenches and car parts

loans.name: Venise

texts.en:
Venise, 23 years of age, is married and has two children. She owns and operates a business selling baked goods in the local community.  She has 1 year of experience in this business.  Venise needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase ingredients to produce more goods. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 WST or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Venise joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Venise's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to produce more goods

loans.name: Maclovia Cecilia

texts.es:
Maclovia de 51 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un negocio (papelería) hace ya cinco años atrás. Empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su familia poco a poco fue teniendo clientela hasta ahora que ya tiene clientes fijos. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere mejorar las ventas. Comienza su horario de trabajo desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo laminas, jugos, papelería. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
51-year-old Maclovia is a hard-working woman who has a stationery store business which she has run for five years.  She started her business with the help of her family.  She gradually gained customers and now has regular customers.  

Maclovia has many aspirations for her business and so she would like to improve her sales.  She starts work at 7.00am and works until 9.00pm.

Maclovia has many aspirations for her business and so she would like to use her loan to buy paper, juice and stationery products.  In the future, she would like to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy sheets of paper, juice and stationery products

loans.name: Josefina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Josefina, vive con su esposo y su hija de 6 años de edad en casa propia, ella tiene una tienda de productos de la canasta básica hace 4 años vende: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, maíz, aceite, consomés, sal, achote, canela, el negocio lo inicio por iniciativa propia ya tiene experiencia no tiene un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo utilizara para  comprar más mercadería Y productos nuevos como: gaseosas, jugos, gatorade, churros, galletas, dulces de esa forma podrá tener variedad y debido a la temporada los productos se venden mas y las ganancias serán mejor cada día.
El sueño de Josefina es siempre mantener estable su negocio mantener siempre su clientela y que a ella y su familia tengan lo necesario.
texts.en:
Josefina lives with her husband and her 6-year-old daughter in her own home.  She has a store where she sells basic household products.  For four years she has been selling rice, sugar, beans, corn, oil, soups, salt, annatto and cinnamon.  She started the business on her own initiative.  She has experience and doesn't work fixed hours.

Josefina will use her loan to buy more merchandise and new products such as soda, juice, Gatorade, churros, cookies and sweets.  This will enable her to have a greater variety of products available.  During this season products sell better and her profits will improve every day.

Josefina's dream is to keep her business stable, to keep her customers, and for herself and her family to have what they need.

loans.use: to buy soda, juice, Gatorade, churros, cookies and sweets

loans.name: Bertha Azucena

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de la ciudad de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y su  artesanía como los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país, se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Al Desarrollo.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Bertha. Tiene 44 años, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos,  dos mayores de edad que estudian en la universidad y el menor que estudia  el colegio, todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella  además de ser una  gran madre y ama de casa se dedica al comercio,   vende ropa de todo tipo, en especial la ropa de niños ya que a ella le encantan los niños. Su forma  de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedidos que les realizan sus clientes. Trabaja de tres a cuatro días de la semana más que todo por las mañanas ya que es más fresco y puede realizar mejor sus actividades. Su mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Lleva más de 15 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas y  en especial ropa de niños. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito.
 
Sus metas son tener buena salud y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Con Amor Y Fe Al Desarrollo' community bank meet in Los Bajos, in the city of Montecristi.  This city is known for its cultural riches and its handicrafts, such as the Panama Hat, which are known both at home and abroad.

Here we meet Bertha.  She is 44 years old, married, and has three children from her relationship.  Two of her children are grown up and are studying at University.  Her youngest is in high school.  All of her children still live at home with her.  Her husband is a salesman.

In addition to being a great mother and homemaker, Bertha also works in commerce.  She sells all kinds of clothes but especially children's clothing as she loves children.  She makes her sales door to door and also fills orders from her customers.  She works three to four days a week, mainly in the mornings as it is cooler at this time and so she is better able to carry out her activities.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever she needs to.  She has been in this business for more than 15 years and is doing very well.

Bertha will use this loan to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses and especially children's clothes.  She is a founding member of her community bank and she likes it because the interest rates are lower than they are with other loan institutions.

Bertha's goals are to enjoy good health and for her children to become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses and children's clothes

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María, es soltera vive en casa propia, ella administra una tienda en su casa de productos de granos básicos como: arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar, leche, churros, gaseosas, gatorade, jugos; desde hace 6 años se dedica a este oficio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia, no tiene un horario establecido para atender a sus clientes.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar otros productos que mas los clientes necesitan como: jabón, detergentes, champoo, chinola, pasta, cepillos, solo a si podrá tener variedad y conseguir más clientela y las ganancias serán mejores cada día.
El sueño de María es siempre mantener su negocio estable y seguir trabajando con nuestra institución mantener un buen recod crediticio y siempre tener lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
María is single and lives in her own home.  She runs a store in her home where she sells basic household products such as rice, oil, beans, sugar, milk, churros, soda, Gatorade and juice.  She has been in this business for 6 years and learned it on her own initiative.  She does not work fixed hours serving her customers.

María will use her loan to buy other products that her customers need such as soap, detergents, shampoo, rollers, toothpaste and brushes.  This is the only way she can have a greater variety of merchandise available.  She will attract more customers and her profits will improve.

María's dream is to keep her business stable, to continue working with our institution, to keep her good credit history and to have everything she needs.

loans.use: to buy soap, detergents, shampoo, rollers, toothpaste and brushes

loans.name: Roseta

texts.en:
Roseta is 29 years of age and is married with two children.

Roseta owns and operates a business venture, selling dried goods in the local community. She has 1 year of experience in this business. Roseta needs a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Roseta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Roseta's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria Isabel  tiene 39 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Mala, Perú. Ubicado alrededor de una hora y media al sur de Lima, Mala, con sus playas de arena, ruinas pre-incas, y la producción del adorado nacional licor de Perú, el Pisco (una especie de aguardiente de uva), ha sido durante mucho tiempo un destino turístico para los peruanos adinerados. Mala es una ciudad cálida y tranquila con una gran población afro-peruana, los restos de un camino indígena, y las influencias del imperio español. La ciudad, junto con otros cerca de la costa del Pacífico, fue dañado durante el 2001 y 2007 terremotos,  pero ha soportado como lo ha hecho durante gran parte de su historia.  Maria en su tiempo libre disfruta pasear con sus hijos;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Maria le gusta mucho es el “Lomo Saltado”, Maria es soltera y la profesión que ella estudio fue la de “Técnica en Farmacia  tiene 2 hijos el mayor de 19 años de edad se encuentra en la universidad y el menor de 14 años de edad cursa el segundo año de secundaria, Maria está muy feliz con sus hijos sobre todo porque son el motivo por el cual ella lucha cada día y porque desea que ellos sean mejor de lo que ella es y a pesar de todo y de ser madre soltera los saca adelante.

Maria Isabel se dedica a la venta de medicamentos en su Farmacia, se dedica a este trabajo 11 horas diarias, ella se animo porque veía que había mucha acogida por  esta clase de negocio. En un día Maria Isabel puede atiende diariamente 80 clientes y esto le permite ganar gana aproximadamente un promedio de S/. 150 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar S/. 300  lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales para invertir en el negocio, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio por la paciencia que tiene con los clientes y por la calidad de su productos. Maria está muy agradecida  con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá comprar más medicamentos para su negocio y realizar mejoras para ampliar su local. 

Esta mejora le permitirá tener medicamentos adecuados y seguir brindando una buena atención a sus clientes  y así poder ahorrar para cumplir su gran sueño: " Tener una cadena de farmacias en las zonas aledañas y darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is 39 years old and lives in the city of Mala, Peru, approximately one and a half hours to the south of Lima.  Mala, with its sandy beaches, pre-Incan ruins and its production of Peru's much-loved national liquor - Pisco (a type of grape brandy) - has long been a tourist destination for wealthy Peruvians.  Mala is a warm and peaceful city with a large afro-Peruvian population.  The rest are indigenous people and people with roots in the Spanish Empire.  This city, together with other nearby cities on the Pacific coast, was damaged during the 2001 and 2007 earthquakes but it survived as it has done throughout most of its history.

In her free time, Maria enjoys going for walks with her children.  It is well known that Peru has the most delicious food in the world and one of the dishes that Maria really enjoys is 'lomo saltado' (stir-fried sirloin).  Maria is single and studied to be a pharmacist.  She has two children.  Her eldest son is 19 years old and is studying at University.  Her youngest is 14 and is in his second year of high school.  Maria is very happy with her children.  They are the reason she works hard every day.  She would like them to do better than she has done and in spite of everything, including the fact that she is a single mother, she manages to get them ahead in life.

Maria Isabel sells medicines in her pharmacy.  She works 11 hours a day.  She was encouraged because she saw that this type of business was well received.  Each day, Maria Isabel can serve 80 customers and this allows her to earn, on average, 150 soles a day.  On a good day, she can earn 300 soles.  This helps her with some additional expenses and she is able to invest in her business.  She believes that her business is doing well because of the patience that she has with her customers and the quality of her products.  Maria is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, she will be able to buy more medicines for her business and make some improvements in expanding her premises.  This improvement will enable her to have the right medicines available and continue providing her customers with a good service.  In this way, she will be able to save up to fulfill her big dream: to have a chain of pharmacies in neighboring areas and to ensure her children have a profession.

loans.use: to buy medicines and expand her premises

loans.name: Diomedes Armando

texts.es:
Diomedes, es agricultor y ganadero, vive en casa propia, con tres hijos, él inicio este oficio por iniciativa propia, trabaja en sus propias tierras, no tiene un horario establecido.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para comprar una vaca y un ternero, para aumentar sus crías en el corral, esta compra le ayudara a tener más ganado y con la esperanza de en un futuro recibir mayores ganancias de esta compra.
Él tiene como objeto, pagar este préstamo muy bien, realizar una buena inversión, estar al pendiente de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Diomedes is a farmer and cattle rancher. He lives in his own house with three children. He began this work by his own initiative. He works on his own land. He doesn't have an established schedule.

Currently he is requesting a loan to purchase a cow and a calf in order to expand the offspring in his barnyard. This purchase will help him to have more cattle and hopefully to receive greater earnings in the future from this purchase.

His objectives are to pay this loan very well, make a good investment and to keep an eye on his children.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and a calf.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sodas, juices, and fruit for natural refreshments.

loans.name: Meleseke

texts.en:
Meleseke is 25 years of age and is married with one child.

Meleseke owns and operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community. She has 1 year of experience in this business. Meleseke needs a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Meleseke joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Meleseke's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sodas, juices and gatorade.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw seed.

loans.name: Antonia Angelica

texts.es:
Antonia, se dedica a la venta de ropa, vive con una hija y con los nietos, tiene un año de estar en el negocio de la ropa, con este negocio ha logrado mantenerse y ganar muchos clientes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de variedad de ropa, blusas, faldas, ropa interior, ropa para niños, con esta inversión del préstamo, ella espera que el negocio crezca y tener más capacidad para atender a los clientes.
Su aspiración es tener mayor capacidad con el negocio y poder mejorar la situación económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Antonia is dedicated to selling clothing. She lives with her daughter and her grandchildren. She has been in the clothing business for one year. With this business, she has managed to support herself and gain many customers.

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase a variety of clothing, blouses, skirts, underwear, children's clothing. With this investment of the loan, she hopes that the business grows and she has more capacity to attend to her customers.

Her aspiration is the business to have greater capacity and to be able to improve the economic situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing, blouses, skirts, underwear.

loans.name: Tumema

texts.en:
Tumema is 41 years of age and is married with 7 children.

Tumema owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has 1 year of experience in this business. Tumema needs a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Tumema joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Tumema's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Mariela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mariela, de 36 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, vive en la ciudad de Granada, ella logro estudiar solo la secundaria, se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama y caballeros desde hace dos años . Su vida se divide en su faceta como madre y comerciante donde cada mañana se alista para preparar a sus hijos y llevarlos a la escuela y luego dirigirse a atender su negocio venta de ropa , abriendo su tramo desde tempranas hora vistiendo a los maniquíes de trajes para llamar la atención de sus clientes, ella es muy activa y le gusta estar en movimiento y contacto con la gente aunque es a veces es muy duro y cansado ella sigue ya que este negocio le ha permitido lograr independencia como mujer y salir adelante con sus hijos en busca de un mejor futuro para ellos.
Ella realizo el crédito para comprar ropa de vestir para damas y caballeros. Pues al variar los estilos y buscar prendas accesibles le permiten que se mueva su mercadería y logre vender. Una de sus metas es ampliar su venta de ropa incorporando nuevos productos para vender y hacer más atractivo su tramo pues le gusta ser dinámica a  la hora de vender y hacer la diferencia entre los demás comerciantes.
texts.en:
Mariela, age 36, has two children and lives in the city of Granada. She was only able to stay in school until the secondary level. She has sold men's and women's clothing for two years. Her life has two facets; that of mother and that of merchant. She gets up every morning to get her children ready and take them to school, and then she takes care of her clothing business. She opens her store early in the morning, dressing the mannequins in order to draw the attention of her customers. She is very active and enjoys being in motion and in contact with people, and she carries on even though it is very hard at times and she gets tired. This business has allowed her to achieve her independence as a woman and to get her children ahead. She is working for a better future for them.
She has taken out this loan for the purchase of men's and women's clothing. Through varying her styles and looking for accessible items, she is able to move her merchandise and sell it. One of her goals is to expand her sales and start selling new products in order to make her store more attractive. She enjoys being dynamic and distinguishing herself from among the other merchants.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: Jose Efrain

texts.es:
José, vive con su  madre en casa alquilada, el tiene su negocio de ropa y cosméticos en el mercado de la ciudad, junto con su madre iniciaron el negocio, lo atienden todos los días de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para incrementar el inventario de ropa y comprar más como: faldas, blusas, vestidos, pantalones, camisas, ropa interior, con el propósito de que este mes de diciembre y enero sean mejores las ventas y obtener mejores ganancias.
El sueño de José es comprar ó hacer una casa en un lote que ya compraron, producto de las ganancias de su negocio y vivir junto con su madre.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his mom in a rented home; he has a business selling clothes and cosmetics at the local market.  Together, his mother and him started the business, they tend to it every day from Monday to Sunday.
The loan will be used to increase the inventory of clothes and purchase more things like: skirts, blouses, dresses, pants, shirts, undergarments, with the intent of having higher sales in the December and January months and therefor having higher earnings.
Jose's dream is to build a home to live in with his mother on a piece of land that they've already purchased with the earnings from the business.

loans.use: to purchase skirts, blouses, dresses, pants, shirts, and other clothes.

loans.name: Karla Yarenci

texts.es: La Sra. Karla y su esposo son una pareja joven que  gracias  a  su  esfuerzo  han logrado  salir  adelante , el  actualmente   trabaja  teniendo  mas de  un  año  de  antigüedad  laboral,  y  ella  lo  apoya   vendiendo  ropa  nueva,  nos  comenta  que  actualmente  sus  ventas  se  incrementaron satisfactoriamente  ya  que  se les   ocurrió  promocionar  su mercancía  en  Internet, es  por  ello  que  ella  se acerco  con nosotros  ya que requiere  realizar  la compra  de ropa para  continuar  brindando a sus  clientes  el  excelente  servicio  que  la a caracterizado, agradece  el  apoyo  brindado para  la  realización de su proyecto.
texts.en: Mrs. Karla  and her husband are a young couple who, thanks to their hard work, have been able to get ahead. Her husband has worked for one year, and she supports him by selling new clothing. She tells us that her sales are currently growing nicely, since she promotes her merchandise on the internet. For this reason she has turned to us, since she needs to make a purchase of clothing in order to offer her characteristically excellent customer service. She is grateful for this support with her project.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Triunfadoras Leales De Motupe Group

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa de 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos los cuales aún dependen de ella. Tiene 10 años con Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de dulces en general como galletas, gaseosas, chupetes, etc.; lleva 10 años en este negocio con el cual comenzó a raíz de poder ayudar a sus hijos con la educación necesaria para que puedan triunfar en la vida. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado abrir un negocio y ha podido dar la educación pertinente a sus hijos. Actualmente su ingreso lo destina a cubrir los gastos de alimentación y transporte, mientras que su esposo cubre los gastos de agua, luz y teléfono. Su plan para el futuro es ampliar su negocio y terminar de construir su hogar. Ella usó el crédito en la compra de mercadería. Rosa pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Triunfadoras Leales de Motupe”, con el cual lleva 1 año como presidenta y que esta conformado por 7 personas. Se formo con el objetivo de que cada socio pueda desarrollarse  y triunfe en la vida y en su negocio, motivo por el cual le pusieron dicho nombre al grupo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 50, married, and has two children who still depend on her. 

She has been with Edaprospo for ten years, and sells candy in general, such as cookies, soft drinks, lollipops, etc. She has been in this business for ten years, which she started in order to help her children get the education they need, so that they can succeed in life.

With her hard work and effort she has managed to open a business, and has been able to provide her children with a proper education. 

Currently, she is allocating her income to cover expenses for food and transportation, while her husband covers the cost of water, electricity, and telephone. 

Her plan for the future is to expand her business, and finish building her home.

She used her loan to buy merchandise. 

Rosa belongs to the "Triunfadores Leales de Motupe" (The Loyal Winners of Motupe) communal bank, which is made up of seven people. She has been the president for one year. It was formed with the objective of each member developing themselves, and "winning" in their business and in their life. This is the reason why they gave this name to the group.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Arquimides Antonio

texts.es:
Arquímedes, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos, el se dedica a la agricultura el cual cosecha frijoles y maíz, no tiene un horario fijo para atender sus labores.
El préstamo lo necesita para invertirlo en alquiler de dos manzanas de tierra para sembrar sus productos y comprar los insumos agrícolas como: herbicidas, abono y semilla para que este año sean mejores sus cosechas y poder darles lo que necesitan su familia.
El sueño de Arquímedes es mejorar económicamente para que a su familia no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Arquímedes lives with his wife and two children. He works in agriculture harvesting beans and corn. He does not have a fixed schedule to tend to his labors.

He needs this loan so he can rent just about 3-1/2 acres of land to plant his crops and to buy agriculture supplies such as herbicides, compost and seed so that this year the crops will be better and he will be able to give his family the things they need.

The dream of Arquímedes is to improve his financial standing so that his family does not lack anything.

loans.use: to rent 3-1/2 acres of land to plant his crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, blouses and underwear.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Felipe de 49 años convive con Aurora de 40 años fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hijos, ellos viven en su casa a base de mateerial rustico, ubicado en la comunidad de Sivia. Felipe es un agricultor de buena trayectoria, él cultiva productos como el cacao, café en su propia parcela agrícola. Al inicio todo fue muy difícil hasta el día en que empezó a cosechar, pues los productos que obtenian eran bueno, con ello logró mantenerse en el mercado. Por tanto continuo invirtiendo el poco capital que tenía para ampliar la siembra de en otras parcelas. Felipe está orgulloso con sus productos que cultiva, porque en la actualidad están teniendo mayor acogida por los comercializadores y por ende mejores precios para los productos de los agricultores. En un futuro desea abrir un negocio en la venta de productos de primera necesidad para lo cual necesita un establecimiento adecuado y seguro. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que Felipe se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3, 000 nuevos soles comprará calaminas para techar su nueva vivienda.
texts.en:
Felipe who is 49 years old lives with Aurora who is 40 years old and from this relationship they have 3 children, who live in their cottage located in the community of Sivia.

Felipe is a farmer with a good record cultivating products such as cocoa and coffee on his own farming land. Everything was difficult in the beginning until the day he began to harvest; well, the crops that he grew were good, and with them he was successful at the market.

So he continued investing the little money that he had to expand the planting of other fields. Felipe is proud of what he grows, because currently he is having a better reception from the traders and hence better prices for his agricultural crops.

In the future he wants to open a business selling staple products for which he needs a suitable and safe facility. 

This will be his first loan with MFP, and Felipe promises to make his payments on time in accordance with the schedule. With the 3000 soles he will buy corrugated iron to put a roof on his new home.

loans.use: to buy corrugated iron to put a roof on his home

loans.name: Doris Xiomara

texts.es:
Doris, vive con su esposo en casa familiar, ella tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad como: aceite, arroz, jugos, gaseosas, gatorade, churros, galletas, el negocio lo inicio junto a su madre, trabaja de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar la mercadería necesaria para surtir su negocio como: jabón, detergentes, champoo,entre otros que de esa manera podrá mejorar su inventario y sus ventas cada día serán mejores.
La aspiración de Doris es que cada día atender mejor a sus clientes brindarles los productos que más necesitan y ayudar para los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Doris lives with her husband in the family home.  She has a store where she sells products of basic necessity like: oil, rice, juice, soft drinks, Gatorade, churros, and cookies.  She started the business along with her mother and they work from Monday to Sunday.  
The loan will be used to purchase merchandise necessary to stock the business, like: soaps, detergents, shampoo, amongst others.  This way she will be able to improve her inventory and her sales will improve daily.  Doris aspires to improve her customer care and offer them the products they most need and to be able to provide for her own household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase soaps, detergents, shampoo.

loans.name: Jef Jel Group

texts.fr:
ce groupe est composé de 14 femmes de la même localité. Elles ont organisé leur groupe par affinité et par voisinage. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce

Nogoye est une femme âgée de 39 ans. Elle est marié et mère de 6 enfants. Elle a également deux autres à sa charge.

Nogoye est membre du banc villageois depuis son inauguration et elle fait parti du groupe de solidarité jef jel dont elle est responsable. Elle est debout à gauche de la photo.

Elle pratique le commerce de chaussure et d'encens. Elle dispose d une bonne expérience dans son domaine d activité.

Avec son nouveau crédit, Nogoye va acheter des paires de chaussures et de l'encens qu'elle va revendre à ses clients qui habitent le même quartier. Et son objectif est soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille

Grâce à ses bénéfices elle va son mari dans les différentes charges familiales à savoir l alimentation et scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group is composed of 14 women from the same area. They are all neighbors or friends. Their main occupation is retail.
Nogoye is a 39 year-old woman. She is married and a mother of 6. She also has 2 other dependent children.
Nogoye has been a member of the banc villageois since its creation and she is part of jef jel, a solidarity group for which she is the representative. She is standing on the left side of the picture.
She sells shoes and incense. She has a good experience in this field.
With this new loan, Nogoye will buy incense and pairs of shoes which she will resell to customers in her neighborhood. Her aim is to support her husband as he provides for the family.
With the profits, she will help her husband cover various expenses, i.e. food and her children's education.

loans.use: to buy shoes and incense to be resold.

loans.name: Jeissell Yumar

texts.es:
Jeisell, una joven de 26 años quien es originaria del departamento de Jinotega se vino a vivir a Granada hace dos años en busca de un futuro mejor, ella es madre soltera tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad, es comerciante se dedica a la venta de  leña desde hace 4 años , estudia para ser maestra los días sábados  lleva segundo año de su carrera. Ella inicio con este negocio por medio de su padre quien era el que se dedicaba a la venta de leña pero debido a su avanzada edad ya no podía seguir entonces comenzó hacerse cargo del negocio ella , esta actividad le ha sido de mucha ayuda pues de ahí saca dinero para sus estudios ya que quiere en un futuro dedicarse a dar clases para cambiar de estilo de vida y darle un futuro mejor a su hijos.
Ella realizo el crédito para comprar leña. Producto que distribuye en la as pulperías de manera ambulante o en los hogares cercanos a su vecindario. A ella le gustaría comprar un camión en el que se pueda movilizar para cubrir más clientes y poder vender mas. Por lo pronto quiere logra graduarse de maestra y salir adelante con su negocio y familia
texts.en:
Jeisell is a young woman of 26 from Jinotega department, who came to live in Granada two years ago, in search of a better future. She is a single mother, and has a four year-old son. She has had a small business selling firewood for four years. 

She is studying to be a teacher on Saturdays, and is in the second year of her program.

She began this business through her father, who was the one who sold firewood. But due to his advanced age, he wasn't able to continue, so she began to take charge of the business.

This activity has been a big help, since that's where she gets money for her studies. Also, in the future she wants to work giving classes, in order to change her way of life, and provide her children with a better future.

She is taking out the loan in order to buy firewood. She distributes this product to small general stores as a street vendor, or to homes near her neighborhood. She would like to buy a truck, which would enable to get around in order to serve more customers, and sell more.

In the meantime, she wants to succeed in graduating as a teacher, and more forward with her business and family.

loans.use: To buy firewood.

loans.name: Faiva

texts.en:
Faiva is fifty-seven years of age and is married with one child. Faiva owns and operates a business venture, baking and selling a variety of baked goods in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business.

Faiva needs a loan of WST 1,500 to buy an additional oven to help increase her product output. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Faiva joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Faiva's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to buy an additional oven to help increase product output.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, vive con su esposa y sus hijos en casa familiar, el se dedica hace tres años a la venta de mariscos como: pescado, camarones, punches, curiles, el oficio lo aprendió de sus padres no tiene un horario establecido traslada su mercadería en una bicicleta para sus clientes.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar más mercadería como: pescado y camarones, que es lo que más se vende y de esa forma podrá aumentar las ganancias y serán mejores para el beneficio de su familia.
El sueño de Carlos es fortalecer su negocio seguir trabajando con nuestra institución y de esa forma lograra mejores ingresos y ayudara mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos lives with his wife and children in the family home. For three years he has sold seafood such as: fish, shrimp, punch fish and curil. He learned the trade from his parents. He has no set schedule and transports his merchandise to his customers by bicycle.

He will use the loan to buy more merchandise such as: fish and shrimp, which is what sells the most. In this way, he can increase his earnings and they will improve for his family's benefits.

Carlos' dream is to fortify his business and continue working with our institution, thus earning more income and better helping his family.

loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Grupo Triunfador Group

texts.es: El Banco comunal esta formado por 8 emprendedores  que día a día lucha por salir adelante junto con su familia. Este grupo ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000,  en cual han demostrado que son unidos, responsable y que sus objetivos es  crecer con sus negocios, ellos nos expresa que gracias al financiamiento han aumentado su inventario y esto ha permitido que tengan mayores clientes en sus negocios. Juana es una de los miembros y es la presidente del grupo que los motiva al resto de sus compañeros para que salgan adelante. Juana sus actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería que anteriormente solicito para aumentar su inventario. Actualmente esta solicitando crédito para abastecer el negocio y ofrecerle a sus clientes variedad de productos de uso en el hogar como granos básicos, golosinas, jabones, aceite entre otros productos.
texts.en:
The communal bank has 8 entrepreneurs who day by day fight to get head together with their family. This group has had loans through Fundación León 2000, and have shown themselves to be united and trustworthy, and their goal is to grow with their businesses. They have expressed to us their thanks for the loans, which have expanded their inventory and have permitted them to have more customers in their businesses. 

Juana is one of the members and she is the president of the group who motivates the rest of the members to get ahead. Juana has a grocery store and as she has in the past she is asking for a loan to increase her inventory. 

Currently she is asking for a loan in order to stock the business to be able to offer her customers a variety of products to use in the home such as basic grains, sweets, soap, oil and other products.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, soap, and oil and other products

loans.name: Faasaveve

texts.en:
Faasaveve is thirty-nine years of age and is married with six children. Faasaveve owns and operates a business venture, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has 4 years of experience in this business. Faasaveve needs a loan of WST 2,000 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Faasaveve joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Faasaveve's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Sugey Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sugey, vive en la ciudad de Granada, casada, 35 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad, ella es comerciante se dedica a la elaboración y ventas de Piñatas desde hace 12 años. Inicio gracias a que su esposo la incentivo a que aprendiera manualidades, les gusto pues despertó en ella creatividad que nunca creyó tener de todas las cosas que aprendió lo que mas le encanto fue el aprender a elaborar piñatas para los niños   al comienzo las regalaba a sus amigos cercanos y ellos le dijeron que las vendiera pues son muy bonitas y bien elaboradas. También  hace tarjetas, cajas para regalos , flores lo que un día comenzó como una simple actividad creativo hoy en día se ha convertido en su herramienta de trabajo que le ha permitido generar ingresos por su propia cuenta. 
Ella realizo el crédito para compra de materia prima tales como  cintas de regalo, papel periódico ,papel crepe, pegamento , cajas de cartón , cartulina. Una de sus inspiraciones es su hijo quien le dice la piñata que quiere para su cumple y el cual se basa en la caricaturas de su preferencia además de elaborar una distracción que produce alegría entre los niños. Por lo pronto una de sus metas es aumentar el volumen de producción y venta de sus manualidades.
texts.en:
Sugey lives in the city of Granada. She is married, 35 years old, and has a 5 year old son. She is a merchant who for 12 years has been making and selling piñatas. She began thanks to her husband’s encouragement to learn handicrafts. She liked it, and well, it aroused creativity in her that she couldn’t believe she had. Of all the things she learned to make what she loved the most was learning to make piñatas for the children.

At the beginning she gave them away to her close friends, and they said she could sell them as they are very pretty and well made. She also makes cards, gift boxes, and flowers. What one day began as a simple creative activity today has become the work tool that has permitted her to earn an income of her own.

The loan she receives is to buy raw material such as ribbons, newsprint, crepe paper, glue, cardboard boxes, and poster board.  One of her inspirations is her son who tells her the piñata that he wants her to finish and which is based on the cartoons that he likes. Also, she likes to give entertainment and bring about joy among the children. 

For the time being one of her goals is to increase her volume of production and the sale of her handicrafts.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as ribbons, newsprint, crepe paper, glue, cardboard boxes, and poster board

loans.name: Guandugloma (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Guandugloma está formado por 7 socias, quienes son mujeres luchadoras que a pesar de las adversidades miran la vida de una manera positiva, con sus trabajos mejoran y ayudan la economía familiar. Viven por la parroquia de Nabon en Cuenca lugar que se encuentra ubicado al sur-este de la provincia del Azuay, es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad, mantienen la gastronomía, cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Elsa, tiene 25 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 9 y 7 años de edad que estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Vive en la casa de su mamá compartiendo los gastos del hogar, la casa de su mamá es propia.

Doña Elsa se dedica al cuidado de su hogar y a la cría y venta de borregos, cuyes, ganado y gallinas, también trabaja en la agricultura en la siembra de hortalizas las que vende en su comunidad.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado.
 
Su meta es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The Guandugloma communal bank consists of 7 members. They are determined women who view life in a positive manner in spite of adversities. With their work, they are contributing to and improving their household economies. They live in the parish of Nabon, in Cuenca, located in the southeast of Azuay province. The climate there is cold, and the inhabitants work in agriculture, raise animals, or in many cases work in the city. They preserve the cuisine, culture and traditions of their indigenous peoples. 

One of the members of this group is Elsa. She is 25 years old and the single mother of 2 children, aged 9 and 7, who attend a small school in the city. She lives in her mother's house, sharing the household expenses. Her mother owns the house. 

Elsa dedicates herself to taking care of her home as well as raising and selling sheep, guinea pigs, chickens and livestock. She also works in agriculture, growing vegetables which she sells in her community. 

This is the first loan she is taking out within her communal bank, to which she was invited by a friend. She will invest the funds from the loan in buying livestock. 

Her goal is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Trinidad (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Trinidad está formado por 12 socias, quienes laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten mejorar su situación económica, se caracterizan por ser mujeres responsables, amables y carismáticas. Viven por los alrededores de la parroquia Turi en Cuenca, esta parroquia es denominada el mirador de la ciudad de Cuenca ya que desde este sector se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad, su gente se dedica a las artesanías, comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa Clementina, este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal.
 
Tiene 40 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 22 años de edad que estudia y trabaja. Su esposo labora en un taller de carpintería, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
Doña Rosa Clementina se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y como pasa la mayor parte del tiempo en su casa, cría  y vende cerdos y pollos. También se dedica a la agricultura, tiene un huerto de tomates.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ventanas para su casa.
 
Su meta es tener su propio negocio como un restaurante.
texts.en:
The communal bank Trinidad has 12 members who work in different areas which allows them to improve their financial situations. They are known to be trustworthy, friendly and charismatic. They live in the surrounding areas of the parish Turi in Cuenca. This parish is known as the lookout point for the city of Cuenca since from here you can admire a large part of the city. The people work in handicrafts, trade, breeding animals and agriculture, while maintaining the culture and traditions of their people.

One of the members of the group is Rosa Clementina. This is her second loan through the communal bank.

She is 40 years old, married and through her marriage she has a 22 year old son who is a student and also works. Her husband works in a carpenter shop, and they live in their own house.

Rosa Clementina works as a housewife and as she spends most of her time at home, she raises and sells pigs and chickens. Also she works in agriculture, having a tomato garden. 

The money from the loan is to be used to buy windows for her home. 

Her dream is to have her own business such as a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy windows for her house

loans.name: Letusia

texts.en:
Letusia is 57 years of age and is married with five children. She owns and operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business. Letusia needs a loan of WST $1,250 to purchase flour, sugar, baking powder and a new oven. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Letusia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Letusia's fifth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, baking powder and a new oven

loans.name: Johanna Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora. Jhoanna es socia del banco comunal Corazones de Turi, vive en una comunidad perteneciente a la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, lugar que es conocido como el mirador de la ciudad de Cuenca ya que desde este lugar se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y carismáticas.

Doña Jhoanna tiene 24 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 5 y 1 año de edad, su primera hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, no tiene casa propia y vive en casa de su mamá compartiendo los gastos del hogar.
 
Ella se dedica  a los quehaceres de su hogar y como pasa en casa cría y vende cuyes.
 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para la construcción de un local para poner una tienda.

Sus sueños son construir su casa y realizar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Jhoanna is a member of the communal bank Corazones de Turi ( Hearts of Turi ), she lives in a community pertaining to the Turi parish in Cuenca, a place known as the viewpoint for the city of Cuenca since from this point you can observe a large part of the city; its people are merchants, they raise livestock, they farm, and are characterized as being very charismatic and nice.  Jhoanna is 24 years old, married, and has 2 children from the marriage, one who is 5 and another who is 1 year old.  Her daughter goes to a small school in the city.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  She doesn't own a home so she lives with her mother sharing the household expenses.  Jhoanna focuses on household duties and since she stays at home she also raises and sells guinea pigs.  
This is her 4th loan with the communal bank and her current loan will be invested in the purchase of construction materials to be able to build and open a store.  
Her dreams are to build her own home and go to college.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Siulia

texts.en:
Siulia is 55 years of age and is married with five children. She owns and operates a business venture, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business. Siulia needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Siulia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Siulia's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Verónica Maribel

texts.es:
La Señora Verónica es socia del banco comunal Corazones de Turi, vive en una comunidad perteneciente a la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, lugar que es conocido como el mirador de la ciudad de Cuenca ya que desde este lugar se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y carismáticas.

La Señora Verónica tiene 21 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 3 años de edad. Su esposo es de profesión albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su suegra y comparten los gastos del hogar. 

Doña Verónica se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de su hijo, en casa cría animales como pollos, cuyes y cerdos.
 
Se encuentra en el cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos.

Su meta es realizar sus estudios Universitarios.
texts.en:
Verónica is a member of the "Corazones de Turi" ["Hearts of Turi"] communal bank. She lives in a community belonging to the parish of Turi in Cuenca. This place is known as the scenic overlook of the city of Cuenca, since from there one can observe most of the city. Its people work in trade, raise animals or work in agriculture. They are known for being friendly and charismatic people.

Verónica is 21 years old and married. With her husband she has a 3-year-old child. Her husband is a mason by profession. They do not have a house of their own, so they live in her mother-in-law's house and share the household expenses. 

Verónica dedicates herself to the household chores and caring for her child. She also raises animals at home, including chickens, pigs and guinea pigs. 
 
This will be her fourth loan with her communal bank, and she will invest it in buying chickens. 

Her goal is to study at the university.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Faalau

texts.en:
Faalau is is sixty years old and is married with six children. Faalau owns and operates a business venture, selling food products in the local community.  She has two years of experience in this business. Faalau needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Faalau joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Faalau's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Aida Edelmira

texts.es:
La Señora Aída es socia del banco comunal Corazones de Turi, vive en una comunidad perteneciente a la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, lugar que es conocido como el mirador de la ciudad de Cuenca ya que desde este lugar se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y carismáticas.

Doña. Aída tiene 38 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 22, 20, 17 y 12 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven independientes, su tercer hijo estudia en el colegio y su ultima hija estudia en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. Aída labora como empleada domestica, esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años y trabaja de lunes a viernes medio día. En su casa se dedica a la cría de animales como ganado, cuyes y pollos.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y materiales de construcción para construir un galpón para los pollos.
 
Su sueño es no tener deudas.
texts.en:
Aída is a member of the "Corazones de Turi" ["Hearts of Turi"] communal bank. She lives in a community belonging to the parish of Turi in Cuenca. This place is known as the scenic overlook of the city of Cuenca, since from there one can observe most of the city. Its people work in trade, raise animals or work in agriculture. They are known for being friendly and charismatic people.

Aída is 38 years old. She is married, and with her husband she has 4 children, aged 22, 20, 17 and 12. Her two oldest children are married and live independently. Her third child is in secondary school, and her youngest daughter goes to a small school in their community. Her husband works as a mason. They own the house where they live.

Aída works as a domestic employee. She has done this work for 5 years, working half a day from Monday through Friday. At home, she also raises animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and larger livestock. 

This will be her second loan, and she will invest it in buying chickens as well as construction materials to build a shed for her chickens. 
 
Her dream is to have no debt.

loans.use: to buy chickens and construction materials.

loans.name: Fia

texts.en:
Fia is forty-two years of age and is married with five children. Fia owns and operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  She has three years of experience in this business. Fia needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Fia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Fia's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
Maria Jesus  tiene 35 años de edad, ella vive en Ica, Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente.  En su tiempo libre Maria disfruta de jugar vóley;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Maria le agrada mucho es el “Arroz con Pato”, María estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar Secretariado Ejecutivo;  María es conviviente y su pareja trabaja como locutor de radio, ella nos dice que su pareja le habla como si estuviera en una radio cuando ella  está molesta y asi la hace reir. 

"Maria Jesus se dedica a la  venta de ceviche y chilcano, (el ceviche es un platillo a base de pescados de mariscos al cual se le añade el zumo de limón, se adereza con sal y aji amarillo o rocoto para darle picante y el chilcano es una sopa a base de la cocción de la cabeza del pescado, es un platillo riquísimo sobre todo porque es muy buena fuente de fosforo y vitaminas), se dedica a este trabajo 6 horas diarias,  Maria se animo a tener este negocio gracias a su pareja,  ya que el la animo mucho porque veía que había mucha acogida de parte de los pobladores de su barrio. En un día Maria puede atender 80 clientes de manera diaria, esto le permite ganar  hasta S/. 150 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar hasta S/. 250  lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales  y también para invertir en el negocio, ella cree que le va bien en el negocio porque tiene muy buena sazón en la preparación de los platillos y porque es muy ordenada en su negocio. Maria esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con el apoyo brindado ella podrá comprar mesas y sillas para su negocio ya que las que tiene no son suficientes para la cantidad de personas que ella atiende.

Esta mejora podrá ayudarle a esta mejora le permitirá que más clientes ingresen a su negocio ya que tendrá mas lugares para que ellos se sienten a disfrutar de sus platillos y así poder en algunos meses  lo que lo ayudará a cumplir su gran sueño: Tener un Restaurante."
texts.en:
34-year old Maria Jesus lives in Ica, Peru. The town is located in the Sechura desert, about four hours south of Lima, the capital of the country and is called the ‘Land of the Sun’ by Peruvians.  Ica is known for the frequency of earthquakes (one at 8.0 level occurred in 2007, and another at 6.9 in 2011), its grapes, asparagus, olives, and of course as the home of Peru’s national drink, pisco sour. 

Maria’s home and business are located in this warm and arid place. In her free time she enjoys playing volleyball. Peru is known for having the best food in the world, and one of the dishes that Maria loves is Arroz con Pato (rice with duck). She has five years of high school education and would have liked to go on to be an executive secretary. She lives with her partner who is a radio announcer. When she is upset, he talks to her as if he were on the radio and makes her laugh.

Maria earns her living selling ceviche and chilcano (ceviche is a seafood dish to which lemon juice, salt, and chili or rocoto pepper have been added to make it spicy; chilcano is a soup made from a fish head--it’s delicious as well as being a good source of phosphorus and vitamins). She works six hours a day and was encouraged in the business by her partner who saw that the local people really enjoyed her food. In one day Maria might serve 80 customers and earn S/. 150. On a good day she can earn up to S/. 250 which helps her pay for additional expenses and also invest in the business. She thinks that all is going well as she is such a good cook and because she is well organized. 

Maria is very grateful to Kiva donors as with the loan she will be able to buy tables and chairs for the business as she doesn’t have enough at the moment for all her customers. With this improvement she will be able to serve more people who come to enjoy her food. In turn, this extra income will help her to achieve her dream: in a few more months she hopes to open a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her business

loans.name: Johanna Yomayra

texts.es:
La Señorita. Johanna es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es una de las más importantes del país, es una mezcla de lo colonial y lo moderno,  su gente mantiene las tradiciones y cultura de sus padres.
 
La Señorita. Johanna tiene 25 años de edad, es soletera y está embarazada de 7 meses, vive en casa con sus padres, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Ella trabaja medio tiempo en un mini mercado de la ciudad, actividad que la realiza hace 2 años y trabaja de lunes a viernes, en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Yanbal, negocio en el que se encuentra hace 5 años.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos para aumentar su mercadería.
 
Su meta es  tener un negocio más grande de venta de cosméticos.
texts.en:
Johanna is a member of the Renacer Uncovia communal bank.  She lives in Cuenca, one of the most important cities of the country, a mix of colonial and modern.  There its people follow the traditions and culture of their forefathers.

Johanna is 25, single,and seven months pregnant.  She lives in her parents’ rented house since they don’t have their own home.

She has worked part-time in a mini market and for the past 5 years in her free time she has been selling Yanbal cosmetics.

The communal bank is in its second loan cycle and she will use the money to increase her merchandise.

Her goal is to have a bigger cosmetics sales business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Rubia Lastenia

texts.es:
La Señora. Rubia es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es una de las más importantes del país, es una mezcla de lo colonial y lo moderno,  su gente mantiene las tradiciones y cultura de sus padres. 

La Señora. Rubia tiene 45 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos  de 24, 20, 15, 7 y 5 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y la ayudan  económicamente, su tercer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Rubia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Yanbal y también vende todo tipo de ropa, actividad en la que se encuentra hace 5 años, sus productos los vende recorriendo la ciudad sin un horario fijo y de domingo a domingo.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa y cosméticos para aumentar su mercadería.

Su meta es tener un local propio para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Rubia is a member of the Renacer Uncovia communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, one of the most important cities in the country.  It is a mixture of the colonial and the modern.  Its people maintain the traditions and culture of their parents.

Rubia, age 45, is married and has five children; ages 24, 20, 15, 7, and 5.  Her first two children work and help her financially.  Her third child goes to high school, and the last two children go to a city school.  She does not have her own house; she rents where she lives.

Rubia sells Yanbal brand cosmetics.  She also sells all types of clothes.  She has been doing this for five years.  She sells her products by traveling through the city.  She works every day without a fixed schedule.

This is her second loan in her communal bank.  She will use it to buy clothes and cosmetics in order to increase her merchandise.

Her goal is to have her own place to sell her products.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis Enrique  tiene 21 años de edad, él vive en Parcona,Ica; Perú. Parcona se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente.  En su tiempo libre disfruta de escuchar música sobre todo porque lo relaja y le permite estar más tranquilo;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Luis Enrique  es el “Ceviche”, Luis solo estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria ya que sus padre no tenían los medios económicos suficientes.

Luis es conductor de mototaxi, realiza este  trabajo 10 horas diarias, sus hermanos lo animaron, ya que no habían muchas movilidades para el transporte en el barrio donde él vive y sobre todo porque es un joven s muy luchador y trabajador. En un día Luis atiende 50 clientes y esto le permite hasta  S/. 70 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar hasta S/.90  lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales para invertir en el negocio,  el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque hay mucha necesidad de movilidad y porque atiende con mucho respeto a las personas que moviliza.

Actualmente está muy agradecido con  prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda brindada podrá realizar un mantenimiento a su movilidad que es su herramienta de trabajo,esta mejora podrá ayudarle a que su vehículo este en perfecto estado y no sufra averías que puedan ocasionarle algún accidente y sus clientes se sientan más seguros utilizando su vehículo de transporte, con ello podrá tener más ingresos para ahorrar y poder cumplir  su gran sueño: “Tener una flota de Mototaxis."
texts.en:
Luis Enrique is 21 years old and lives in Parcona, Ica, Peru. Parcona is located in the Sechura Desert some 4 hours south of Lima, the national capital. It is acclaimed by Peruvians as “The Land of the Sun.” It is also known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.0 in 2007 and 6.9 in 2011), and its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps above all, as the source of the traditional Peruvian national drink, the Pisco Sour. In this hot and arid climate we find the house and enterprise of our client. In his free time he enjoys, especially, listening to music because it relaxes him and provides tranquility.  As is well known, Peru has the world's most delicious dishes and one of those plates Luis Enrique especially likes is “ceviche.” Luis studied only up to the 5th year of secondary school, because his parents lacked sufficient economic means. 

Luis drives a moto-taxi 10 hours a day. His brothers motivated him to do this because there is little transportation in the barrio where he lives and, above all, because he is young and very determined and a hard-worker. In a day, Luis attends to 50 customers and this gives him around 70 new sols daily. On a good day he can earn up to 90 new sols, which helps him cover some added costs and invest in his business.
