He feels that the business is going well because there is much need for transportation and because he treats his customers with much respect. 

He feels very grateful to the Kiva loaners, since with their offer of aid, he is able to maintain the vehicle which is his work tool. This improvement loan will enable him to restore his vehicle to perfect order and he won't suffer breakdowns that could cause an accident. And his customers will feel safer when utilizing his vehicle. He will earn more income and saving more, he will fulfill his grand dream: “Having a fleet of moto-taxis.”

loans.use: maintain his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Rosa Lidubina

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es una de las más importantes del país, es una mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno,  su gente mantiene las tradiciones y cultura de sus padres. 

Doña Rosa tiene 37 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 17 y 14 años de edad que  están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. Rosa labora en una panadería y trabaja de domingo a domingo en horarios rotativos, también tiene su negocio, ella vende ropa y esta actividad la desempeña hace 2 años, vende su mercadería recorriendo la ciudad sin un horario fijo.

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en ropa para surtir su mercadería.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is a member of the communal bank Renacer Uncovia. She lives in the city of Cuenca. This city is one of the most important in the country. It is a mix of the colonial and the modern, and its people maintain the traditions and culture of their ancestors.

Doña Rosa is 37 years old. She is the single mother of two children, ages 17 and 14, who are students at a city secondary school. She does not have her own house, so she rents.

Señora Rosa works in a bakery. She works every day with rotating hours. She also has her own business: she sells clothing, a business that she began two years ago. She sells her merchandise throughout the city without a fixed schedule.

She has been a member of the communal bank for a year, and she will invest her new loan in clothing to increase her supply of merchandise.

Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Talalelei

texts.en:
Talalelei is forty-six years old and is married with nine children.  She owns and operates a business venture, providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members.  She has five years of experience in this business. Talalelei needs a loan of WST 2,500 to purchase additional fabrics and materials.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Talalelei joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Talalelei's 4th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabric and materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Melati Group

texts.en:
This is the fourth loan for the Melati group. Two of the members couldn’t attend the meeting because they had to attend a ceremony at the temple. 

The group is taking out a new loan to continue their businesses. Although in the last period their pigs were attacked by diseases, they still keep their spirit to run this business. They hope this period will be better. The vet suggested how to give more nutritious feed and vitamins. 

Ni Ketut will use the loan to purchase two superior piglets. She hopes she can earn more profit this time and  will use all of it to support her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase two superior piglets.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is thirty-seven years old and is married with ten children.

Telesia owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting peanuts for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Telesia  needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Telesia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Telesia's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Leataosina

texts.en:
Leataosina is forty-four years of age and is married with two children.

Leataosina owns and operates a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  She has four years of experience in this business.  Leataosina needs a loan of WST 2500 to purchase new items to expand her product offering.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to further improve/expand the business.

Leataosina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Leataosina's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items in order to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Adiccion Group

texts.es:
Sandra, es mujer y madre, de quien dependen dos hijos. Ella pensando en su familia y en la forma en que podía apoyar en la economía de su hogar y con ello dar una mejor calidad de vida a los suyos, decidió poner un stand de comida afuera de su domicilio. Esta idea nació a partir de que sus amigas y vecinas le comentaban en fiestas y reuniones que tenía un rico sazón. Estos comentarios la impulsaron a emprender su negocio. Al principio, tenia incertidumbre de  funcionar y más por la competencia, pero poco a poco ha crecido su clientela.
Ahora ella pide un crédito para poder devolver el tanque de gas que le prestaron para echar andar el negocio y reparar la parilla con la que inicio.
Ella ha puesto toda su voluntad y esperanzas en este negocio pues desea ofrecer a sus hijos un mejor presente.
texts.en:
Sandra is a woman and a mother, with two children who depend on her. Thinking of her family, and how she could support her household finances, and so provide a better quality of life to her family members, she decided to set up a food stand outside her home.

This idea originated from her friends and neighbors commenting at parties and gatherings that her food had a delicious flavor. These comments motivated her to launch her business.

In the beginning, she had doubts about it working, and more because of the competition, but little by little, her clientele has grown. Now she is asking for a loan to be able to return the gas tank that was lent to her to get the business going, and to repair the grill that she started with. 

She has put all of her will and her hopes into this business, as she wishes to offer her children a better present.

loans.use: To buy a new tank of gas, and repair her current grill.

loans.name: Galu

texts.en:
Galu is twenty-nine years of age and is married with three children.

Galu is starting a business venture selling ice cream in the local community.  Galu needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase a new refrigerator and ice cream.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Galu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Galu's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase a new refrigerator and ice cream

loans.name: Fiaavae

texts.en:
Fiaavae is twenty-seven years old and is married with two children.  She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has two years of experience in this business.  Fiaavae needs a loan of WST 1500 to purchase wheelbarrow,spade,bushknives and gromozones. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to further improve/expand the business.

Fiaavae joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Fiaavae's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase wheelbarrow,spade,bushknives and gromozones.

loans.name: Faamaini

texts.en:
Faamaini is twenty-four years of age and is married with one child.

Faamaini owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has two years of experience in this business.    Faamaini needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional tools and chemicals.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Faamaini joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Faamaini's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and chemicals.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is twenty-six years of age and is married with three children.

Lina owns & operates a business venture, selling fabric handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  She has one year of experience in this business.    Lina needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase materials ,painting,craft board for elei printing.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Lina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Lina's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase materials, painting, craft board for elei printing

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is thirty-four years of age and is married with three children.

Anita owns & operates a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business.    Anita needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional goods to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Anita joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Anita's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Luatimu

texts.en:
Luatimu is thirty three years of age and is married with two children. Luatimu owns and operates a business venture, where she plants and harvests fruits and vegetables for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business. Luatimu needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase equipment and chemicals.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Luatimu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Luatimu's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and chemicals.

loans.name: Toilalo

texts.en:
Toilalo is thirty one years of age and is married with four children. Toilalo owns and operates a business venture raising fish for sale. She has two years of experience in this business. Toilalo needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase a new canoe,fishing net and spears.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Toilalo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Toilalo's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase a new canoe, fishing net and spears

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is forty three years of age and is married with six children. Rosa owns and operates a business venture baking and selling specialty goods and delicacies in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business. Rosa needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase an oven and other related equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Rosa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Rosa's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase an oven and other related equipment.

loans.name: Tutulu

texts.en:
Tutulu is eighteen years of age and is married with one child. Tutulu owns and operates a business venture selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business. Tutulu needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase soft drinks, snacks, bag of rice,sugar,salt , cookies , ctn of fish herring.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Tutulu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Tutulu's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, snacks, bag of rice,sugar,salt , cookies and ctn of herring

loans.name: Po

texts.en:
Mrs. Po, 22, lives in Takhmao town with her husband and young kid. She has worked in the farming business for many years. She typically grows rice and some kinds of vegetable crops, from which she is able to generate approximately $4.00 per day. Her husband always helps her manage the business. 

Mrs Po is taking out her second loan of KHR 2,000,000 from HKL to purchase vegetables and rice seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to put on her farmland. In the future, Mrs. Po wants to improve her business and expand to additional farmland for a higher rate of output.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and rice seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Merelini

texts.en:
Merelini is forty five years of age and is married with ten children. Merelini owns & operates a business venture, selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community.  She has 4 years of experience in this business. Merelini needs a loan of WST 2,700 to purchase new items to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Merelini joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Merelini's 4th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items to sell

loans.name: Lopeta

texts.en:
Lopeta is sixty years old and is married with ten children. Lopeta owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  She has 4 years of experience in this business. Lopeta needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase weed killer chemicals.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Lopeta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Lopeta's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killer chemicals

loans.name: Siem

texts.en:
Siem, age 47, lives in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is a widow with four sons and five daughters. Three are married and live in separate homes, two are construction workers, one is a garment worker, one assists his mother in the business and the other two attend school.  

Siem is a farmer, she grows vegetables on her farmland in the village where she lives. She is applying for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm and pay for plowing fees. 

Photo: Siem and her son.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm and pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally, age 21, is single. He lives with his parents in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Phally is a farmer who grows cucumbers, beans and cauliflower. He is a asking for his first loan in the amount of $500 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

Photo: Phally is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Sophorn (pictured here), age 33, is single. She lives with her widowed mother and sister on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 
Sophorn is a garment worker. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle to get to work because she drives a bicycle to work every day. Taking a bicycle is tiring and takes lots of time.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to get to work.

loans.name: Sharshenbek

texts.ru: Шаршенбеку 44 года,  воспитывает двоих детей. Шаршенбек работает электриком в своем селе. Три года назад, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, Шаршенбек начал свой бизнес в разведении скота и реализации сельхозпродукции на местном рынке.  Начав со стартовой суммой в 30,000 сом (KGS), он сумел развить хозяйство, насчитывающее семь баранов и одну лошадь, а также он возделывает землю в 1,90 га  с картофелем, фасолью и многолетними травами.  В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Шаршенбек обратился в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита он планирует направить на постройку дополнительного сарая для скота.
texts.en: Sharshenbek is 44 years, he has two children. Sharshenbek an electrician in his village. Three years ago, in search of an additional source of income for his family, Sharshenbek began his business in livestock breeding and sale of agricultural products in the local market. Beginning with the starting amount of 30,000 soms (KGS), he has managed to develop a farm which has seven sheep and one horse and he cultivated the land of 1.90 hectares with potatoes, beans and perennial grasses. In order to further expand his business Sharshenbek has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 40,000 soms (KGS) to buy livestock. He plans to use the proceeds from the loan in construction of an additional shed for the livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Firuzamo

texts.ru: Фирузамо проживает в районе Вахш. Она замужем. Ей 29 лет. У  нее двое детей. Фирузамо занимается скотоводством. Она откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа коровы и бычков.
texts.en: Firuzamo lives in the Vakhsh district.  She is 29 years old, married and has two children.  Firuzamo is involved in animal husbandry.  She fattens up and sells livestock.  She is requesting this loan to purchase a cow and bulls.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and bulls

loans.name: Josphat Mwanzi

texts.en: Josphat, 25 years old, is a single young man. He has no children yet. He describes himself as a social and friendly man. He has been providing transportation services within a viable busy market for the last year. In addition, Josphat sells green grams (a type of legume) to add to his source of income. His business challenge is the high price of fuel. He will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy another motorbike. In the future, Josphat hopes and dreams of expanding his services and employing more people in this business.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Orifjon

texts.ru: Орифчон у себя дома занимается торговлей сухофруктов. В этой области он десять лет. Орифчон женат. Ему 36 лет. У него шестеро детей. Орифчон берет кредит для покупки сухофруктов.
texts.en: Orifjon is involved in selling dried fruits at home.  He has been in this business for ten years.  Orifjon is 36 years old, married and has six children.  Orifjon is requesting this loan to purchase dried fruits.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Denis

texts.en: Denis, 25 years old, is a single young man. He has no children yet. He describes himself as a social and talkative man. For the last two years, Denis has been selling cabbages in a busy market. His customers are hotels and residents. His business challenge is the high cost of transportation when buying the cabbages. He will be using the loan of KES 20,000 to buy more cabbages. In the future, he sees himself as a wholesaler and distributor of the cabbages. Denis also hopes to have a happy family.

loans.use: To buy more cabbages.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick, 25 years old, is a single young man. He describes himself as a quiet man. He has been selling goats for the last three years. In addition, he runs a retail shop to add to his source of income. He faces the challenge of insufficient funds to improve his business. Patrick plans to use the loan of KES 20,000 to expand his business by buying more goats. In the future, Patrick's dream is to venture into a butcher shop. He also plans in the next five years, to go back to school.

loans.use: To buy more goats.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 45 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. She has had a business selling spare parts in Yei, South Sudan for three years.

Charity is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase wheels and tires. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase wheels and tires to sell

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Mrs. Ros, age 39, is a humble farmer who has been living in Prey Chor, Kompong Cham province. She has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years. Her husband shares responsibility for his family by providing motor taxi service to the people around the province. Ros has been blessed with three single children who are attending school. At the present, Ros’ house is under construction. She will use the loan given to her to pay for labor costs to perform the construction. In the future, Ros hopes to encourage her children until they finish high school.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs on her house

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 28-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had a salon in Yei, South Sudan for five years. Grace is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase weaves, gel and hair lotions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase weaves, gel and hair lotions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens and ducks

loans.name: Kaku

texts.en:
Kaku is 23 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She has had a business selling food at a stall in Yei, South Sudan for two years.

Kaku is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 26 year old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for three years.

Christina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 48 years old and married to Benson. They have two children. She has been in the mixed crop farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 5,600, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET Ltd after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Susan will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her family. Her hope and dream is to venture into raising pigs.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Callistus

texts.en: Callistus, 27 years old, is married and has five children ranging from three to six years old. He describes himself as an intelligent and disciplined man. For the last two years, he has been running a retail shop and sells products such as sugar, cooking oil, tea leaves, flour etc. In addition, he also sells timber to add to his source of income. His business challenge is transportation of the goods when buying. He will use the loan of KES 20,000 to purchase more products such as flour, salt, sugar etc. In the future, Callistus' hope and dream is to run a bigger shop.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Celina

texts.en: Celina is 35 years old with no children. She has had a business selling food in a hotel (restaurant) in Yei, South Sudan for five years. Celina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina is 35 years old and married. She has four children and two of them are in school. 

She has had a business of selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan, for five years.

Edina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Tobico

texts.en:
Tobico is 59 years old, married to Nina and they have six children.  He has been in the business of buying and selling goats and sheep for the last ten years, from which he earns a monthly income of KES 25,000.

He is applying for his third loan with KADET Ltd for KES 50,000, which he will use to buy more goats and sheep. With the anticipated profits he plans to save for the future expansion of his business. 

He hopes to expand his goat and sheep selling business to include the distribution of goat and sheep meat.

loans.use: to buy more goats and sheep to sell on.

loans.name: Rasoha

texts.en:
Rasoha 70 years old, is married and has five children ranging from seventeen to thirty years. She describes herself as a persistent woman. 

For the last four years, she has been selling clothes to the neighbours in her home area.  In addition, Rasoha does faming and sells kales and peas to increase her income.  She describes her business challenge to be the high price of clothes. 

She will use the loan of KES 10,000 to buy more clothes.  In the future, Rosaha hopes and dreams to run several clothes stores.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 30 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business selling food items in Yei, South Sudan for three years. Jane is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and beer. She will use her extra income from this loam to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and beer to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock for his shop.

loans.name: Lona

texts.en: Lona is 36 years old and married with four children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for three years. Lona is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 28 years old and single. He has been running a beauty salon business preparing peoples hair, selling hair products and hair extensions for the last four years, from which he earns a monthly income of KES 15,000.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET Ltd of KES 30,000.  He plans to use the funds to buy more stocks of cosmetics weave shampoos and hair extensions.  He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer.  With the anticipated profits he plans to buy further salon equipment.

His hopes and dreams are to grow his business and open up another hair salon in a different locality

loans.use: to buy hair products, extensions, shampoo and oil for use and sale in his salon.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en: Silvia is 35 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for five years. Silvia is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en:
Bonface is 28 years old.  He makes and sells wood carvings in Malindi.  He has been in the business for the last two years, with a monthly income of KES 25,000. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer and he is applying for his first loan with KADET Ltd of KES 30,000.  He intends to buy additional stocks of wood for his business. Bonface will save the anticipated profit and help take care of himself as he grows his business.
 
In the future he hopes to continue growing his business and also venture into other investments.

loans.use: to buy wood  for his business.

loans.name: Phylis

texts.en:
Phylis is 30 years old and single, supporting six children of the following ages thirteen, nine, six, five, three and two years.  She runs a grocery shop and she has been in business for two years, earning a monthly income of KES 6,500.

She is requesting her first loan with KADET Ltd of KES 20,000.  She will use the funds to buy stocks of bananas, kales, carrots and potatoes.  She plans to expand her business with the anticipated profit from the business.

Her hopes and dreams are to grow her business and to ensure that her family is stable.

loans.use: to add stock to the business.

loans.name: Aliyah

texts.en:
Aliyah is a 43-year-old married woman, mother of three beautiful boys, who represent her whole life.

Aliyah is a hardworking woman, 21 years ago she started her small business. She is a skilled tailor and well known in the region.

To start a business was a bit hard for her because she wanted to keep taking good care of her children but the family's needs forced her to do both.
Aliyah didn't regret this step at all, and she is very proud of herself since her fears weren't true and she was capable of managing both her business and being a special mother.

Aliyah has been a Al Majmoua (Kiva partner) borrower for two cycles, her previous cycle helped to support her family's needs a lot. 

Today Aliyah is requesting a loan, in order to buy a new, updated sewing machine, necessary to update her business and to provide her customers good quality in a short period of time.

Aliyah hopes to open a special clothes factory in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new, updated sewing machine.

loans.name: Davis

texts.en:
Davis is 38 years old, married and a father of three children.  He has been in the carpentry business for the last ten years, with a monthly profit of KES 15,000. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer and he is now applying for his third loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd, which he will use to buy tools such as a jigsaw, G-clamps, tenon saws and wood drills for his business.  He will save the anticipated profit and use it to help pay the school fees for his children. 

In the future, Davies hopes to grow his business into a large, fully automated workshop and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase working tools for his workshop.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 49 years old and married to Joseph.  They are blessed with two children.  She has been in the farming business for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  She will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.  With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to open a big retail shop to supply fertilizer in her locality.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Dishon

texts.en:
Dishon, a 50-year-old man, is married and has two children.  He desribes himself as a focused man.  For the last five years, he has been selling firewood to his neighbours and to new customers.  He also practices farming, where he sells milk to add to his income.  His business challenge is the policies posed by the goverment to not cut trees which results in a shortage of access to firewood.  

He will use the loan of KES 10,000 to buy more trees for firewood.  In the future, Dishon hopes to have had diversified his business.  His long term goal is to venture into another business, running a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy more trees for firewood.

loans.name: Karisa

texts.en:
Karisa is 43 years old, married, and the father of five children. He is in the motorcycle transport business and has been in it for the last three years earning a monthly profit of about Kes 15,000. 

He is applying for his first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 30,000 which he will partly use to service his motorcycle, as well as also to buy some goats so that he could practice livestock farming. He will save the anticipated profit to help take care of his children.

 In future, the client hopes to grow his businesses and be financially stable.

loans.use: To service his motorcycle and open a new business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is 33 years old, married to a beautician, and they have two children ages four and thirteen years. She describes herself as a courageous and wise woman. She has been running her beauty salon for the last one and one half years. She provides services such as plaiting, blow drying, etc. She also sells hair oils, braids, beauty cream, lotions, shampoos, clips, earrings, cutex etc. Her business challenge is irregular customers. 

She will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more beauty products such as braids, lotions and earrings.  Madina hopes and dreams to be a successful businesswoman by running several beauty salons in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy beauty products such as braids, lotions, earrings, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 30 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for six years. Joyce is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah, 43 years old, is married and has five children ranging from ten to seventeen years.  She describes herself as a self-motivated and aggresive woman.  She has been running a retail shop and has sold items such as sugar, salt, flour, soap for the last two years.  In addition, she also does farming to add her source of income.  

Her business challenge is the transportation of her products when buying them.  She will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy one bag of sugar and a bundle of flour.  In the future, Leah's goal is to run a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy one bag of sugar and a bundle of flour.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is 31 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for five years. Charity is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Tserendavaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Tserendavaa, 38, runs a cafe in the suburban district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She opened her cafe in 2004 and already has her permanent customers who are well satisfied with the quality of her service. Tserendavaa is unmarried and lives with her two daughters in the ger district, a Mongolian traditional nomadic yurt district.
 
She always tries to expand her business with the income from her business. This time she decided to open two karaoke rooms beside her café shop. It is a very beneficial kind of business in the current Mongolian market conditions. At first, she needs to purchase the necessary equipment for the  karaoke rooms. She will buy it from the certified distributor in Mongolia according her plan. The loan she is taking will be to purchase the necessary karaoke room equipment for starting multiple businesses.

loans.use: To purchase karaoke room equipment

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 57 years old, married to Esther and blessed with three children aged 36, 33 and 14 years old.  He operates a business at Bonjoge trading centre, Rift valley, which has been in operation for the last two years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

He is requesting his first loan with KADET Ltd of KES 30,000.  He will use this amount to purchase more stock of wheat and maize flour, rice, sugar and cooking oil for his business.  The profits will be used to repay back the loan and for the family upkeep.

His hopes and dreams are to grow his business and educate his children to greater heights.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Tulgach

texts.en:
Mr. Tulgach is 60 years old and lives with his wife and his daughter. He has been working as a watchman in the kindergarten since he was pensioned; before, he was a military man. His daughter, Davaasuren, works as a seller in a grocery store and earns not very much.

Next February she will be married and will be moving out of her parents' home. Her father, Tulgach, wants to prepare their daughter’s abode as a wedding gift, but he needs 1,450 USD to purchase the complete ger from the market. A ger is the Mongolian national nomadic tent and it is one of the most respectful present for Mongolians. The loan he is taking will be used to cover the cost of a complete ger set.

loans.use: to cover the cost of a complete ger set

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 45-year-old married woman with seven children who are all in school. She has had a business of selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan for three years.

Mary is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale

loans.name: Ariuntsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Ariuntsetseg, 44, sells dairy products in a market. She is widowed and lives with her son and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling dairy products for 17 years and owns a stall in market.

Her monthly income often does not meet her family's necessities because both of her children study at the college and university. Their school fees are paid by herself and the costs very high, so Ariuntsetseg decided to increase her income by expanding her sales volume. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchasing the dairy products from her permanent suppliers.

loans.use: to purchase dairy products from her permanent suppliers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 49-year-old divorced woman, who spent 22 years of her life working and raising her own child alone, with no-one's help.  Souad also takes care of her old mother, so she had to work hard to cover her house's family expenses from her business, that's why she put all her effort in doing so; to provide the best education and living for her child and her mother.

Souad has a clothing sales shop, her prices are affordable to anyone in her region.  She offers different qualities with different styles that fit anyone visiting her shop.

Souad has requested a loan from KIVA partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her business capital with a specially released new collection with special attractive prices.

Souad aims to open another branch in the future, to expand her trade.

loans.use: to increase her business capital with a newly released clothes collection.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Boldbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Boldbaatar, 40, makes Mongolian national musical instruments such as horse-head fiddles. A horse-head fiddle is one of the Mongolian national respectful musical instruments and there are just a few carpenters who make it correctly in Mongolia. Boldbaatar is one of them. He sells his products to the supermarkets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running his business for 21 years and already has his own permanent customers. He lives with his wife and his two sons. His two sons also have been studying carpentry skills.
  
Boldbaatar wants to increase his working capital to purchase wooden material and some other materials needed to make more products because he is planning to sell a large numbers of horse-head fiddles to his customers. It is beneficial for his business future and its expansion. The loan he is taking will be used to purchase the raw materials for carpentry.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for carpentry

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia is 29 year old and married with one child who is in school. She has had a business selling chickens in Yei, South Sudan for two years. Cicilia is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase chickens. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase chickens

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 29 years old, a single mother of one child aged two years.  She has been selling tomatoes for the past year with a monthly income of KES 6,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  She will use the loan to buy tomatoes, kales and onions for her business.  With the anticipated profit from the business she will add different fruits. 

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her child up to university level and open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, kales and onions for her business.

loans.name: Batbileg

texts.en: Batbileg wants to assist his younger brother to pay his school fee. His younger brother Erdenbaatar studies as a human resource manager in Mongolian State University of Education. Erdenebaatar has a plan to establish his own human-resource agency which is a professional job. He needs to graduate from school successfully first. It is one of his biggest wishes and plans of life he said. Therefore, his good brother Batbileg is taking a loan to assist his younger brother in paying his school fees so he can successfully graduate.

loans.use: to assist his younger brother in paying his school fees

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 30 years old and is married to Alice.  They are blessed with one child.  He has been running a boutique for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 16,000.

He is applying for his first loan of KES 30,000 with KADET Ltd after being introduced by an existing customer.  He will use the loan to buy stocks of new clothes for his business.  With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his child. 

His hopes and dreams are to expand his business and open a retail shop for his wife, which will help him improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for his business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 42-year-old married woman with three children, two of them are in school.  She has had a business selling tea in Yei, South Sudan for three year.

Betty is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and coffee to sell.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: buy sugar and coffee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Besta

texts.en:
Besta is a 28-year-old married woman with three children two of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food at a stall in Yei, South Sudan for two years.
Besta is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase cassava and maize. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase cassava and maize for sale.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 62 years old, married to Loise and they have five children.  He has been in the hotel business selling cooked food; chips, ugali and tea to his clients for the last two years from which he earns a monthly income of KES 18,000.

He is applying for his first loan of KES 20,000.  He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer.  He plans to use the funds to purchase food stuffs such as wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, cooking oil and sugar for the hotel.  With the anticipated profits he will repay the loan.

He hopes are to grow his business and open another branch and improve the family welfare.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for sale: bags of potatoes, sugar, onions and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix her house and cover the ground with concrete.

loans.name: Mori

texts.en:
Mori is a 40-year-old, married woman with four children, two of whom are in school.  She has had a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for two years.

Mori is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 33 years old, married to Patrick and they are blessed with one child.  She has been selling fruits for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her third loan of KES 50,000 with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully.  Esther will use the loan to buy a stock of fresh fruits for her business. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. 

Her hopes and dreams are to start a green grocery store, which will help her improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of fresh fruits for her business.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is 37 years old, married to Joseph and blessed with four children.  She operates a charcoal retail business in Kapsabet town, which has been in operation for a period of ten years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

She is requesting her first loan loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd.   She will use this amount to purchase more bags of charcoal for resale.  The profits will be used to pay the school fees for her children and also improve the stock of her business. 

Her dream is to prosper in business and educate her children to greater levels.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Jenty

texts.en:
Jenty is a 30-year-old, married woman with four children two of whom are in school.  She has had a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for two years.

Jenty is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 27 years old, married and blessed with one child.  Jackline sells clothes in Kapsabet town and has been in operation for a period of 4 years, earning a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

She is requesting her third loan from KADET Ltd. of 40,000 KES.  She plans to use the funds to purchase more clothing for resale. With the anticipated profits, she will pay back the loan and support her family.

Her dream is to open a large clothing boutique and have a successful, happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for resale

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 64 years old, married to Sarah and they support one person within the family. He has been in the business of rearing dairy cows for milk production for sale for the last 10 years, from which he earns a monthly income of 18,000 KES.

He is applying for his fifth loan of 80,000 KES. He repaid his previous loan well and in good time. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer. He plans to use the funds to buy an additional dairy cow. With the anticipated profits, he will improve the cow sheds and his family's welfare.

He hopes to increase the milk output to become the leading producer in his locality and uplift the family living standards.

loans.use: to buy an additional dairy cow for rearing

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a 40-year-old, married woman with three children, two of whom are in school.  She has had a business selling food in Yei, South Sudan for four years.

Loice is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase cabbages and rice.  She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase cabbages and rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 35-year-old married woman with two children, all of whom are in school.  She has had a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for five years.

Esther is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 48-year-old married woman and mother of three children.

18 years ago, Ghada opened her business specializing in selling souvenirs for special occasions, in addition to decorating special occasions chocolates, too. Ghada does so many handmade crafts and designs. She is talented in her domain and works hard on improving herself. Ghada helps her husband in making their living. He works polishing floor tiles and his business isn't good these days.

Ghada is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to start early Valentine's Day preparations. She will increase her business capital with special Valentine's Day souvenirs and gifts. Ghada is a smart woman; she captures the best moments and occasions. She aims to expand her business and gain her customers' loyalty.

loans.use: to increase her business capital with special valentine's day souvenirs and gifts

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 56 years old married to Lucy and they have five children.  He has been in the housing business building semi-permanent rental houses for the last ten years, from which he earns a monthly income of KES 15,000.

He is applying for his first loan of KES 19,000 with KADET Ltd.  He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer.  He will use the funds to renovate the rental houses.  With the anticipated profits he will save to build more houses.

He hopes and dreams are build permanent rental houses in prime areas of his locality and to educate his children.

loans.use: to renovate his rental houses for his tenants.

loans.name: Koem

texts.en:
Mr. Koem, 64, and his wife, 62, are in the same business of cultivating rice crops from Takhmao. From the business, they typically earn in the neighborhood of $5.00 per day. On the day the photo was taken, Koem was not available so his wife appears alone in her yard. This couple has been blessed with 5 children, four of whom are already married and live independently. 

Mr. Koem would like to take out a loan from Kiva, through HKL, to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to put in his farmland. In the future, Koem plans to expand his farming business and grows additional rice crops.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to put in his farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy packaging materials

loans.name: Mamadou Khaly

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Mamadou  Khaly est un jeune chauffeur âgé de 31 ans .Il est marié et père de deux enfants .IL fait du transport depuis douze ans.
Avec le crédit il envisage  de faire quelques travaux de construction chez lui.
Il gère sa petite famille et satisfait leurs besoins quotidiens. Dans  l’ avenir  il veut devenir  un grand transporteur.
texts.en:
Mamadou Khaly is a 31-year-old driver. He is married and has 2 children. He's been a driver for 12 years.
With this loan, he plans on doing some construction work at home.
He takes care of his family and meets their daily needs. In the future he would like to become a major carrier.

loans.use: to do some construction work at home.

loans.name: Fawziye

texts.en:
Fawziye is a 59-year-old married woman, the mother of five children. She has been working as a tailor from home for 31 years. 

Fawziye is good at her work and well known in her area. She lives in a populous neighborhood. She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to support her new business with a special range of clothing. She is selling used clothes and needs a small capital to improve that business.

Fawziye will also help her son and buy him a bedroom for his new house.

The new machine that she bought with the previous loan helped a lot in improving her business. Fawziye is still hoping to open a shop in the future and expand her business more.

loans.use: To support her new business with a special range of used clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more  maize to sell.

loans.name: C8033 Twiterinkunga Group

texts.en:
Francais is 51 years old and is married with six children between the ages of 10 and 24 years old. His business is well organized. He sells rice, sugar, soap and salt. He works from 6am until 5pm every day. Francais is team leader of this group called "C8033 Twiterinkunga". He is the first person on the right side of this picture.

Francais has requested a loan from the Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more rice, sugar, soap and salt to sell. With this profit, he will be able to buy more food for his family and reinvest it in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, sugar, soap and salt to sell.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice, 52 years old, is married to a retired teacher and they have six children ranging from twenty-five to thirty-five years of age. She describes herself as a talkative and social woman. She has been running a retail shop for the last four years. She also increases her income by working at a hospital as a nurse. Her business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more wheat flour. In the next five years, Joice's hope and plan is to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more wood to carve and sell to clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables and wheat flour for hotel use.

loans.name: Namunyar

texts.en:
Namunyar is 34-years-old, married to Korono and they have ten children. She has been in the business of buying and selling cows and goats for the last 13 years from which she earns a monthly income of Kes 51,500.

She is applying for a loan with KADET ltd of Kes 100,000 She will use the funds to purchase more cows, goats and sheep for selling. She paid the previous loan well and in good time. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. With the anticipated profits she will repay the loan

She hopes to expand her livestock selling business and include farming in future.

loans.use: to buy more cows and goats for sale.

loans.name: C5687 Abisunganye Group

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 28 years old and is single. His business is well organized. He sells sugar, soap, bananas, salt, sorghum, beans, maize in the market and he works from 6am until 10pm every day. Jean Baptiste employes two people to help him.

Jean Baptiste has requested a loan from a Kiva lender in order to purchase more quantities of rice, soap, salt, sorghum, beans, maize to sell. With this profit, Jean Baptiste will be able to buy more quantities of food for his family and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, sugar, soap, bananas, salt, etc to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 49-years-old, married to Simon and they are blessed with three children. She has been in the dairy farming business for the past ten years with the monthly income of Kes 8,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Lucia will use the loan to buy animal feeds. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to venture into bee keeping.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for  her dairy cow.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 52-years-old, married to Jane and they are blessed with two children. He has been rearing beef cows for slaughter in his butchery for the past three years earning a monthly income of Kes 15,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his third loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Paul will use the loan to restock beef cows for  for his butchery business. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children.

 His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop which will increase his income.

loans.use: to buy stocks of beef cows for his butchery business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 35 years old, married to Maurine, and they have three dependents. He has done brick-making as a business for the last three years, earning a monthly income of Kes 10,000.

He is requesting his first loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 20,000 which he plans to use in making bricks. With the anticipated profit from the business he will repay the loan. 

His hopes and dreams are to expand his business and include making ballast.

loans.use: To make more bricks.

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney is 53 years old and is married with four children between the ages of 13 and 21 years old. He sells cabbages. His business is well organized. He starts from 5am until 8pm every day and he employs four people to help him.

Jean Marie Vianney has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to increase his business by buying more quantities of cabbage to sell. With the profit from the loan, Jean Marie Vianney will be able to buy more quantities of onion and cabbages.

loans.use: To purchase more quantities of cabbage to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is married and has two daughters aged six months and three years. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. She runs a beauty salon and provides services of plaiting, blow-drying and applying chemicals. In addition, she sells cosmetics and hair oils. Her business challenge is the high prices of cosmetics. She will be using the loan of Kes 20,000 to purchase more beauty products. In the next five years, Catherine hopes to run a cosmetics retail shop.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 28 years old, married to Patrick and they have three children.  She has been operating a grocery store selling onions, tomatoes and cabbages for the last year, from which she earns a monthly income of KES 21,000.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET Ltd of KES 8,000.  She will use the loans to buy stocks of onions bananas, tomatoes and cabbages.  She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer.

She hopes to open another grocery kiosk and to provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, mangoes, onions, tomatoes and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Cate

texts.en:
Cate is 41-years-old, married to Nicholas and they have three children. She has been in the business of selling second-hand clothes to her customers for the last 10 years from which she earns a monthly income of Kes 10,000.

She is applying for her third loan with KADET ltd of Kes 50,000. She will use the funds to buy more stock of second-hand clothes. She paid the previous loans well and in good time. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. With the anticipated profits she will educate her children

Her hopes are educate her children and buy a plot for putting up a permanent family house in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 28-years-old and a single mother of one child. She is also supporting five people in the family. She has been in the business of selling clothing materials to her clients for the last 11 years from which she earns a monthly income of Kes 7,200.

She is applying for her first loan of Kes 15,000. She will use the funds to buy more second-hand clothes for sale. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. With the anticipated profits she will pay for school fees for her child.

Her hopes are to pay for her child's school fees and provide for the family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials and shoes for sale.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 48-years-old who is a single man supporting two people in his family. He has been in the transportation business offering transport services to his clients for the last 5 years from which he earns a monthly income of Kes 25,000.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 50,000. He will use the loan to combine with his savings to buy another transport vehicle. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. With the anticipated profits he will repay the loan.

He hopes to use the profits to buy more vehicles to offer transport services to his customers.

loans.use: to buy another transport vehicle for use.

loans.name: Virginiah

texts.en:
Virginiah is 35-years-old, married to Antony and they have four children. She has been in the business of selling charcoal to her clients for the last 8 years from which she earns a monthly income of Kes 40,000.

She is applying for her sixth loan with KADET ltd of Kes 10,000. She will use the loan to buy stocks of charcoal. She paid the previous loan well and in good time. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. With the anticipated profits she will save for the expansion of her business.

Her hopes are to educate her children and expand her business to sell cooking gas.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: C9271 Abafiturukundo Group

texts.en:
Samuel is 48 years old and is a widow with four children between the ages of 10 and 21 years old. He sells vegetables and fruits and his business is open from 6am until 5pm every day. He currently employs one person to help him. He is the leader of the group which is called "C9271 Abafiturukundo" in the local language. He is the first person on the left side of the picture. Samuel has three years of experience. 

Samuel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a large quantity of vegetables and fruits to sell. With this profit, he will be able to reinvest it in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 33 years old, married to Jacinta and they have two children.  He has been operating a curio shop selling soapstone carvings from Kisii for the last two years, from which he earns a monthly income of KES 16,000.

He is applying for his second loan with KADET Ltd of KES 40,000.  He will use the funds to buy more soap stone carvings for sale.  He paid his previous loan back well and in good time.  He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer.  With anticipated profits he will educate his children.

His hopes are to expand his business and open up another curio shop outlet.

loans.use: to buy soapstone carvings from Kisii for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soapstone carvings from Kisii for sale.

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Peter is 40 years old and is married with six children between the ages of nine and fifteen years old.  He sells bananas and Irish potatoes.  His business is well organized, he works from 6am until 6pm every day and has one year of experince in this business.

Peter has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance company in order to purchase more Irish potatoes and bananas to sell.  With the profits from the loan, Peter will reinvest in his business and to save money.

loans.use: to purchase more Irish potatoes and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soapstone carvings from Kisii for sale.

loans.name: Ricardo Javier

texts.es: Ricardo de 19 años de edad, tiene un expendio de carne ubicado en un local arrendado, de la Ciudadela 20 de julio. Allí vende carne vacuna, porcina y vísceras al por mayor y al detal. Su  clientela la conforman las tiendas, los restaurantes, otros expendios, las amas de casa y público en general. Maneja un sistema de ventas de contado y a también  credicontado. El negocio es atendido por el Ricardo, su padre y dos empleados particulares. Las compras las realiza de contado, maneja una competencia que le potencializa su clientela, y él  se sostiene por ofrecer precios justos, peso exacto, calidad y trato amable con sus clientes. Con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  comprará al por mayor y de contado, carne vacuna y porcina y obtendrá muy buenos descuentos, porque su credikiva es un nuevo capital con el que contará, para invertir un poco mas de lo acostumbrado en sus productos y responderle oportunamente a su clientela que lo amerita, a propósito de las fiestas familiares que se avecinan para recibir el año 2012.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 19 years old.  He sells meat in a rented locale in the 20 de Julio neighborhood.  He sells beef, pork and offal at wholesale and retail.  His clientele is comprised of stores, restaurants, other meat sellers, housewives and the general public.  He manages both credit and cash sales.  Ricardo, his father and two employees run the business.  

He pays cash for his purchases and has competition that vies for his clientele but he stays in business by offering fair prices, exact weights, quality and kind customer service.

He plans to use his Kiva loan, his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to pay cash to buy beef and pork at wholesale thus obtaining good discounts because with the Kiva loan he’ll have new capital to invest a bit more than usual into his products and be able to respond in an opportune way to his deserving clientele especially now that the family get-togethers to welcome 2012 are nearing.

loans.use: to buy beef and pork at wholesale and for cash.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 38 years old and a single mother of three children.  She has been selling cereals for the past ten years, earning a monthly income of KES 30,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  Esther will use the loan to buy a stock of dry maize, beans and wheat for her business.  With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to build a store for her stock.

loans.use: to buy a stock of dry maize, beans and wheat for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stock of clothes to add to her business.

loans.name: David

texts.es: David tiene una comercializadora de prendas de vestir y trabaja en compañía de su señora madre dese hace 14 meses;  él quiere comprar una máquina plana, para fabricar otro tipo de prendas que pueda vender en su punto de ventas y la fabricación de ropa es ahora su máximo desafio. En la actualidad se dedica a la comercialización de ropa interior ,para damas caballeros ye infantil, así como otras prendas sencillas. La necesidad de aprovechar su punto estratégico comercial lo lleva a pensar en comprar maquinarias que le permitan vender ropa jeans y en tejido de punto. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Sato Domingo y esto es con el ánimo de continuar la expansión de su negocio, pues con este financiamiento cuenta  para ello. Su negocio ha sido importante como joven emprendedor pues tiene su fuente de empleo y desarrolla su creatividad y muchos de sus sueños como el de terminar de estudiar Ingeniería de sistemas, profesión en la que va por el segundo semestre del año.
texts.en:
David has a clothing store and has been working there alongside his mother for 14 months.  He wants to buy a sewing machine to start manufacturing other types of clothes that he can sell at his store; manufacturing clothes is his current main challenge.

He currently sells women’s, men’s and children’s underwear as well as other simple articles of clothing.  He wants to take advantage of the strategic commercial location he has and this has led him to think about buying machinery that will make it possible for him to sell jeans and knitwear.

This is the reason behind his request for a Kiva loan, the first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in hopes of continuing expanding his business; the loan will make this possible.  

His business has been important to him as a young entrepreneur because he has a source of employment and it develops his creativity and many of his dreams, like finishing studying computer sciences, a profession he’s in the second semester of.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Simaloi

texts.en:
Simaloi is 33 years old, married to Lesamai and they have ten children.  She has been into the farming business, rearing sheep and growing food crops for the last ten years from which she earns a monthly income of KES 26,800.

She is applying for her fourth loan of KES 80,000.  She will use the loan to buy sheep for rearing and tomato seedlings.  She paid back her previous loan well and in good time. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the profits to buy more cows and goats for rearing and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy tomato seeds for planting and to buy more sheep for rearing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 33 years old, a single mother of one child.  She has been running a beauty salon for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 10,500 which she uses to cater for her child’s basic needs. 

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  Eunice will use the loan to buy a dryer machine and beauty products.  With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. 

Her hopes and dreams are to venture into clothes selling.

loans.use: to buy a dryer and beauty products.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 32 years old, married to Peter and they are blessed with two children.  She has been selling second hand clothes for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  Mary will use the loan to buy a stock of clothes to add to her business.  With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop, which will increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothes to add to her business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 48 years old, she is married to David and they are blessed with four children.  She has been selling cereals for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 30,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  Judith will use the loan to buy a stock of dry maize, beans and wheat for her business.  With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to build a store for her stock.

loans.use: to buy a stock of dry maize, beans and wheat for her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, 43 years old, is married to a driver and they have four children ranging from 10 to 25 years. 

For the last five years, Margaret has been selling timber, poles, posts and firewood. She has two employees. Her business is located at a busy market.

She will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy more timber. In the next five years, Margaret hopes to run several timber retail stores.

loans.use: To buy more timber.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 26 years old and has been in farming in her home area of Nkubu in Central Kenya for five consecutive years. She is married with two children, ages six and four. Her farm produces maize, beans, and bananas for the local market.

Doris has made her first loan request with Juhudi Kilimo amounting to 30,000 KES to enable her to boost her banana farming business. She says this will improve her production for all seasons and enable her to provide better living conditions for her young family.

She is optimistic business will grow and sees inconsistent rainfalls as the main challenge in farming.

loans.use: to buy water pipes for irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is married and has four children ranging from 8 months to 12 years. He describes himself as an ambitious and God-fearing man. 

He has been providing photography services to frequent and new customers. His challenge is the high cost of traveling during the course of his business. 

He will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy a digital camera. In the next five years, William hopes and plans to run several photo studios and be a well known photographer.

loans.use: To buy a digital camera.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a single mother of a 5-year-old son. She describes herself as an honest and reliable woman. 

She has been running a beauty salon for the last four years. She provides services of manicure, pedicure, plaiting, etc. She has two employees. The business is in a good and viable area. 

Her business challenge is the high price of the beauty products she uses. 

She will be using the loan of KES 20,000 to purchase Cutex (nail polish remover), weaves and braids. In the next five years, Beatrice hopes to own several beauty salons in all the major towns.

loans.use: To buy more Cutex, weaves and braids.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, 32 years old, is a single mother of a 13-year-old daughter. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. 

She runs a beauty salon and provides services of hairdressing, manicure, pedicure and plaiting. Her business challenge is high cost of the beauty products such as braids and cosmetics. 

She will be using the loan of KES 20,000 to purchase hair oils, braids and cosmetics. 

In the next five years, Lydia hopes to run a bigger beauty salon in Nakuru town.

loans.use: To buy more hair oil, braids and cosmetics.

loans.name: Savali

texts.en:
Savali, 26 years old, is married and has two children, ages 4 and 6 years. He describes himself as an ambitious man. 

For the last two years, he has been providing transportation services to residents in a competitive place. His business challenge is the weather, especially when it rains, as the roads are impassible. 

He will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy spare parts for the motorbike. Savali's hope and dream is to own another motorbike. In the next five years, his goal is to buy a van to add more transportation services.

loans.use: To buy motorbike spare parts.

loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.es:
Norma, es casada, vive con su esposo y cuatro hijos, tienen casa propia, ella administra un cafetín desde hace 7 años, este lo inicio por ideas propias, las ventas las realiza a los estudiantes de centros escolares y personas que transitan el lugar desde las 7:00am hasta las 5.00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio como boquitas, galletas, pan, huevos, Lácteos y medicina, este crédito le ayudara para mejorar el negocio, fortaleciéndolo de mercadería para que los clientes encuentren lo que necesitan.
Su aspiración es mejorar su condición económica a través del préstamo, para tener una mejor solvencia económica frente  a sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Norma is married living with her husband and four children; they own their house.  She has been running a café for seven years that she started with her own ideas.  She sells to students from local schools and to people who pass by between 7am and 5pm.

She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise for the business like snacks, cookies, bread, eggs, dairy products and medicine.  The loan will help her improve the business strengthening the merchandise so that customers can find what they need.

Her hopes are to improve her economic situation through the loan to have better economic solvency in face of her obligations.

loans.use: to buy snacks, cookies, bread, eggs, dairy products and medicine.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget is a mother of 2 children, aged 18 and 15 years. She has been active in farming for 5 years with her produce of cabbages and vegetables going to the local market.

Bridget has requested for a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy piglets and to venture into pig farming. She says pigs reproduce faster and are likely to earn her more income since pork has also become more marketable due to the high cost of beef. She plans to use the income to educate her two children.

She adds that Juhudi Kilimo loans have given great help to farmers.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Millian

texts.en:
Millian, 24 years old, is married and has a 3-year-old daughter. She describes herself as a social and determined woman. 

She has sold detergent for the last three years to schools, offices and hotels. The business is in a viable place. 

Her business challenge is insufficient funds. 

She will be using the loan of KES 20,000 to buy acids, mixtures and chemicals. 

In the next five years, Millian's hopes to be a large-scale distributor of detergents.

loans.use: To buy more acids, chemicals and mixtures.

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en:
Simeon is 29 years old and is married. He has one child who is 5 years old. Simeon sells spare parts in his business, working from 5am until 5pm every day, with two employees to help him.

Simeon has requested a loan from Kiva lender, Vision Finance company to help him expand his business by financing more spare parts to sell. With this profit from this loans, Simeon will be able to build his own house.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a resident and a farmer in Nkubu area of Kenya. She is married, has 5 adult children and has been active in farming for 30 years. Her current harvests of cabbages, french beans and carrots go to the local market.

Joyce has requested for a loan of 63,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable her to buy and insure a dairy cow.
