She plans to use the income to improve her farming by buying a generator for pumping water into her farm. She hopes farming will make her life better. She, however, laments the high input costs of farming.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Guillermo Felix

texts.es:
Guillermo Felix  tiene 49 años de edad, él vive en Ica, Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente.  En su tiempo libre disfruta Arreglar Motos;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Guillermo le gusta mucho es el “Seco de Cabrito”. Guillermo estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria debido a problemas  económicos de sus padres, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar 0 Mecánica Automotriz.

Guillermo trabaja como conductor de mototaxi pero tanta son las ganas de salir adelante de Guillermo que también con mucho esfuerzo trabaja  en su Taller de reparación de mototaxi, se dedica a ambos trabajos alrededor de 11 horas diarias, ya que el nos dice que sin sacrificio no hay crecimiento, sus amigos lo animaron ya que tiene mucha habilidad para la reparación de estos vehículos y porque también sabe manejar y es muy prudente al hacerlo. En un día Guillermo puede atender alrededor de 50 clientes y esto le permite ganar hasta  S/. 30 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar  hasta S/.60  lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales para su hogar o para  invertir en el negocio, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es cumplido en la entrega de sus trabajos , es honrado, responsable y sobre todo muy honesto y es por eso que sus clientes siempre lo buscan y lo recomiendan a otras personas. Guillermo está muy agradecido hacia  los prestatarios Kiva ya que con este apoyo el podrá remodelar su taller de mecánica y remodelar su casa.

Esta mejora podrá ayudarle a tener un mejor ambiente para realizar su trabajo y con ello tendrá una mejor calidad de vida ya que tendrá mejores ingresos y así en algunos meses le gustaría tener un taller más grande lo que lo ayudará a cumplir su gran sueño: "Tener su casa propia."
texts.en:
Guillermo Félix, 49, lives in Ica, Perú.  Ica is located in the Sechura Desert almost four hours south of Lima, the national capital, and is acclaimed by Peruvians as “The Land of the Sun.”  It’s noted in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.0 in 2007 and a 6.9 in 2011), its grape, asparagus and olive production and, above all, as the source of Peru’s traditional, national beverage: Pisco.

In this hot, arid weather we find our client’s home and business.  In his spare time he enjoys repairing motorcycles.  As he well knows, Peru is known for having the most delicious food in the world and one of Guillermo’s favorite dishes is “Seco de Cabrito.”  Guillermo studied up to eleventh grade due to his parent’s economic problems; he would have liked to study Auto Mechanics.

Guillermo works as a mototaxi driver but his drive to get ahead is so strong that he also works very hard in his motorcycle repair shop.  He spends about 11 hours daily at both jobs and tells us that without sacrifice, there is no growth.  His friends encouraged him because he’s very skilled in vehicle repair and because he knows how to drive and is a very prudent driver.

In a typical day, Guillermo can tend to 50 customers which produces a 30-sol daily profit for him and on a good day he might earn up to 60 soles which helps him cover some additional household expenses or to invest in the business.  He believes that he does well in his business because he finishes his jobs on time, he’s honest and responsible but, above all, very honest and this is why his customers seek him out and recommend him to others.

Guillermo is very grateful to Kiva lenders because he’ll be able to use the loan to remodel his workshop and his house.  This improvement will help him have a better environment in which to carry out his work and this will create a better quality of life since his income will improve and in a few months he’d like to have a larger workshop that will help him reach his great dream: “To have his own house.”

loans.use: to remodel his shop and his house.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Felipe es una es persona trabajadora que su objetivo en la vida es de mejorar su vivienda donde habita con su familia, con mucho esfuerzo la ha acondicionado poco a poco para darles a sus hijos una vivienda digna, que por falta de capital no ha terminado las mejoras que el necesidad realizarle a la vivienda. Felipe está solicitando crédito para poder realizar las mejoras de su vivienda para la compra de zinc, pilares entre otros equipos para la construcción.
texts.en: Felipe is a hardworking person whose life goal is to improve the house he lives in with his family.  With much effort he’s gradually been furnishing it so that his children can have a dignified home.  For lack of capital, however, he’s been unable to finish the improvements he needs to make on the dwelling.  Felipe is asking for a loan to carry out the home improvements.  He will buy metal sheeting, pillars and other building materials and supplies.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Arlen Patricia

texts.es:
Arlen comerciante de ropas y mas, casada. Anteriormente trabajaba como profesora a la actualidad atiende su negocio pudiendo establecer nuevos clientes  y mayor control de su producto. Con el préstamo anterior compro mercadería logrando aumentar su ingreso. Con este nuevo ciclo de préstamo invertirá en productos para dama, varones y niños ya que se acerca la temporada escolar y el verano siendo tiempo de ventas. Comprara mercaderías como: pantalones escolares, pantalones de dama y caballero, zapatos, blusas, camisolas, camisetas, faldas, calcetines, short, sandalia, reloj, entre otros productos para aumentar su inventario, cumplir con los pedidos que ya tiene y lo que vendrán. 
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo constante al desarrollo de su negocio y el mejoramiento de su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Arlen sells clothing and other items and is married. She previously worked as a teacher, but currently tends to her business in order to gain new customers and better manage her sales. She used her previous loan to buy merchandise and thereby increase her income. She will invest this new loan in items for women, men and children as the school year is approaching and sales are high during the summer. She will buy merchandise such as pants for school, men’s and women’s pants, shoes, blouses, camisoles, shirts, skirts, socks, shorts, sandals, watches, and other items in order to expand her inventory and fill her current and future orders.

She is grateful to the lending institution for the constant support in developing her business and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Carlos Adolfo

texts.es:
Carlos, es un joven emprendedor muy activo que le gusta emprender y sacar adelante a su familia, el tiene 30 años de edad, es padre de 4 hijos, esta casado, habita en la ciudad de Granado se dedica a la venta de hortalizas y  frutas los colores verdes y amarillos son su mejor presentación ya que vive rodeado de frutos y vegetales frescos colocados en sus enormes canastos hecho de palma seca elaborados de forma artesanal. Este negocio lo inicio por medio de sus padres ya que se dedicaban a la producción de algunas hortalizas y vendían lo que cultivaban el ayudaba a su padre hasta que el se logro independizar siempre vendiendo lo que sembraban sus padres además para  variar sus productos viaja hasta Masaya para comprar otro tipos de verduras y vegetales que su padres no siembran para ofrecer variedad a su clientela.     Así transcurren sus actividades diarias en el mercado de la ciudad de Granada.    
El solicita el crédito para compra de cebolla, papas, tomates, granadillas, chayote, cálalas, repollos. Ya que son parte de los productos que buscan sus clientes y no siembran por lo cual los compra fuera de Granada. Uno de sus planes es asegurar su tramo para almacenar productos y no pagar bodega para guardar su mercadería. Sobre todo luchar cada día por darles un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carlos is a young, very active entrepreneur who likes to work and get his family ahead. He is 30 years old, married, and the father of four children. He lives in the city of Granada and works selling vegetables and fruits. The green and yellow products make the best presentation, as he is surrounded by fresh fruits and vegetables in enormous artisanal baskets made of dried palm. He started this business through his parents, as they worked growing vegetables and would sell what they grew. Carlos helped his father until he became independent. He has always sold his parents’ products but also adds variety for his customers by traveling to Masaya to buy other vegetables that his parents don’t grow. This is how he spends his day in the Granada city market.

Carlos is requesting this loan for the purchase of onions, potatoes, tomatoes, granadillas, chayotes, passion fruit, and cabbage. His customers look for these products and his parents do not grow them, which is why he buys them outside of Granada. One of his plans is to ensure storage for his products and not have to pay for a warehouse to store his merchandise. Above all, he struggles daily to provide his children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy onions, potatoes, tomatoes, granadillas, chayotes, passion fruit, and cabbage

loans.name: Maria Nelly

texts.es:
Doña María de oficio comerciante, se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace tres años , tiene 6 hijos es casada, vive en  la ciudad de Granada. La idea de empezar con su propio negocio surgió con la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares pues la situación económica es mas difícil y criar a 6 hijos todos ellos en edades escolares no es tarea fácil para una sola persona así que ella le ayuda a su marido atravez de su negocio y juntos aportan para el bienestar de su familia. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz y leña para elaborar tortillas. Uno de sus sueños es tener una cocina industrial que le ayude a mejorar su nivel de producción y seguir  haciendo productivo su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a merchant who has worked making and selling tortillas for the past three years. She has six children, is married, and lives in the city of Granada. She decided to start her own business out of her need to help her husband with the family expenses since the economy is not doing well and raising six school-aged children is not an easy task for one person alone. As a result, she helps her husband through her business and together, they contribute to their family’s well-being.

She is requesting a loan to purchase corn and firewood for making tortillas. One of her dreams is to have an industrial kitchen to help her improve production and continue doing well in her business.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for making tortillas.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Don Carlos es un humilde pescador de 31 años de edad, originario de Granada, tiene 5 hijos . El se dedica a esta actividad desde los 19 años de edad, el solo logro estudiar la primaria pues tuvo que dedicarse a trabajar para poder comer sus condiciones de pobreza no le permitieron seguir estudiando ni llegar a la universidad por tal motivo no quisiera que a sus hijos le sucediera lo mismo. Sus actividades de pesca comienzan desde muy tempranas hora de la mañana donde alista su humilde lancha y sus instrumentos para irse a pescar en el imponente lago de Granada y regresa por el atardecer después de todo un día de sol incandescente  para poder vender sus frescos pescados de agua dulce.  
El solicita el crédito para comprar materiales tales como faroles, tambor  de mecate, hilo, cemento para elaborar un trasmayo (herramienta que se utiliza para la red de pescar). Esto le ayudara a adquirir mejor cantidad los pescados y poder vender mas. Siempre con sus ganas de salir adelante el desea lograr comprar otra lancha con mejores condiciones pues la que tiene esta algo desgastada.
texts.en:
Carlos is a humble fisherman, 31 years of age, who comes from Granada and has 5 children. He has followed this trade since he was 19 years old. Carlos only completed primary school because he had to go to work in order to eat. His poverty did not permit him to continue to study, nor to attend the university. For that reason, he doesn't want this to happen to his children. 

Carlos begins fishing very early in the morning when he launches his humble boat and his fishing gear on the imposing Lake Granada, and returns late in the afternoon, after spending all day in the incandescent sun, to sell his fresh water catch.

Carlos is requesting a loan to buy materials such as (net) eyes, a drum of twine, fishing line, and cement to make a tool for making and mending fishing nets. This will help him to catch and sell more fish. Since, as always, he desires to get ahead, he wants to buy a boat that is in better condition -- the one he has is somewhat dilapidated.

loans.use: buy materials such as net eyes, a drum of fishing twine, fishing lines, and cement to make tools used in making and repairing  fishing nets.

loans.name: Roger Raul

texts.es:
Nacido en Granada, con 36 años de edad Roger es un comerciante activo, vende CD y DVD, es soltero, tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, sus estudios a duras penas llegaron hasta la secundaria. El empezó con este negocio por la necesidad y el entusiasmo de salir adelante e independizarse de sus padres además que necesitaba ayudar a su familia a salir adelante siempre buscando la manera de ayudar a sus padres. Fue cuando decidió vender CD y DVD cuando tenia 26 años de edad al principio fue difícil sobre todo el hacer una clientela fija pero logro y se siente satisfecho que a los largo de 10 años que tiene este negocio ha sobrevivido el y su familia. El vende su mercadería en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Granada su hermana lo ayuda atender el negocio mientras el realiza las compra de inventario y esta en la búsqueda de mas clientes. 
El solicita el préstamo para compra de CD y DVD por mayor cantidad. Pues le ayudara a incrementar sus ventas y mejorar su negocio. Uno de sus planes futuros es tener un local con mas seguridad y comprar un vehículo que le ayude a transportarse a los pueblos para vender.
texts.en:
Born in Granada, 36 year old Roger is an active vendor, selling CDs and DVDs. He is single and he has a two year old son. He attended school until the secondary level. He started this business for necessity and enthusiasm to make progress and to become independent from his parents. In addition, he needed to help his family make progress as he’s always looking for a way to help his parents. He decided to sell CDs and DVDs when he was 26 years old. At first, it was difficult because he had to find a stable customer base. However, he succeeded.  He feels satisfied that in the ten years that he has had the business he and his family have survived.  He sells his merchandise in the city market in the city of Granada. His sister helps him with the business while he purchases inventory and looks for more customers. 
He is requesting the loan to purchase more CDs and DVDs. These purchases will help him increase his sails and improve his business. One of his plans for the future is to have a store with more security and to also purchase a vehicle that will take him to other towns to sell his products.

loans.use: to purchase more CDs and DVDs.

loans.name: Las Marias Group

texts.es:
Cristina cuenta con 33 años de edad es casada, tiene 5 hijos los cuales están estudiando Creidily esta cursando la primaria, Jona Antonio esta en 4° de primaria, Jemi en 3° Maritza en la secundaria y el menor esta en el preescolar, su esposo se llama tomas es campesino.

Ella es comerciante vende pescados ya tiene 3 años con su negocio ella sale a vender a los pueblos vecinos e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de mas pescados espera que le ayude ya que es una fuente de ingresos y le es de gran utilidad espera hacer crecer su negocio. 

Cristina pertenece al grupo las marías el cual esta integrado por 13 personas 1 hombre y 12 mujeres a continuación serán mencionadas: Teresa, Isabel, Elisandra, Rosa Dalia, Yadira, Paula, Alberta, Leonardo, Marisol, Antonia, Yesenia, Carmela, todas realizan una actividad comercial como son: cosméticos, perfumes, refrescos, artículos para el hogar, maíz, frutas, legumbres, etc
texts.en:
Cristina is 33 years old. She is married and has five children, who are in school. Creidily is in primary school, Jona Antonia is in the fourth grade of primary school, Jemi is in 3rd grade, Maritza is in secondary school, and the youngest is in preschool. Her husband, Tomás, is a farmer.

Cristina is a merchant. She sells fish, and she has already had this business for 3 years. She goes to the neighboring towns to sell, and she will invest her loan in the purchase of more fish. She expects that the loan will help her, since her business is a source of income and it is very useful to her. She hopes to make her business grow.

Cristina belongs to the Las Marias group, which consists of 13 people, one man and 12 women -- Teresa, Isabel, Elisandra, Rosa Dalia, Yadira, Paula, Alberta, Leonardo, Marison, Antonia, Tesenia, and Carmela. All have business activities such as cosmetics, perfumes, soft drinks, household items, corn, fruits, vegetable, etc.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Kathy

texts.en:
Kathy has been working in the construction industry as far back as her first job. Since 2010, she has owned an electric company, which provides electrical, telecommunications and other wiring contractor services. She decided she wanted to do electrical contracting because she enjoys being part of building and construction projects, and she knew it would be fulfilling and challenging. Some of Kathy’s family members are also involved in the business, helping with office duties. She says the biggest challenge for the business is the current state of the economy, since construction and building jobs are not as plentiful as they used to be. Kathy feels fortunate to have had a good financial year considering the economy.

This loan will be used to purchase electrical equipment used on jobsites and will be used with the start of Kathy’s next major contract.

loans.use: To purchase electrical equipment for job sites.

loans.name: Sara San Isidro Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre Sara san Isidro, los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre porque así se llama la persona que formo el grupo y en honor a su comunidad, es por eso que escogieron este nombre, la historia es acerca de la señora Sara ya que es la representante de este grupo, cuenta con 41 años de edad y está casada con el señor Porfirio Ruiz quien es campesino, tienen 2 hijos Manuel y Alejandra los cuales cursan sexto año de primaria y segundo año de secundaria, ella se dedica a la venta de productos agrícolas como sandias, melones, elotes, jitomates y chiles desde hace 4 años.

Doña Sara decidió iniciar con este negocio, por que tenia la necesidad de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia y sacar a sus hijos adelante, ya que no tenia la solvencia económica suficiente para conseguir darles una mejor educación, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como sandias, melones, elotes, jitomates y chiles.

 
Ella desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y así poder hacerlo crecer mucho mas, puesto que quiere construir un local para poner su tienda de frutas y verduras y así incrementar y mejorar sus ventas e ingresos, puesto que así podrá seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que puedan tener una muy buena profesión y también seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.

Ella esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios de kiva y con Fundación realidad, ya que gracias a ellos esta saliendo adelante y ha podido tener su propio negocio.

Otras de las compañeras de doña Sara son: Silvia, María del socorro, Mireya y magdalena, quienes realizan variadas actividades como son: venta de frutas, comida, ropa y zapatos
texts.en:
This group goes by the name Sara San Isidro.  They named their group after the person who started it and in honor of their community.  This profile is about Sara as she is the group representative.  She is 41 years old and is married to Señor Profirio Ruiz who is a farmer.  They have 2 children, Manuel and Alejandra, who are in the sixth year of elementary school and the second year of high school.  She has been selling produce such as watermelons, melons, sweet corn, tomatoes and chilies for 4 years.  

Doña Sara decided to start this business because she needed to improve her quality of life and that of her family and provide for her children as she didn't have the financial means to give them a better education.  She plans to invest her loan in the purchase of products such as watermelons, melons, sweet corn, tomatoes and chilies.  
 
She wants to keep investing in her business so that it can grow since she wants to build a place from which to sell her fruits and vegetables.  This way she will be able to increase and improve her sales and income.  She can also continue supporting her children in their studies so they can work in a good profession and also, continue improving their quality of life.  

She is very grateful to the Kiva lenders and to Fundación Realidad because, thanks to them, she is getting ahead and has been able to have her own business.  

Doña Sara's other partners are: Silvia, María del Socorro, Mireya and Magdalena who work at various other activities such as fruit, food, clothing and shoe sales.

loans.use: purchase watermelons, melons, sweet corn, tomatoes and chilies.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: La socia Felicia; La socia alterna continua con su negocio de alquiler de cuartos,compra y venta de productos de belleza y también vende ropa interior, la socia desea seguir invirtiendo en los mismos negocio y de este modo implementar sus ventas y mejorar la economia, la socia comprara la mercaderia con el credito. La socia desea terminar de mejorar su vivienda y seguir prosperando.
texts.en: Felicia constantly divides her time between her business renting out rooms and buying and selling beauty products and underwear.  She wants to continue investing in these businesses so that she can increase her sales and improve her finances.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise.  Felicia wants to finish her housing improvements and continue growing.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Palccaraqui Ii Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “PALCCARAQUI II” y se reúnen  cada treinta días en la ciudad de Urubamba en el distrito de Urubamba. (Cusco, Perú).  El banco comunal se distingue por estar conformado por gente trabajadora,  profesionales, artesanos y comerciantes. El grupo está conformado ocho integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan un préstamo de la Asociación Arariwa y el dinero lo invertirán para mejorar sus negocios. 

En esta reunión conocimos a la señora Lucia y nos cuenta que ella nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba y ahora vive en la ciudad de Urubamba en el poblado de Palcaraqui junto con  sus tres hijos (Brenda de 18 años, Lenin de 15 años y Arnold de 11 años). Desde joven se caracterizo por ser una persona responsable y amable y por ese motivo sus vecinas le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal. Lucia es enfermera y trabaja en una posta de salud de la ciudad de Urubamba, ella también se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para el mantenimiento de la casa ósea quiere comprar maderas y cemento.  Ella tiene 42 años de edad, es una persona con muchas ganas de superarse y tener un negocio exitoso día con día, siempre con el deseo de brindarle lo mejor a su familia. El sueño de la socia es ver profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Palccaraqui II” and meets every 30 days in the city and district of Urubamba (Cusco, Peru).  The Communal Bank is distinguished for having hardworking individuals who are professionals, artisans, and merchants.  There are eight members and this is the first time they have requested a loan from Asociación Arariwa.  The money will be invested in the improvement of their businesses.  

At this meeting, the staff of Asociación Arariwa met with Sra. Lucia.  She indicated that she was born in the city of Quillabamba, but now resides in the subdivision of Palcaraqui in the city of Urubamba.  Lucia lives with her three children:  Brenda – 18, Lenin - 15, and Arnold – 11.  From a young age, Lucia has been known for being a responsible and friendly person.  Her neighbors encouraged and invited her to participate in the Communal Bank.  

Lucia is a nurse and works at a health clinic in the city of Urubamba.  She also engages in farming and raising small animals.  Lucia is taking this opportunity to request a loan for home maintenance.  She plans to buy wood and cement.  Lucia is 42 years and has great desire to succeed and do well in her business day after day so that she can always provide the best for her family.  Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy wood and cement for home improvements.

loans.name: Los Girasoles De Compone Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS GIRASOLES DE COMPONE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia; ella es casada y tiene 41 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de queso, ella vende en forma independiente llevando a lugares como Limatambo, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es terminar de construir su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, yeso, arena y piedras para que termine de construir su casa.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de ganados, negocio de crianza de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de  venta de comida, negocio de venta de verduras.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Los Girasoles de Compone" Communal Bank, located in the Anta district in the Anta province, department of Cusco.
Julia, 41, is married and has five children. She has a business selling cheese. She sells independently and takes her cheese to places such as Limatambo. She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm and is able to get her children ahead through this business. Her dream is to finish building her home. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of construction materials such as cement, plaster, sand and stones in order to finish building her home.
The other members sell livestock, raise animals, run grocery stores, sell food, or sell vegetables.
Julia is grateful to those who will become part of this dream through financing this loan. She promises to repay her quotas as established.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, plaster, sand and stones to finish building her home.

loans.name: Concepcion Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Concepción es una sencilla pero muy trabajadora comerciante quien vende granos básicos, tomates, cebollas, chiltoma y ropa en un pequeño tramo localizado en la ciudad de Granada , es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 14 años de edad ambos están estudiando la secundaria  y le ayudan a ella a atender el negocio durante las vacaciones . Ella comenzó con este negocio cuando su madre enfermo pues era ella quien le enseño todo lo relacionado a la compra y venta de vegetales. Concepción trabaja desde los 11 años de edad, pero al cumplir 28  años puso su propio negocio donde actualmente tiene 2 pequeños locales vendiendo hortalizas y ropa.  
Ella realizo el préstamo para comprar mercadería de ropa, zapatos y hortalizas para surtir y vender. Pues le gusta ofrecer buenos productos para atraer clientes y así mejorar sus ventas  ya que uno de sus sueños es ampliar con variedad de productos su local que sea de mucha necesidad en su vecindario y puedan encontrar de inmediato sin necesidad de salir fuera a buscar productos que son de gran demanda.
texts.en:
Señora Concepción is unassuming and very hard-working. She sells basic grains, tomatoes, onions, sweet pepper and clothing from a small stall in the city of Granada. She is the single mother of two children ages 13 and 14. Both are in secondary school and help her with the business when they are on vacation. Concepcion started this business when her mother became ill; her mother had taught her everything about buying and selling vegetables. Concepcion started working at the age of 11, and when she turned 28 she opened her own business. She now has two small locations where she sells vegetables and clothing.
She has taken out this loan for the purchase of merchandise: clothing, shoes and vegetables to sell. She likes offering good products to attract customers and improve her sales. One of her dreams is to have a greater variety of products so that her business will have great demand in the area. She hopes that customers will be able to find what they need at her business without going elsewhere.

loans.use: to buy merchandise: clothing, shoes and vegetables.

loans.name: Esperanza De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza de los Ángeles  es una señora trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de Aguas fresca de horchata, Jamaica, naranja, coco, limón y tamarindo.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Lorenzo con quien tiene  un hijo  por quien los dos trabajan para darles un mejor futuro ya que desean   que estudie.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de  frutas, azúcar y leche, para la elaboración de aguas frescas naturales.
Le dan las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante y triunfar en el futuro.
texts.en:
Esperanza de Los Angeles is a hardworking woman who has a business selling "aguas frescas" (freshly made traditional Mexican beverages), including horchata (a rice-based beverage), jamaica (a type of iced-tea), and juices flavored with orange, coconut, lemon and tamarind.

Esperanza is happily married to Lorenzo, and together they have a child for whom they work hard to provide a better future, since they want him to get an education.  

Esperanza requested this loan to purchase fruit, sugar and milk to make her natural beverages.

She thanks the Fundación for the support that they have provided her, which will allow her to get ahead and succeed in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make fresh beverages made from natural grains and fruit

loans.name: Keila Ibeth

texts.es:
La señora Keila Ibeth es una señora trabajadora  que se dedica a la venta de  zapatos de la marca  Andrea, flexy y mega chau.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Alfonso quien  le ayuda y apoya en lo que desea ya que  tiene una hija pequeña que don Alfonso cuida cuando doña Keila va entregar sus pedidos de calzado.
Tambien se dedica a la siembra de palmas de papaya para la venta.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas calzado para la venta  ya que , su negocio le deja  buenas ganancias.
Le da las gracias a fundación por apoyarla cuando más lo necesitaba.
texts.en:
Keila Ibeth is a hardworking woman who has a business selling shoes in the brands Andrea, Flexy and Mega Chau.

She is happily married to Alfonso, who helps and supports her as needed, since they have a small daughter who Alfonso cares for when Keila goes out to deliver her shoe orders.

Keila also works cultivating papaya to sell.  She requested a loan so that she could buy more shoes to sell, because she is getting good earnings from her business. She thanks the Fundación for supporting her when she needed it the most.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha es una señora trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de  pollos, pelados, destazados  y vivos.
Doña Martha nos cuenta que lo que más le gusta de su negocio es  atender bien a sus clientes y darles un buen servicio ya que  siempre le compran por que les recala una patita de pollo para que les rinda su comida.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compara de mas pollos para la venta.
Gracias fundación por ayudar a las personas trabajadoras como yo.
texts.en:
Martha is a hardworking woman who sells chickens, plucked, cut up, and also live. Martha tells us that what she likes most about her business is taking good care of her customers and giving them a good service. They always buy from her because she throws in a chicken foot to help their food go farther.

She asked for the loan to buy more chickens to sell. Thank you, foundation, for helping hardworking people such as I.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: Marco  Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Marco Antonio es  un señor trabajador humilde, es albañil el nos cuenta que desde  muy pequeño le ha gustado trabajar en lo que es la albañilería ya que es un trabajo buena le deja buenas ganancias y siempre tiene trabajos extras.
Don Marcos es soltero, tiene tres hijas a quien quiere mucho cuando se va a trabajar sus hijas se le quedan a su mama.
Tambien se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda desde hace tres meses.
El pidió el préstamo para la compara de mas materiales para la albañilería  ya que desea terminar rápido sus trabajos  para que sus clientas estén contentas.
Le da las gracias a fundación por ayudarla a seguir trabajando y crecer como  él desea.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio is a hardworking and humble man who works as a bricklayer.  He tells us that since he was very young he has enjoyed working as a mason, since it is good work that gives him good earnings, and he always has additional work.

Marco is single and has three daughters who he loves very much.  When he goes to work, his daughters stay with their mother.  

In addition, he has been selling used clothing for 3 months.  He is requesting a loan to buy more masonry supplies, since he wants to finish his jobs quickly so that his customers will be pleased.

He thanks the Fundación for helping him to continue to work and grow, which is what he wants to do.

loans.use: to buy masonry supplies

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan es un señor trabajador  humilde que se dedica a la  venta de ciruelas y dulces, también trabaja como albañil.
Esta felizmente casada con la señora Cristina con quien tiene  dos hijos varones por quien trabaja ya que desea darles un mejor futuro ya que ellos ,le ayudan en la venta de dulces cuando él se va a trabajar.
Tambin se dedica a la venta de garafones con agua.
El pidió el préstamo para comprar material para albañilería como es: pala, caretilla, tanbos y tablas.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante y triunfar en el futuro.
texts.en:
Juan is a hardworking and humble man who has a business selling plums and sweets.  He also works as a bricklayer.

He is happily married to Cristina, and together they have two sons.  He works for them, because he wants to give them a better future.  His sons help him with the sale of sweets when he goes out to work.  

In addition, he also sells jugs of water.   He is requesting a loan to buy masonry supplies such as: a shovel, wheelbarrow, canisters and planks of wood.  

He thanks the Fundacion for their support, which is allowing him to get ahead and succeed in the future.

loans.use: to buy masonry supplies

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Magdalena es una señora amable, trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de  bicicletas desde hace  un año.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Macario, quien la ayuda en lo que se pueda ya que el se tiene que ir a trabajar, trabaja de albañil para ofrecerle  una mejor vida.
Magdalena tambien se dedica a la venta de comida, sin embargo esta vez pidió el préstamo para la compra de  bicicletas y refacciones de bicicletas para la venta  ya que se venden muy bien y deja buenas ganancias.
Le da las gracias a fundación por apoyándola para seguir  con su negocio.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a friendly, hardworking woman who has been selling bicycles for a year. 

She is happily married to Macario, who helps her with what he can, since he has to go to work. He works as a bricklayer so that he can offer her a better life.

Magdalena also works selling food. However, this time, she is asking for the loan for the purchase of bicycles and spare parts to sell, since she sells them very well and makes a good profit. 

She is thankful to the foundation for helping her continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for bicycles.

loans.name: Victorio

texts.es:
El señor Victorio es un señor trabajador  quien es taxista desde hace dos años es una persona trabajadora  y amable.
Esta felizmente casada con la señora Beatriz con quien tiene  dos hijos  por quien trabaja día a día para darles una mejor vida y puedan seguir estudiando para defenderse en el futuro.
El pidió el préstamo para la compra de refacciones para su taxi ya que en ocasiones se daña su taxi y tarda mucho tiempo en componerlo y pierde pasajes.
Le da las gracias a fundación por ayudarlo a seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Victorio is a hardworking man who has been a taxi driver for 2 years.  He is a friendly and hardworking person.

He is happily married to Beatriz, and together they have 2 children.  They work for their children each day to provide them with a better life, and to allow them to continue to get an education so that they can take care of themselves in the future.

He is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for his taxi, because at times it breaks down and he loses a lot of time fixing it, and so loses fares.

Victorio thanks the Fundacion for helping him to continue with his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Dulce Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Dulce es una persona trabajadora, está embarazada  tiene siete meses de embarazo  y está feliz y contenta por su bebé que viene en camino.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Víctor Hugo a quien quiere y le agradece el apoyo que le ha dado para que pueda seguir trabajando aun estando embarazada.
Se dedica a la venta de leños  por carga(150 leños)
Doña Dulce tambien  se  dedica a la venta de productos Herbalife desde hace dos años, ella pidió el préstamo para la comprar de más productos Herbalife para la venta.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante y triunfar en la vida.
texts.en:
Dulce is a hardworking person who is 6 months pregnant, and who is very happy and content about the baby that is on the way.

She is happily married to Victor Hugo, who she loves and is grateful to for the support that he has provided her so that she could continue to work even though she is pregnant.

She sells logs (150 per load).

Dulce also has had a business selling Herbalife products for 2 years.  She requested this loan to buy more Herbalife products to sell.

She thanks the Fundacion for the support that they have given her so that she can get ahead and succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase natural health products to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La señora Josefina es  una señora trabajadora  que se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes desde hace tres años.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Noé con quien tienen  dos hijos una mujer y  un varón, quienes le ayudan a atender su tienda  cuando ella está haciendo la comida.
Tambien se dedica a la venta de refacciones para dicicletas y tisiclos.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la comprar de mas mercancía de abarrotes como es : aceite,cebolla,azúcar,pan,leche,galletas y detergente.
Le da las gracias a fundación por ayudarla ya que gracias a su apoyo su tienda va creciendo poco a poco.
texts.en:
Josefina is a hardworking woman who has been selling groceries for 3 years.

She is happily married to Noé, and together they have 2 children, a girl and a boy.  They help her to tend to her store when she is making meals. In addition, she has a business selling spare parts for bicycles and 3-wheeled bikes.

She requests a loan to buy more merchandise for her store, such as: cooking oil, onions, sugar, bread, milk, cookies and detergent.  

Josefina thanks the Fundacion for helping her, because thanks to their support her store has been gradually growing.

loans.use: to buy grocery products to sell

loans.name: Herminia Delfina

texts.es:
La señora  Herminia Delfina se dedica a la venta de  a la venta de ropa  desde hace tres años.
Doña Herminia Delfina es una señora trabajadora, humilde y con deseos de superarse y luchar para obtener más ganancias en su negocio.
Tambien se  dedicaa  a la venta de comida.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más ropa para niño y para dama ya que  en su colonia le compran mucha ropa niños.
Le da las gracias a fundación por apoyarla y seguir triunfando ya que por su edad no puede tener un trabajo pero si puede tener su negocio y hacerlo cada vez más grande.
texts.en:
Herminia Delfina has been selling clothing for 3 years.  She is a hardworking and humble woman, who has a desire to succeed, and who strives to obtain more earnings from her business.  She also has a business selling food.  

She requests a loan to buy more clothing for women and children, since in her neighborhood people buy a lot of children's clothing.  

Herminia Delfina thanks the Fundación for supporting her so that she can continue to succeed, because at her age she was unable to get a  job, but she can have her own business and make it bigger over time.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Sra. Martha se dedica a la venta de papa en uno de los mercados mas concurridos por las amas de casa de la ciudad de La Paz,  es una clienta antigua que trabajo con el banco Kantutitas, luego trabajo con crédito individual ella vuelve a la institución después de un año y medio y solicita crédito que esta destinado al incremento de capital y sacar los papeles de su puesto de venta, el esposo el sr. Braulio es albañil contratista actualmente se encuentra trabajando en la ciudad de El Alto, ambos aportan para el gasto de la familia, el domicilio de la Sra. Martha se encuentra ubicado en la zona de las lomas por lo que se pudo  observar es una persona muy trabajadora ya que desde las seis de la mañana sale a comprar sus productos la variedad de papas por quintales,  para poder venderlo  y también poner al día los papeles de su puesto de venta,  también pela papa 5 arrobas por día para una pensión que se encuentra cerca a su puesto y así tener otro ingreso extra, La Sra. Martha se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Martha sells potatoes in one of the markets most popular with housewives in La Paz.  She had worked with Kantutitas bank for years and then she worked with an individual loan.  She returned to the institution after a year and a half and requested a loan to increase her working capital and to get her documents in order for her stand.  Her husband, Braulio, is a contracted construction worker and he is working in El Alto.  Both pay for the family expenses.  Martha’s home is on the hills in the zone.  

As you can see she is a very hardworking person since she goes out in the mornings at 6 to buy the potatoes by quintales (a weight of about 100 pounds) to sell them and get her documents in order.  She also peels 5 arrobas (a weight of about 25 pounds) of potatoes per day for a small hotel near her stand and she gets extra income for that.  Martha is grateful for the support offered her by the institution.
.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and to get her papers in order for her stand

loans.name: Meiko

texts.en:
The One Smart Cookie Company began as a home-based business in February 2008.  Owner and founder, Meiko, worked diligently for several months perfecting an old family sugar cookie and turtle cookie recipe.  After completing her final product, Meiko began sharing her sweet creations with family and friends, and received an overwhelmingly positive response.  Word spread of Meiko’s delicious delicacies and people began placing orders for all types of parties, celebrations, and other functions.  One business owner was so impressed with Meiko’s cookies, that he ordered 115 dozen to be shipped across the United States as gifts for his clients.  Needless to say, Meiko quickly outgrew the home and needed to move into a commercial building to support her rapidly growing business.

Today, One Smart Cookie Company has a total of 11 employees operating three locations and has expanded their product line to include deli sandwiches and catering services.  In the future, Meiko would love to franchise the company to provide her product to a larger target market. 

Meiko will use her Kiva loan to purchase baking supplies and signage for a new location set to open in January 2012.

loans.use: to purchase signage and equipment for a new location

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: La Señora Lourdes tiene  como actividad la venta de medias, tiene su puesto fijo en la zona de la Ceja de la Ciudad de El Alto La Paz, compra por docena y vende por suelto de diferentes variedades y marcas para Damas, Caballeros, Bebes, niños, Deportivos y tobilleras, tiene una hija que esta estudiando la carrera de enfermería, el esposo vende agendas, libretas bolígrafos etc., este trabajo realiza juntamente con su esposo, el momento de la visita se encontraba junto con su esposo,  esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella, ya que ambos corren con los gastos del hogar,  en esta ocasión solicita financiamiento para aumentar su capital de negocio, comprara de medias por docenas y agendas para mejorar sus ingresos ya que esta época de fin de año tiene mucha venta.
texts.en: Lourdes sells socks. She has her stall in the area of La Ceja in the city of El Alto La Paz. She buys them by the dozen and sells them loose in different varieties and brands for women, men, babies, children, sports, and ankle socks. She has a daughter who is studying to be a nurse. Her husband sells planners, notebooks, pens, etc. She does this work together with her husband; she was with her husband at the time of the visit. This is her main source of income, since both pay the household expenses. This time she is asking for a loan to increase her business capital. She will buy socks by the dozen and planners in order to improve her income, since she has a lot of sales at the end of the year.

loans.use: to purchase her merchandise of socks by the dozen

loans.name: Emprendedores De Pampahasi Group

texts.es: La señora Carmen es la presidenta de banco de emprendimiento Emprendedores de Pampahasi, todas las socias viven en la zona de Pampahasi de ahí el nombre, la Sra. Carmen es un apersona muy responsable y trabajadora siempre solidaria con su compañeras por tal motivo la eligieron como presidenta, ella se dedica a la venta de  cd's de colección en la zona de Villa Fátima es ambulante trabaja con el hijo que tiene 2 años de edad el esposo trabaja como ayudante de minibús viven en alquiler y ambos corren con los gastos del hogar, el dinero del  crédito lo utilizara en la compra de cd bailables para este año nuevo ya que tiene gran demanda, la Sra. Carmen es una persona muy trabajadora siempre esta diversificando sus productos, en un futuro desea alquilar una tienda para poder vender sus productos y así de esta manera incrementar mas su capital de trabajo, se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado
texts.en: Carmen is the president of the Emprendedores de Pampahasi (Entrepreneurs of Pampahasi) communal bank. All the members live in the area of Pampahasi, which is where they got the name. Carmen is a very responsible and hard-working person who is always supportive of her fellow members, so they elected her president. She sells collectible CDs in the area of Villa Fátima. She sells door-to-door and she works with her son, who is 2 years old. Her husband works as a minibus assistant. They rent, and they both pay household expenses. She will use the money from the loan to purchase a CD of dance songs for this new year, since she has a lot of demand. Carmen is a very hard-working person and is always diversifying her products. In the future, she wants to rent a shop in order to be able to sell her products and in this way further increase her business capital. She is very thankful for the help she is receiving.

loans.use: to purchase CDs of dance songs for the new year

loans.name: Taumainuumau

texts.en:
Taumainuumau is sixty-four years of age, married, and has six children.

Taumainuumau owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business.    

She needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase a spray gun to ease labor costs.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Taumainuumau joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is Taumainuumau's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase a spray gun to ease labor costs.

loans.name: Talosaga

texts.en:
Talosaga is thirty-three years of age, married, and has one child.

Talosaga owns and operates a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business.   Talosaga needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Talosaga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is Talosaga's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make fried food products for sale.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Martha madre soltera trabajadora, emprendedora e inteligente anteriormente invirtió el préstamo en su venta ambulante. Tiene planes de construir su casa. Se le ha presentado dificultades en la realización de las mejoras ya que los costos de materiales y mano de obra son altos. 
 Analizando que con el apoyo de la financiera y con los ingresos del negocio y su trabajo podría ir mejorándola poco a poco para obtener una vivienda sencilla. Con este nuevo ciclo de préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, bloques, piedras cantera, piedrín, arena, hierro, perlines, golosa, laminas de zinc entre otros materiales para la construcción de una pared y cambio del techo de una parte de la casa. 
Agradece a la financiera ya que mediante ella lograra ofrecerle a su familia protección y seguridad.
texts.en:
Martha, a hard-working, enterprising and intelligent single mother, invested her previous loan in her business. She plans to build her home. She has encountered difficulties making improvements because the cost of materials and labour is high.
She has figured out that the support of this financial institution, along with her income from her business, will allow her to make improvements bit by bit in order to have a simple home. With this new loan cycle she will buy construction materials such as: cement, blocks, stone, gravel, sand, iron, purlines, dividers, zinc laminate, and other materials for building a wall and changing the roof for part of her home.
She thanks the financial institution, because through this  loan she will be able to offer her family protection and security.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Soyla Leonor

texts.es: Soyla Leonor es una emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de plátanos y al destace de cerdo es una persona  que ha luchado por salir adelante junto con su familia, ella ya ha sido clienta de Fundación León 2000 en cual ha demostrado ser una persona emprendedora, responsable y con ganas de superación. Soyla nos expresa que leda gracias por la confianza que han depositada en ella y que con el financiamiento que se le ha brindado ha aumentado su inventario y claro sus clientes. Actualmente está solicitando crédito para comprar plátanos y cerdos para esta temporada donde las ventas se ponen buenas.
texts.en: Soyla Leonor is an entrepreneur who has a business selling bananas and butchering pigs.  She is a person who has struggled to get ahead along with her family.  She has already been a client of Fundación León 2000, and she has demonstrated herself to be a person who is enterprising and responsible, and who has a strong desire to succeed.  Soyla tells us that she wants to express her gratitude for the trust that has been placed in her; with the financing that has been provided to her she has increased her inventory and her customer base.  Now she is requesting a loan to buy bananas and pigs for this season when the sales are strong.

loans.use: to buy bananas and pigs

loans.name: Talosaga

texts.en:
Talosaga is thirty-seven years of age and is married with one child.

Talosaga owns and operates a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community. She has one year of experience in this business.Talosaga needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Talosaga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is Talosaga's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale.

loans.name: Flor Margarita

texts.es:
Este es el segundo préstamo de Flor, de 49 años, ella es una mujer que tiene dos pequeños hijos, uno de 12 y el menor de 8 añitos, actualmente ella se dedica sola al cuidado y mantención sus pequeños, debido a que por situaciones personales tuvo que separarse de su pareja. Para salir adelante y darle a sus niños siempre una buena calidad de vida, ella se empezó a dedicar a la venta de abarrotes en la ciudad de Nazca, famosa por las legendarias Líneas de Nazca, una serie de antiguos, inmenso e inexplicable jeroglíficos grabados en el desierto que rodea la ciudad, generalmente atribuidos a la cultura Nazca, que habitaron en la región de 300 a 800 AD. Como tal, la ciudad atrae a una cantidad considerable de turismo. Pero Nazca también es conocida por su gente trabajadora, que han conservado a pesar de los frecuentes terremotos, tsunamis, y un alto nivel de pobreza en la región.

Con ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, ella podrá comprar algunos abarrotes que le son necesarios, estos están siempre incrementando su precio y es por ello que quiere comprar todo lo que necesita en una sola ocasión a un buen precio, para poder ganar el dinero necesario para el buen cuidado de sus hijitos.
texts.en:
This is the second loan for Flor, age 49. She has two young children, one age 12 and the younger one only 8 years old. She currently dedicates herself alone to the care and support of her little ones, since for personal reasons she had to separate from her partner. To get ahead and always provide her children with a good quality of life, she began to work selling groceries in the city of Nazca. This city is famous for the legendary Nazca Lines, a series of ancient, immense and inexplicable hieroglyphics carved into the desert which surrounds the city. They are generally attributed to the people of the Nazca culture, who inhabited the region from 300 to 800 AD. Because of this, the city attracts a large number of tourists. However, Nazca is also known for its hard-working people, who have survived in spite of frequent earthquakes, tsunamis, and a high poverty rate in the region. 

With the help of Kiva lenders, Flor will be able to buy some groceries which she needs for her store. The merchandise is always increasing in price, and because of this, she would like to buy what she needs in a single purchase at a good price, so that she can earn the money she needs to take good care of her young children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Tafa

texts.en:
Tafa is thirty seven years of age and is married with four children. She owns & operates a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  She has 1 year of experience in this business. Tafa needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Tafa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Tafa's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Organizer

texts.en:
Organizer is twenty eight years of age and is married with four children. Organizer owns & operates a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community. She has 3 years of experience in this business. Organizer needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Organizer joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Organizer's 4th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Alex Omar

texts.es: El señor Alex es cliente nuevo es soltero,  vive en la ciudad de La Paz el  trabajaba  en una institución y percibía un sueldo fijo, pero no tenia estabilidad laboral,  decidió emprender un nuevo negocio, se dedica a la venta de ropas  el crédito  lo  invertirá en la  compra de ropa para navidad y poleras  el cliente es trabajador este es su único ingreso que le ayuda para mantenerse, el joven  Alex se siente muy feliz  y agradecido con la institución por  brindarle la oportunidad de seguir adelante con un negocio propio,  el se compromete en  ser un cliente puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Mr. Alex is a new client. He is single and lives in the city of La Paz. He used to work in an institution and was receiving a fixed salary but did not have job security, so he decided to start a new business, that of clothing sales. 

He will invest the loan in the purchase of clothing for Christmas and t-shirts. The client is hardworking. This is the only income he has to support himself. The young man Alex feels very happy and grateful to the institution for providing him the opportunity to get ahead with his own business. He promises to be a punctual and responsible client.

loans.use: invest in purchasing pants and T-shirts.

loans.name: Louena

texts.en:
Louena is twenty one years of age and is married and has no children. Louena owns & operates a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  She has 1 year of experience in this business. Louena needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Louena joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Louena's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Violina

texts.en:
Violina is forty four years of age and is married with five children. Violina owns & operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  She has 1 year of experience in this business. Violina needs a loan of WST 2,700 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Violina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Violina's 5th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make baked goods for sale

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en:
Temukisa is 20 years old.  She is married and has two children.  Temukisa owns and operates a business venture, selling fried food in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business.  

Temukisa is requesting a loan of 2,000 WST in order to purchase the ingredients necessary to make fried food to sell.  She plans to use the profit generated from her business (estimated to be 600 WST per week) to improve and/or expand her business.

In 2009, Temukisa joined SPBD in order to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Temukisa's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients necessary to make fried food to sell.

loans.name: Samuel Ricardo

texts.es: El señor  Samuel  es cliente antiguo que esta en su sexta secuencia de su crédito, Samuel  es viudo tiene una hija, el vive en la ciudad de la paz se dedica en la venta de dvd`s musicales en diferentes zonas de la ciudad de la paz , como ser  zona  sur y  zona central  ambulando por oficinas y en paradas de minibuses y otros lugares comerciales. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de juguetes ya que por temporada navideña se dedica a la  venta  de estos productos, el cliente tiene un puesto por navidad sale a vender en la ciudad de La Paz, Samuel  trabaja sacrificadamente todos los días y según la evaluación económica que se lo realizo tiene un negocio rentable. Manifiesta que pagara como siempre puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Mr. Samuel is an old client who is in his sixth loan cycle. Samuel is a widower and has a daughter. He lives in the city of La Paz and sells music DVDs in various parts of the city of La Paz, such as in the southern and central zones, passing on foot by offices and at minibus stops and other commercial spots. 

He will invest the loan in the purchase of toys since during the Christmas season he devotes himself to selling these products. The client has a stand at Christmas and goes out to sell in the city of La Paz. 

Samuel works devotedly every day of the week and, according to the financial review that was done, he has a profitable business. He states that he will make his payments punctually as he has always done.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of Christmas toy merchandise.

loans.name: Akala

texts.en:
Akala is 59 years old.  She is married and has three children.  Akala owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell.  She has three years of experience in this business.    

Akala is requesting a loan of 2,000 WST to purchase herbicides such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit generated from her business (estimated to be 600 WST per week) to financially support her immediate family members.

In 2009, Akala joined SPBD in order to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Akala's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase herbicides such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Betha De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña Betha Originaria de la comunidad llamada las cuevas Esteli , de oficio comerciante, madre de dos niños. Nos cuenta despues de su primera experiencia vivida atraves del prestamo Kiva que fue muy positiva para ella, hizo una choza nueva en donde vende comida y pasteles hechos por las mujeres de su comunidad ya que ella promueve la participacion de ellas tanto en campo atraves de los huertos, elaboracion de rosquillas como en las chozas donde vende el alimento que producen. 
Ella requiere un segundo credito para comprar material de construccion tales como cemento ,arena ,pago de mano de obra para arreglar mas choza , hacer mejoras a su casa en invertir en mercaderia en general para vender.Por lo pronto piensa seguir incentivando el trabajo comunitario entre las mujeres de su comunidad sacar adelante a su negocio y priorizar la educacion de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Bertha is from a community called Las Cuevas, Estelí.  She’s a merchant and the mother of two children.  She tells us that after her initial experience with Kiva loans which was very positive for her she built a new hut where she sells food and cakes made by women in her community since she promotes their participation both in farming and in making ‘rosquillas’ [traditional pastry] to sell in the huts where the food they make is sold.

She needs a second loan to buy building materials like cement and sand and to pay labor costs to fix up the hut more and to make some home improvements and also to invest in general merchandise to sell.  For the moment, she plans to continue to encourage communal work among the women in her community to move their business forward and to prioritize the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: La señora Lidia vive junto a su esposo Severino y sus cuatro hijos en la zona de alto san isidro que esta ubicado a treinta minutos del centro de la cuidad. Lidia se dedica a la venta de víveres a crédito como ser arroz, fideo, azúcar y aceite. Pero su ella no reparte estos víveres en la cuidad sino que ella los lleva a las localidades y pueblos fuera de la cuidad, por ejemplo al pueblo de los padres de su esposo. Esta actividad que ella tiene es agotadora ya que tienen que realizar un largo viaja hasta estos pueblos y tiene que cargar y descargar la mercadería que lleva.  Por otro lado el Sr. Severino trabaja como albañil contratista. Ellos actualmente viven en casa familiar de los padres pero quieren llegar a ahorrar suficiente dinero para comprar una casa propia.  En esta oportunidad lidia solicita el préstamo de dinero para el incremento de su capital con la compra de mas arroz, fideo y azúcar.
texts.en:
Ms. Lidia lives along with her husband Severino and their four children in the Alto San Isidro area which is located thirty minutes from the downtown area of the city. Lidia devotes herself to selling groceries on credit such as rice, beans, sugar and oil. But she does not distribute these goods in the city but rather carries them to towns and localities outside the city, for example, the town where her husband's parents live. This business of hers is exhausting since she must make long trips to these towns and must load and unload the merchandise she carries. Her husband Mr. Severino works as a construction worker for hire. They currently live in the family home of her parents but would like to save up enough money to be able to buy their own home. 

At this time Lidia requests the loan for increasing her capital with the purchase of more rice, beans and sugar.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Iupeli

texts.en:
Iupeli is 19 years old.  She is married and has one child.  Iupeli owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro to sell.  She has one year of experience in this business.    

Iupeli is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase herbicides such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit generated from her business (estimated to be 500 WST per week) to improve and/or expand her business.

In 2011, Iupeli joined SPBD in order to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Iupeli's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase herbicides such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Jiovanna Mirian

texts.es: La señora Jiovanna vive en la casa de su suegro, cuenta con una tienda de barrio hace 5 años y una pequeña peluquería, vive con sus tres hijos, pocas veces recibe apoyo de su pareja puesto que el sr. Trabaja en provincia y llega poco a su domicilio, con esta actividad ella sola mantiene el hogar,  el crédito lo necesita para poner abarrotes en su tienda y mejorar sus ingresos, la zona donde vende y vive es periurbana, el sector es de alto comercio ya que existen varias construcciones aledañas, y esta es la única tienda de barrio por la zona y ella tiene mucha venta por tal motivo desea surtir su tienda, la Sra.se siente agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Ms. Jiovanna lives in her father-in-law's home and has a neighborhood grocery store which she's had for five years and a small beauty salon. She lives with her three children and receives support from her partner infrequently since he works in the province and does not get home much. With this business she supports the household on her own. 

She needs the loan to stock her store with groceries and improve her income. The area where she sells and lives is semi-urban. The zone is largely commercial as there are various buildings around the area. This is the only neighborhood grocery store in the area and she gets a lot of sales, and so she wishes to stock her shop. 

She is grateful for the opportunity she is being given.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for her shop such as rice, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Floridalma

texts.es:
Floridalma, tiene 42 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijas de 5, 11 y 18 años de edad, vive en las Brisas del Negrito, Yoro junto a su esposo quien es comerciante también.

Doña Floridalma hace 3 años decidió establecer una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser maíz, arroz, manteca, café, pan, especies, refrescos, churros, verduras y otros. Es una señora muy trabajadora atiende a sus clientes todo el día. Anteriormente ella trabajaba como niñera en un Kínder y  con el fin de obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir gastos de educación de sus hijas, decidió este negocio.
Ha solicitado este préstamo de L.10,000 para surtir mas sus negocio en productos alimenticios como granos básicos, pan, café, churros, manteca y verduras.
Su gran motivación es generar ingresos para educar a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Floridalma, 42, is married and has three daughters who are 5, 11 and 18 years old.  She lives in Brisas del Negrito, Yoro with her husband who is also a merchant.

Floridalma opened a grocery store three years ago where she sells basic staple items like corn, rice, lard, coffee, bread, spices, soft-drinks, snacks, vegetables and others.  She is a very hardworking woman who tends to her customers all day.  She used to work as a nanny at a Kindergarten and in order to earn better income for her daughters’ education costs she decided on this business.

She has requested a L.10,000 loan to better stock her store with foodstuffs like basic grains, bread, coffee, snacks, lard and vegetables.  Her great motivation is to generate income to educate her daughters.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
Epenesa is 53 years old.  She is married and has six children.  Epenesa is starting a business venture, planting and harvesting taro to sell.  

Epenesa is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST in order to purchase herbicides such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 WST per week) to improve and/or expand her business.

In 2011, Epenesa joined SPBD in order to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Epenesa's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase herbicides such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es: La Sra. Eulogia es cliente desde hace dos años, ella se dedica a la venta de mantas de alpaca y vicuña, ella compra por kilos la lana en bruto y después lo hila, posteriormente da a tejer lo cual paga en mano de obra, la señora vive con el esposo que trabaja en un taller de carpintería, ellos tienen tres hijos de los cuales dos ya colaboran en el hogar a la vez que estudian, el hijo menor es quien continua estudiando y acompaña a su mama, es una familia muy unida y con el esfuerzo de ambos construyeron su vivienda propia, con el dinero del crédito comprara lana ya que tiene un pedido que entregar de mantas, La Sra. Eulogia se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Ms. Eulogia has been a client for two years. She devotes herself to selling blankets made of alpaca and vicuña wool. She buys the unprocessed wool in kilos and then spins it, and then gives it to be woven and pays for the labor. She lives with her husband who works in a carpentry shop. They have three children of whom two now help out at home while they also go to school. The youngest child is the one who is still in school and accompanies his mom. It is a very close-knit family and through both their efforts they built their own housing. With the money from the loan she will purchase wool since she has an order to fill for blankets. Ms. Eulogia is happy and grateful to the institution for the support she has been given.

loans.use: to purchase wool.

loans.name: Talaloa

texts.en:
Talaloa is 60 years old.  She is married and has six children.  Talaloa owns and operates a business venture, selling fried food in the local community.  She has two years of experience in this business.    

Talaloa is requesting a loan of 1,500 WST in order to purchase the ingredients necessary to make the fried food she sells.  She plans to use the profit generated from her business (estimated to be 300 WST per week) to improve and/or expand her business.

In 2010, Talaloa joined SPBD in order to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Talaloa's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients necessary to make fried food to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: La señora Alicia es cliente nueva de la institución ella vive en la zona de bajo Seguencoma en la casa de sus suegros ella tiene una tienda de barrio la cual adquirió hace un año, con lo cual se dedica a mantener a su familia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería por las fiestas de fin de año para surtir su tienda, comprando abarrotes, dulces, galletas y refrescos y así surtir su tienda, es una joven emprendedora con ganas de superación, con deseos de salir adelante para mejorar  la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en: Alicia is a new member of the insitution. She lives in her mother and father-in-law's home below the Seguecome area. She has had a grocery store in the neighborhood for a year now. She is able to maintain her family with this store. She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise to stock up her store such as groceries, candies, cookies, and soda. She is a young entrepreneur with a drive to better herself in order to improve her's and her family's quality of life

loans.use: buy merchandise to stock up her grocery store and sodas.

loans.name: Agalelei

texts.en:
Agalelei is thirty years of age and married with four children. She has owned a business selling general farm supplies and equipment to local farmers  for two years. Agalelei needs a loan of WST $1,500 to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Agalelei joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Agalelei's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is sixty four years old and a widow with six children. She has owned a business selling general farm supplies and equipment to local farmers for  two years. Naomi needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase general agricultural supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Naomi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Naomi's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general agricultural supplies and equipment
