loans.name: Rosa Etelvina

texts.es:
Rosa Etelvina  tiene 63 años de edad, ella vive en Ica, Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente. En su tiempo libre disfruta de ver películas sobre todo si son de comedia;  Rosa estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar enfermería. Ella es madre soltera y tiene un hijo el cual se encuentra estudiando en la universidad.

"Rosa se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, desde hace ya 20 años, le dedica a este trabajo 5 horas al día, una amiga la animo ya. En un día Rosa puede atender 15 clientes y esto le permite ganar hasta S/. 50 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar hasta S/.120 lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales para el hogar  y para  invertir en el negocio, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy carismática. 

Rosa está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda brindada podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda,  mejora podrá ayudarle a va tener una mejor calidad de vida y sobre todo un mejor ambiente para atender a sus clientes, con esta mejora podrá tener más ingresos ella nos dice que su gran sueño y que va seguir luchando, porque ella nos dice que el ser viejo no existe solo es viejo que que se sienta asi, ella tiene el espiritu joven y seguira ahorrando para lograr su gran sueño:” Ver a su hijo un profesional."porque es lo mas valioso que le puede heredar.
texts.en:
Rosa Etelvina is 63 years old, she lives in Ica, Peru. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert, about four hours south of Lima, the capital of the country, and is acclaimed by the Peruvians as "La Tierra del Sol." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.0 in 2007 and a 6.9 in 2011), production of grapes, asparagus and olives, and perhaps above all, as the source of the national traditional drink of Peru, the “Pisco.” In this warm and dry climate you will find Rosa’s home and clientele.

In her spare time she enjoys watching movies--especially comedies. Rosa studied until the fifth year of secondary school, but would very much like to study nursing. She is a single mother with a son who is studying at university. 

Rosa has been selling beauty products for 20 years. She works five hours per day, and a friend to help her. In a day Rosa can serve fifteen customers, allowing her to earn as much as 50 PEN, and on a good day she can earn up to 120 PEN, helping her to pay additional household expenses and reinvest in her business.  She believes that she is doing so well with her business because she is charismatic. 

Rosa is very thankful for the Kiva lenders and their help with which she can make home improvements, improve her quality of life, and above all create a better environment in which to serve her customers. With these improvements she may yield more income, she tells us this is her greatest dream and what she will go on fighting for, because she says that old age does not exist on its own—one is only old when one feels old. Rosa has a young spirit and will continue saving to achieve her dream: "To see your son as a professional,” for this is the most valuable thing that can be inherited.

loans.use: to make improvements in her life.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es una mujer de 41 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Nasca, Ica, Peru. Nazca es una ciudad cuyos pobladores son muy generosos y hospitalarios, tiene un legado en cuanto a cultura, como peruanos estamos muy orgullosos de esta ciudad ya que alberga las líneas de nazca, estas han sido dibujadas en un extenso campo y que eran utilizadas por la cultura nasca para la agricultura ya que eran una especie de calendario en donde ellos podían saber cuando era la época de lluvia, debido a estas majestuosas líneas esta ciudad alberga cada año infinidad de turistas; Francisca es una mujer muy luchadora ella es madre soltera y como toda mujer peruana saca a sus hijos cuyas edades comprenden 23, 18, 17 años los tres están estudiando en la universidad, Francisca nos dice que quiere que sus hijos sean mejor que ella y sobre todo porque los estudios es la mejor herencia que les puede dejar.

Francisca antes de tener su negocio se dedicaba a lavar ropa de casa en casa era un trabajo muy duro pero con lo que ganaba pudo ahorrar y asi pudo tener su trabajo al cual  se dedica actualmente, el cual es la venta de pan en su triciclo por las calles de la ciudad donde vive, 	ella aprendió este oficio de su madre, ya que ella también se dedica a la venta de pan, Francisca se levanta muy temprano para realizar su labor, desde las 4:00 am ella esta trabajando para poder vender todo su producto, ella puede ganar hasta s/. 50 semanales pero en un muy buen día puede ganar hasta S. 100, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque vende productos de calidad, tiene un trato amable y porque Dios guía su trabajo.

Actualmente Francisca esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que podrá comprar gracias al apoyo brindado un triciclo, con esta mejora ella podrá realizar mejor su trabajo ya que tendrá una herramienta nueva para realizar su labor y podrá dirigirse a mas sitios para vender sus productos, con ello ahorrara dinero para poder cumplir su sueño mas anhelado: “Hacer profesionales a sus Hijos”.
texts.en:
Francisca, 41, lives in Nasca, Ica, Peru, a city whose people are very generous and hospitable.  There is a legend about its culture.  As Peruvians, we are very proud of this city since this is where the Nazca lines are found.  They were drawn in a big field and were used by the Nasca culture for farming since they were a type of calendar where the people could figure out when the rainy season would be.  Because of these majestic lines many many tourists come. 

 Francisca is a woman who struggles.  She is a single mother and as with all Peruvian women, she strives for her children (23, 18 and 17).  The three are studying at the university.  Francisca tells us that she wants her children to be better educated and especially because their studies are the best inheritance that she can leave for them.

Before Francisca had her business she used to wash laundry in different houses.  It was very hard work but she was able to save from what she earned and so have her work that she has now, selling bread on her tricycle on the streets of the city where she lives.  Francisca rises very early to do her work, from 4:00 am she is already working so that she can sell all of her product.  She can earn up to .50 sols weekly but on a good day, she can earn up to 100 sols.  She believes that she is doing well because she sells quality bread, she is very friendly, and because God guides her in her work.

Now Francisca is very thankful for the Kiva loan since she would like to have their support to buy a tricycle.  With this improvement she could do better work since she needs to have some new equipment to be able to go to more places to sell the bread.  This way she could save money to fulfill her biggest dream: “Her children would become professionals”.

loans.use: to buy a tricycle

loans.name: Rosa Narciza

texts.es:
Rosa Narcisa  tiene 50 años de edad, ella vive en Ica, Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente.

En su tiempo libre disfruta de leer;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que le gusta mucho son los “Tallarines Rojos”. Rosa estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar  secretariado. Ella es casada, su esposo también trabaja muy duro para salir adelante, el trabaja  transportando  algas marinas, Rosa nos dice que él es su brazo derecho y aunque  algunos días no están juntos debido al trabajo de su esposo ellos siempre están unidos y se apoyan en todo, juntos tienen 2 hijos cuyas edades comprenden entre 24 y 19 años a los cuales con esfuerzo y sacrifico están sacando adelante ya que se encuentran en la universidad.	

Rosa se dedica al venta de bebidas (gaseosas, agua, etc.),  se dedica a este trabajo 6 horas diarias, su padre la animo a tener esta clase de negocio. En un día Rosa puede atender  alrededor de  15 a 20 clientes diariamente y esto le permite ganar hasta S/. 90 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar  hasta S/.660  lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales para los gastos del hogar  y para  invertir en el negocio, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio debido al  buen trato que tiene con sus clientes y por el carisma que tiene.

Esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda brindada podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio, esta mejora podrá ayudarle a tener  más variedad de productos para ofrecer y con ello  tener mejores ingresos y así poder en algunos meses  ahorrar para poder cumplir  su gran sueño: “Tener una Bodega".
texts.en:
Rosa Narcisa is 50 years old. She lives in Ica, Peru. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert, around four hours south of Lima, the country's capital. Ica is celebrated by Peruvians as "La Tierra del Sol" ["The Land of the Sun"]. It is also known for its frequent earthquakes (8.0 in 2007 and 6.9 in 2011), its production of grapes, asparagus and olives, and perhaps above all, as the source of the traditional national beverage of Peru: pisco. The borrower's home and business are located in this hot and arid place. 

In her free time, she likes to read. As is well known, Peru is noted for having the most delicious food in the world, and one of the dishes that Rosa likes a lot is "Tallarines Rojos” ["Red Noodles"]. Rosa attended school up to the fifth year of secondary school. She would have liked to study to become a secretary. She is married, and her husband also works very hard to get ahead. He works transporting marine plants. Rosa reports that he is her "right arm," and although some days they are not together due to her husband's work, they are always united and support each other in everything. Together they have 2 children, aged 24 and 19, whom they are helping to get ahead with great effort and sacrifice: both are studying at the university. 

Rosa works selling beverages (soft drinks, water, etc.). She dedicates herself to this work for 6 hours each day. Her father inspired her to go into this type of business. In one day, Rosa can serve approximately 15 to 20 customers, and this allows her to earn some 90 Peruvian soles per day; on a good day she can earn up to 660 soles. This helps her take care of some extra household expenses and also invest in her business. She believes that her business is going well for her thanks to the good treatment she gives her customers as well as her friendly personality. 

She is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since with the help provided to her she will be able to buy merchandise for her business. This improvement will help her offer a greater variety of products and earn a better income. Thus, in a few months, she will be able to save up enough to fulfill her great dream: opening her own store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny tiene 37 años de edad, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora vive en la ciudad de nazca, famoso Nazca,  Perú. La ciudad es famosa por la legendaria Líneas de Nazca, una serie de antiguos, inmenso e inexplicable geoglifos grabados en el desierto que rodea la ciudad, generalmente atribuidos a la cultura Nazca, que habitaron en la región de 300 a 800 AD. Como tal, la ciudad atrae a una cantidad considerable de turismo. Pero Nazca también es conocida por su gente trabajadora, que han conservado a pesar de los frecuentes terremotos, tsunamis, y un alto nivel de pobreza en la región, es madre, tiene 4 hijos cuyas edades comprenden entre 17, 15, 12 y 3 años, los tres mayores cursan actualmente educación secundaria y el menor aun no va a la escuela pero es muy travieso, ella dice que le saca canas verdes.

 Marleny  se dedica actualmente a su negocio, el cual consiste en la venta de Desayunos, bebidas y raspadillas (hielo desmenuzado al cual se le añade jarabes de dulce a base de frutas), le dedica a su negocio 8 horas diarias, y en un día puede ganar hasta S/.50 y en un día muy bueno puede ganar hasta S/. 100, 	ella  se animo a tener este tipo de negocio porque quería trabajar en su domicilio para poder estar al pendiente de sus hijos en especial del más pequeño. 	

Marleny está muy agradecida por el apoyo otorgado por los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a esta ayuda ella podrá comprar insumos (abarrotes,verduras, etc) para agregar a su negocio la venta de comida en las noches, con esta mejora ella podrá obtener mayores ingresos y tener más variedad de productos que ofrecer, y más clientes, con esta mejora ella tendrá mejores ingresos y podrá ahorrar y cumplir su gran sueño:”Tener su propio local”.
texts.en:
Marleny is 37 years old. She is a very hard-working woman who lives in the famous city of Nazca, Peru. This city is famous for the legendary Nazca Lines, a series of ancient, immense and inexplicable hieroglyphics carved into the desert which surrounds the city. They are generally attributed to the people of the Nazca culture, who inhabited the region from 300 to 800 AD. Because of this, the city attracts a large number of tourists. However, Nazca is also known for its hard-working people, who have survived in spite of frequent earthquakes, tsunamis, and a high poverty rate in the region. Marleny is a mother with 4 children, aged 17, 15, 12 and 3. The three older children are currently in secondary school, and the youngest does not go to school yet, but he is very mischievous; she says that "le saca canas verdes" [he gives her green hairs instead of gray hairs].

Marleny is currently running a business selling breakfasts, beverages and raspadillas (shaved ice with added sweet fruit-based syrups). She works at her business 8 hours each day, and in one day she might make 50 Peruvian soles, or on a very good day up to 100 soles. She was inspired to open this type of business because she wanted to work at home, so she could watch over her children, especially the youngest. 

Marleny is very grateful for the support provided by the Kiva lenders, since thanks to this help, she will be able to buy supplies (groceries, vegetables, etc.) to expand her business by offering food in the evenings. With this improvement, she will be able to obtain a better income, offer a greater variety of products, and attract more customers. With this she will have better earnings and be able to save up to fulfill her great dream: having her own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy supplies (groceries, vegetables).

texts.en:
Faatupu is fifty seven years old and is married with five children. Faatupu owns and operates a business venture selling fried foods in the local community.  She has five years of experience in this business. Faatupu needs a loan of WST $2,750 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2006, Faatupu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Faatupu's 6th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale.

loans.name: Sipiu

texts.en:
Sipiu is twenty one years of age and is married with two children. Sipiu owns and operates a business venture selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has three years of experience in this business. Sipiu needs a loan of WST $2,000 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Sipiu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Sipiu's 4th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional daily use products to sell.

loans.name: Leotele

texts.en:
Leotele is thirty eight years old and is married with four children. Leotele owns and operates a business venture selling specialty handwoven products to tourists and local community members. She has two years of experience in this business. Leotele needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase raw materials to make mats and mattresses. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Leotele joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Leotele's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make mats and mattresses.

loans.name: Tausili

texts.en:
Tausili is forty mine years old and is married with four children. Tausili owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has two years of experience in this business. Tausili needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase weedkillers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2010, Tausili joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Tausili's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weedkillers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Vaiola

texts.en:
Vaiola is 37 years of age and a widow with one child. She owns and operates a business venture of selling soft drinkts to her village community. She has run this business for one year. Vaiola needs a loan of $1,000 WST to purchase codial , raros ,sugar and plastic cups. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 WST per week) to improve and expand the business.
In 2011, Vaiola joined Kiva partner SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Vaiola's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase codial , raros ,sugar and plastic cups

loans.name: Senia

texts.en:
Senia is 40 years old and is married with five children. Senia sells baked goods in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business. Senia needs a loan of 1,500 talas to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Senia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Senia's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Aglow

texts.en:
Aglow is 25 years old and is married with one child. Aglow sells baked goods in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business.    Aglow needs a loan of 1,500 talas to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Aglow joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Aglow's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Pasami

texts.en:
Pasami is 42 years of age and is married with four children. Pasami sells fried foods in the local community. She has one year of experience in this business. Pasami needs a loan of 1,000 talas to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Pasami joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Pasami's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Ofeira

texts.en:
Ofeira is thirty-seven years of age and is married with four children.

Ofeira owns and operates a business venture sewing clothes to sell to her villages . She has one year of experience in this business. Ofeira needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase materials , threads and needles.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Ofeira joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Ofeira's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase materials, threads and needles

loans.name: Egla

texts.en: Egla is a married woman. She has two children with ages ranging between 8 and 15 years old. She describes herself to be polite. She operates a retail store where she sells maize. She has been involved in this business for four years. In addition, she also sells tea to add her income. Her business is located within her home area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of maize. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more maize. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. In the next five future, she hopes she will run another maize store in a neighboring town.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon, 59 years old, is married and has five children ranging from 18 to 29 years old. He describes himself as a courageous man. He has been selling men and ladies' suits and uniforms to businessmen, civil servants and teachers. His business challenge is insufficient funds. He will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy more clothing materials. In the next five years, Simon hopes to run at least two clothes store.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Ujamaa Ugogo Group

texts.en:
Lambertha is a 35-year-old mother of four children, three of whom attend secondary school. She has been growing coffee, maize, beans and cassava for over 25 years. She is facing farming problems due to lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.
Lambertha is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and insecticides. She is working hard with the aim of being able to pay for food, clothes and medical expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is a married woman. She has four children whose ages range from 14 to 28. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. 

Zipporah operates a retail store where she sells cereals such as maize, beans, black beans etc. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a conducive area. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more cereals such as maize, beans and black beans. Her business goal is to diversify her cereal store within five years.

loans.use: To buy more cereals such as maize, beans and black beans.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 34-year-old married man. He has 2 children, ages 3 and 7. He describes himself to be a determined man. He operates a butcher shop where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a busy market. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the shortage of meat. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more meat for selling. His business goal is to run the biggest butcher shop within his town area within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more meat for selling.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Amani Matekela Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a 62-year-old married man with five children, one of whom attends secondary school. He is a hardworking farmer who has produced cassava, beans, maize and coffee for over 33 years. He has agricultural problems due to crop diseases and lack of fertilizers.
Joseph is requesting a loan for working capital to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. His vision for the next five years is to expand his scale of production from 8 to 17 acres so that he can generate more income to pay for school fees, medical expenses and repairs to the family home.
In the photograph there are 17 members of the group, but only 14 members have taken a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase insecticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stones for selling.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a 42-year-old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 17 years. He describes himself to be determined man. He operates a van with which he manages transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. In addition, he also sells chickens. His business is located at a busy market. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more chickens to boost his chicken business. His business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to boost his chicken business.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Matuhi Group

texts.en:
Manufred is a 36-year-old father of five children, four of whom attend primary school. He is a good farmer who has been growing maize, beans, coffee and cassava for over 22 years. He works hard while earning a low income due to crop diseases and lack of fertilizers.
Manufred is seeking funds to purchase insecticides and fertilizers for his growing crops. He dreams of expanding his production from 7 to 16 acres in the next five years in order to generate more income to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 49-year-old man who lives in Sana'a ,Yemen. He is a father of seven sons and four daughters. He is a distributor who sells and distributes different sweets. He is not literate but has 20 years of experience in this field.
Mohammed started his business by opening a small sweets bakery with a small amount of capital. As his business was small and there was no other bakery in the area, he attracted customers by making tasty sweets for them. He distributes his goods to many different groceries with a wheelbarrow. He not only uses his business as a source of income but for social purposes such as helping the poor by providing his sweets, especially during festivals and weddings seasons. Recently, Mohammed's business has decreased leading to a decrease in his profits. He has had to stop providing sweets for poor people because of the current bad situation which Yemen faces.
Mohammed is requesting a loan of 300,000 YER from Kiva partner AMB in order to purchase materials for his business. In this way he hopes to increase his profits and continue providing sweets at social occasions. In the future, Mohammed plans to open a big sweet factory in order to distribute his goods around Yemen's provinces. He would also like to buy a new lorry to use instead of his wheelbarrow.

loans.use: to purchase some related materials to his business of sweets

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is a 39-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be focused and hardworking. She operates a food stall where she sells food, snacks, tea, etc. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a fast growing area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve her food stall. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy cereals, flour, rice, salt and cooking oil.  Her business goal is to run a hotel within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy cereals, flour, rice, salt and cooking oil for cooking.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья с мужем и дочерью живет в Запорожье. Она занимается рыночным предпринимательством, торгуя разными товарами в розницу на Крытом рынке в своем родном городе. Наталья реализует тапочки, подарочные наборы и декоративные украшения. На рынке у нее немного конкурентов, что только способствует развитию бизнеса. У Натальи – два прилавка. Чистый доход составляет 8 000 гривен.  

Наталья планирует вложить кредит в 10 000 гривен в приобретение дополнительного количества тапочек для последующей реализации. Тапочки всегда хорошо продаются в холодное время года, поэтому Наталья хотела бы не упустить возможность заработать дополнительные средства в сезон. В следующей году Наталья планирует еще одно торговое место, если удастся получить дополнительную прибыль от реализации товара.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Natalya, her husband, and her daughter live in Zaporozhye, Ukraine.  She sells various items at the indoor market in her hometown. Natalya sells slippers, gift sets, and decorative knickknacks. In the market she has very little competition, which helps her to develop her business. Natalya has two shops. Her net income amounts to 8,000 hryvnia.

Natalya plans to invest the money from a 10,000 hryvnia loan in purchasing more slippers for resale. Slippers always sell well in the cold season, so Natalya would not like to miss the opportunity to earn extra money during the season. Next year, Natalya plans on opening another retail space if she can earn enough extra income from sales.

loans.use: to buy more slippers to sell during winter.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Changanyikeni Buruma Group

texts.en:
Paskal is a 42-year-old father of five children. Three of them attend secondary school. He is doing well, and has been growing maize, beans, cassava and coffee for over 20 years. He experiences agricultural problems including crop diseases and lack of fertilizers.

Paskal is looking for more funds to pay for insecticides and fertilizers. In the coming five years, he dreams of boosting his production from 8 to 17 acres. With the additional income he will pay school fees and cover medical expenses.

loans.use: To purchase insectides and fertilizers?

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 31-year-old single man. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a motorcycle, providing motorcycle transportation. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a competitive area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the rainy season, as roads are impassible. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts. Joseph's business goal is to own at least five motorcycles within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.ru:
Виталий живет в селе Приветное. Он занимается сельским хозяйством вместе со своей семьей. У него есть жена и двое сыновей. На 45 сотках земли Виталий выращивает ранние овощи: 5 000 помидор, 20 000 кустов капусты, 10 000 лука, 15 000 перца. Огородничеством занимается уже 10 лет. На данный момент в хозяйство вложено около 60 000 гривен.  

Виталий и его семья живет за счет своего бизнеса. Чем больше средств они вкладывают в содержание теплиц и уход за урожаем, тем качественнее и ранее они получают свой урожай. Виталий обратился к КИВА за кредитом в размере 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить семена, пленку, удобрения, агроволокно, а также установить отопление в теплицах и покрыть транспортные расходы, связанные с бизнесом.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Vitaliy lives in the village Privetnoye. He works with agriculture together with his family. He has a wife and two sons. On his 45 acres of land Vitaliy grows vegetables: 5 000 tomatoes, 20 000 cabbage bushes, 10 000 onions and 15 000 peppers. 

Vitaliy has worked with vegetable farming for 10 years. Up until now he has invested around 60 000 hryvnia in the farm. He and his family live off their business. The more money they invest in the maintenance of greenhouses and care for crops, the better and earlier they get their crops. 

Vitaliy turned to Kiva for a loan in the amount of 15 000 hrvynia in order to buy seeds, tape, fertilizer, agricultural fabric (to cover plants to protect them from insects, prevent weeds etc), and also to install heating in the greenhouses and cover transportation costs associated with the business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, tape, fertilizer and agricultural fabric, and to install heating in the greenhouses and cover transportation costs associated with the business

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила – вдова. У нее есть двое взрослых детей. Людмила – из Мелитополя. Она работает на местном Районном рынке, торгует женской одеждой: кофтами, футболками, платьями. Людмила очень трудолюбивая. Она занимается предпринимательством уже 15 лет. На данный момент у нее 20 000 гривен оборотного капитала. 

Людмиле необходим кредит КИВА  в размере 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить женскую одежду к сезону. Она хотела бы увеличить ассортимент и, реализовав его, получить дополнительную прибыль.  За счет получения дополнительной прибыли Людмила хотела бы провести автономное отопление в своей квартире. Более того, Людмиле нравится работать с этой группой товаров, поэтому она планирует и дальше вкладывать полученные от реализации средства в дальнейшее развитие своего дела. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Ludmila is a widow. She has two grown children. Ludmila is from Melitopol. She works at the local market selling women's clothing: sweaters, shirts, dresses. Lyudmila is very hardworking. She has been in business for fifteen years. At the moment, her working capital is 20,000 hryvnia. 

Ludmila needs a Kiva loan of 10,000 hryvnia to buy women's clothes for the season. She would like to increase the variety she carries and thereby earn extra income. With the profit she makes, Ludmila would like to install a heating system in her apartment. Moreover, Ludmila enjoys working with these products, so she plans to continue to invest funds she receives from sales to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal women's clothing.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en: Everlyne is a single woman.  She has no children yet. She describes herself to be a courageous woman. She operates a boutique where she sells clothes, shoes, weaves, braids and hair oil. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a busy market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of items sold. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more shoes, clothes and weaves. Her business goal is to run a bigger boutique within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy weaves, shoes and clothes for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an oven.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Safina Buruma Group

texts.en:
Amos is a 41-year-old father of seven children. Three of them attend secondary school. For the past twenty years, Amos has grown maize, beans, coffee and cassava. He faces a problem of lack of fertilisers and insecticides. 

Amos believes that in the coming five years, he will be able to expand his crop production from 8 to 18 acres. This will allow him to generate more income which he will use to purchase clothes and food as well as to cover medical expenses.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 14 years to 30 years. She describes herself as a polite woman. She operates a grocery stall where she sells tomatoes, cabbages and bananas. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located near a murram (gravel) road and her primary customers are residents in her home area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the shortage of sources of obtaining cabbages during the sunny season. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more cabbages. Hellan's business goal is to be a wholesaler of cabbages within 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase more cabbages.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 18 years to 26 years. She describes herself to be a kind woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells onions and tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. In addition, she also sells small fish commonly known as ''omena''. Her primary customers are residents in her home area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of traveling when getting onions and tomatoes for selling. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more onions and tomatoes. Her business goal is to be selling tomatoes and onions wholesale within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Zadock

texts.en: Zadock is a single man. He has no children yet. He describes himself to be a promising man. He operates a tailoring shop where he sells trousers, suits and materials. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a busy market. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high prices of materials used for sewing. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase an overlock machine (serger). His business goal is to run a tailoring school within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy an overlock machine.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Maarifa Mitawa Group

texts.en:
Sabas is a 32-year-old father of one child who attends primary school. He is hardworking and has been producing maize, cassava, beans and coffee for over seven years. He has problems due to crop diseases and lack of fertilizers.
Sabas is looking for a loan to purchase fertilizers and insecticides. He also wishes to expand his scale of production in the next five years from 10 to 17 acres in expectation of earning more income.

loans.use: to purchase insecticides, fertilizers and gum boots.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a 30-year-old married man. He has two children who are four and six years old. He describes himself as honest and effective.

Samson operates a retail shop where he sells cooking oil, rice, flour, sugar etc. He has been involved in this business for a year. His business is located near a busy road and his primary customers are residents of neighboring villages. He says his biggest business challenge is having insufficient funds to improve the retail shop. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy baking flour, milk and cooking oil. His business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy baking flour, milk and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Khamis is a 58-year and married. He has been into poultry farming   business for the last six months. 

He is requesting for his first loan with KADET ltd of kes 20,000. He plans to use the loan to purchase more chicken for rearing on his farm. The proceeds from the business will be used to expand his business and repay his loan. 

He hopes are to expand and excel in this business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks.

loans.name: Kiwambi Jiimarishe Buruma Group

texts.en:
Thomas is a 38-year-old father of five children, two of whom attend secondary school. He has been working in farming producing maize, beans, cassava and coffee for over 12 years. He is facing farming problems due to lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.
Thomas is looking for more capital to pay for insecticides and fertilizers. In the next five years he wishes to increase production from 6 to 13 acres in expectation of earning more income.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a single woman. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a beauty salon where she provides services of plaiting and blowdrying  and also sells hair oil. She has been involved in this business for four years and employs two staff members. Her business is located in a convenient and conducive area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate labour. 
Gladys will use her loan of 20,000 KES to buy weaves, hair oil and braids. Her business goal is to run at least two salons within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy weaves, hair oil and braids.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more kale, tomatoes, cabbages and potatoes.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is a 27-year-old married woman. She has 2 children aged two and five. She describes herself as hardworking, patient and tolerant. 

Sandra operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for a year. Her business is located in a very busy and competitive area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy two bales of clothes. Her business goal is to be the best supplier of clothes and run a boutique within five years.

loans.use: To buy two bales of clothes.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a 28-year-old married woman. She has three children between one and nine years old. She describes herself as an honest woman. 

Judy operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a densely populated area and she has both repeat and new customers. She says her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the retail store. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bags of maize.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is a 51-year-old married with seven children. She has been selling cereals for the past 30 years and the business is doing great. 

She was introduced to KADET ltd and this is her first loan. She plans to use the loan to purchase more peanuts, beans and maize to supply to her customers. With the anticipated profits she will repay her loan and use the rest to expand her business. 

In the future, she hopes to have a bigger cereals store.

loans.use: to purchase more peanuts, beans and maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more passion fruits.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 56-year-old, married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from fifteen to thirty years. She describes herself to be a visionary woman. She operates a retail store where she sells cereals such as beans, maize, groundnuts and also onions. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located at a busy market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of cereals sold.  

Rosemary will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy maize and groundnuts.  Her business goal is to expand her retail store and venture into providing rental houses services within five years.

loans.use: to buy more maize and groundnuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, cooking oil, maize flour and baking flour.

loans.name: Nyatindo

texts.en: Nyatindo is a married man who has three children ranging from two to eleven years of age. He describes himself as a religious man. For the last three years, his primary business activity has been transportation services. His business challenge is the high price of fuel. He will use the requested loan of KES 20,000 to buy spare parts for his motorbike. In the next five years, Nyatindo hopes and plans to run a spare parts retail shop and to own at least three motorbikes.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motorbike.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida lives in Changamwe, Kenya. She is married and has four children, one of whom is in school. She owns a retail shop, a business she has run for five years. 

Frida is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase sugar, flours, cereals, and other items to sell. The main challenges she faces are the scarcity and high cost of products. 

She looks forward to setting up a wholesale business in the future. She will use the extra income to open other businesses.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, flours, cereals, and other grocery items.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is married and has three children ranging from one to seven years of age. He is a patient man. His primary business activity has been providing transportation services. His business is located in a busy and densely populated urban area. He describes his business challenge as occasionally low purchasing power. He will use the requested loan of KES 20,000 to supplement his savings so he can buy another motorbike. Kennedy's hope and goal is to own at least seven motorbikes in the next five years to increase his transportation business.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en: Ezekiel is a married man. He has no children yet. He describes himself as a prayerful man. His primary activity is transportation, and he has been in this business for the last two years. His business challenge is the increasing cost of maintenance. He will use the requested loan of KES 20,000 to buy spare parts for the motorbike and to pay for the garage. In the next five years, Ezekiel plans and hopes to diversify his business by expanding his transportation services, having a garage, and running a retail shop that sells spare parts.

loans.use: to pay for garage costs and to purchase motorbike spare parts.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 34-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 8 years to 14 years. She describes herself as a hardworking and industrious woman. 

She operates a retail shop where she sells products such as sugar, flour, tea leaves, milk, etc. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located a shopping center. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as high prices of the products she sells. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more sugar, salt, flour, etc. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, flour, etc.

loans.name: Rosalina Patricia

texts.es:
Rosalina, se dedica a la venta de ropa, vive con su esposo, tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad, los dos trabajan en el hogar, y se ayudan mutuamente para cubrir los gastos y necesidades del hogar. Ella trabaja en el negocio todos los días, este negocio está ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, es un lugar donde transitan muchos clientes.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa para la temporada navideña, blusas, faldas, camisas, vestidos, esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar el inventario de su negocio, con la intención de ofrecer a los clientes mejores prendas de vestir.
La aspiración de Rosalina es crecer en el comercio y mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosalina works selling clothing. She lives with her husband and has a 6-year-old child. Both of them work at home, and they help each other cover the household expenses and necessities. She works in her business every day. This business is located in the city center, in a place where many customers go by. 

Currently, she is requesting a loan to buy clothing for the holiday season: blouses, skirts, shirts and suits. This investment will help her improve the inventory of her business, with the aim of offering her customers better clothing.

Rosalina's aspiration is to grow in her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, shirts and suits.

loans.name: Reina Admit

texts.es:
Reina, se dedica a la venta de tamales de elote, riguas, atol, sopas de mondongo, estos son los productos que ella vende a los clientes, ella es madre soltera, sus dos hijos tienen 20 y 26 años de edad, a Reina fue su madre quien le enseño a trabajar, su horario es de 7:00am a 7:00pm, lleva 18 años en esta actividad.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de elotes en redes, manteca, leña, condimentos y los preparativos para la sopa, con este financiamiento incrementara la producción de sus alimentos y generara mayores ganancias.
El objetvio de ella es ser buena cliente con este préstamo, crecer y pagar las deudas.
texts.en:
Reina works selling corn tamales, corn pies called riguas, a corn drink called atol, and tripe soup. She is a single mother and her two children are 20 and 26 years old. Her mother taught Reina how to do this work. Her working day is from 7:00am until 7:00pm, and she has been doing this for 18 years.
She is currently requesting a loan to buy corn, butter, wood, spices, and the the ingredients for the soup. With this financing, she will increase her food production and generate better profits. 
Her goal is to be a good loan borrower, grow, and pay her debts.

loans.use: to buy corn, butter, wood, and spices.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua lives in Changamwe and is employed. He is married and has four children; one of whom is in school. Joshua learned of Milango from his friends. He is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to pay for his children's school fees. His main goal is to provide education to his children.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima - Jauja Group

texts.es:
La señora MERCEDES ROSA de 46 años de edad madre soltera con 01 hijo   menor de edad  en etapa escolar. Es socia de la  alcancía comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima - Jauja”.

Actualmente se dedica a la compra y venta de granos como maíz, habas, cebada, etc. El préstamo solicito para la compra de más productos. Así pueda venderlas en la feria comercial de su localidad dándose la oportunidad para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.Desea en el futuro comprar su propia casa.

En la fotografia la socia se encuentra ubicada al centro de las grupo viste con chompa color marron. la clienta insertada en la parte superior de la fotografia es una clienta que no pudo asistir en la reunion por motivo de salud.
texts.en: Elva Luz, 46, is a single mother of three minor, school age children.  She’s a member of the “Santa Rosa de Lima-Jauja” communal bank.  She currently sells shoes for children and adults.  She requested the loan to buy footwear and ankle boots for children and adults to sell at her local street market.  She hopes in future to buy a house.  In the photo, she’s wearing a brown jacket and is the third person in the center of her colleagues. The member in the small photo is a member who could not attend the meeting for health reasons.

loans.use: VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE GRANOS CEREALES

loans.name: Hatun Warmie - Huancayo Group

texts.es:
La señora YVONE de 30 años de edad madre soltera con 01 hijo   menor de edad  en etapa escolar. Es socias de la  alcancía comunal “Hatun Warmie - Huancayo”.
Se dedica a la venta de Prendas de vestir  para niños y adultos como chompas polos etc. El préstamo solicito para la compra de Prendas de vestir que las vende ofreciendo y repartiendo de casa en casa, realiza pedidos al por mayor y menor. 
Desea en el futuro desea comprarse su automóvil para trasladar sus mercaderías, ella viste de polo color turquesa ubicada lado derecha  segunda persona.
texts.en:
Yvone is 30 years old and she is a single mother of a child of school age. She is a member of the “Hatun Warmie – Huancayo” Community Bank.
She engages in selling clothes for children and grownups such as sweaters and polo shirts. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy clothes that she sells door to door. She also gets orders at wholesale and retail prices.
In the future she wants to buy a car to transport her products. In the picture she is the one dressed in the blue polo shirt, the second person on the right side.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell such as sweaters and polo shirts.

loans.name: Aforo

texts.en: mmmmmmmm

loans.use: To buy

loans.name: Yugabet

texts.en:
Yugabet is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and has one child. Yugabet is a fish monger, a business she has run for one year. She learned of Milango from her friends.

Yugabet is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to purchase fish. Her main challenges include the high cost of products and transportation.

She will use the extra income from this loan to purchase a freezer and open a shop.

loans.use: to purchase fish.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica lives in the coastal town of Changamwe, Kenya. She is married and has five school going children. Monica owns a preparatory school; an education center that offers primary level education. She also owns some rental houses.

Monica was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to build additional classrooms and carry out some renovations. 

The main challenge Monica faces is late payments by some parents which hampers the school's operations. She aspires to have a fully integrated school providing education through the primary school years and to meet all the government requirements.

loans.use: to build additional classrooms and carry out some renovations.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a single mother of two. Rachel owns a cosmetics shop which has been running for the last two years. She obtained the startup capital from her mother. She was introduced to Milango by her friends.

Rachel is applying for a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to purchase new stocks of cosmetics. She looks forward to owning a cosmetics supermarket in the future. Rachel will use the extra income to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase new stocks of cosmetics.

loans.name: Ifrah

texts.en:
Ifrah is a married business lady who lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She owns a clothes shop which has been running for five years. She obtained the startup capital from her husband.

Ifrah is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy more clothes to sell during the festive season. She looks forward to owning a business premise and not having to rent. She will use the extra income from this loan to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah is a poultry farmer living in Changamwe, Kenya. The business has been in operation for four years. She is applying for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to purchase more chickens and chicken feed.

Her main challenges are poultry diseases and the high cost of feeds and drugs. Lydiah would like to diversify to a food canteen and hotel business. She will use the extra income from this business to pay for her children’s education and pay for other household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Ndinda

texts.en:
Ndinda is a poultry farmer who lives in Likoni, Kenya. She is married and has been involved in this business for two years.

Ndinda was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase more broilers.

Ndinda would like to venture into hen layers farming. The challenges she faces are seasonal weather and the high cost of transport and feeds. She will use the extra income from the loan to purchase more chicken feed.

loans.use: to purchase more broilers.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He owns a textile business which is five-years old. Elijah is a married father of two. He first worked as a gatekeeper, saved some money and applied for a loan to start up his business. 

Elijah is applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to purchase cotton linings and clothes materials for the textile business. He looks forward to being a supplier of school uniforms to institutions.

loans.use: to purchase cotton linings and clothes materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase play station machines and two television sets.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is a single mother of four and owns a salon which has been in operation for thirteen years. She was first employed in a salon, saved some money and purchased her equipment before opening the salon.

She is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase salon products such as cosmetics. Her aspiration is to open a larger salon despite this challenge of a seasonal sales period. Emily will save the extra income from this loan.

loans.use: to purchase salon products such as cosmetics.

loans.name: Barrio Pincha - Chupaca Group

texts.es:
La señora CRESENCIANA MARIA de 36 años de edad madre soltera con 02 hijo   menor de edad  en etapa escolar. Es socias de la  alcancía comunal “Barrio Pincha - Chupaca”.

Se dedica a la Crianza y venta de animales menores como cuy, pollos, gallinas, etc. El préstamo solicito para la compra de alimentos balanceados y otros para sus animales, Desea en el futuro  comprarse su propia casa. 
Ella está ubicada la segunda persona lado derecha viste de polo color blanco y chompa color rosada.
texts.en:
Cresenciana Maria is 36 years old and she is a single mother of 2 children of school age. She is a member of the “Barrio Pincha - Chupaca” Community Bank. 
She engages in breeding and selling small animals such as “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig), hens, and chickens. She is requesting a loan to buy animal feed, as she engages in breeding and fattening her animals to sell them every week-end in the commercial fair of her community.
In the future she wants to buy her own house. In the picture she is the second person on the right hand side, dressed in a white polo shirt and a pink sweater.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for her animals.

loans.name: Iye

texts.en: Iye is 34 year-old and a widow with children aged 15 and 5yrs. In 2009, she established her provisions and drinks business to help her provide a livelihood for her children after she lost her husband who use to be the bread-winner of the family. She got her initial business capital from a family friend and neighbour. Iye opens her business 7 days a week and 13 hours a day. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000 to buy different kinds of soft drinks for her business. In the future, Iye plans to send her children to college. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Jàppalé Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé le 17 mai 2010. IL est composé de 15 membres issues du même village, elles ont pratiquement toutes des les liens de parenté.

Elles ont pour responsable Marèma. Elle est debout à l'extrême droite de la photo. Elle est âgée de 49 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont une petite fille. Elle a aussi la charge d'un petit fils. 

Elle fait de la couture et comme activité parallèle elle fait de l'agriculture. Elle pratique ce type d'activité depuis 26 années. 

Son prêt va lui permettre de s'approvisionner en marchandises (tissus, fil et semences). 

Son objectif est de prendre en charge ses enfants pour leur santé.les membres du groupes font la même activité.Notez qu'il y a un membre qui n'a pas pris de prêt et 02 absentes.
texts.en:
This group was founded May 17, 2010. It is made up of 15 women who come from the same village and who are almost all related to one another.

Their leader is Marèma. She is standing at the far right of the photo. She is 49 years old, married and the mother of six children, one of whom is a little girl. She is also responsible for a grandson.

Marèma sews and, in parallel, is involved in farming. She has been conducting this type of business for 26 years.

Her loan will allow Marèma to purchase supplies (fabrics, thread and seeds).

Her goal is to care for her children and their health; the members of the group are involved in the same business. Please note that there is one group member who did not take a loan and two who are absent [from the photo].

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr: Le groupe a été créé le17 mai 2010.IL est composé de 15 femmes issues du même village, elles sont soit des parents, soit des amies. Elles ont pour responsable Aïssatou. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle fait des activités agricoles et de la couture en même temps. Elle pratique ce type d'activité depuis 06 années. Son prêt va lui permettre de s'approvisionner en marchandises (tissus, fil et semences d'arachide). Son objectif est de prendre en charge ses enfants pour la scolarité et une partie de la dépense quotidienne.les membres du groupes font la même activité
texts.en:
The group was created on May 17, 2010. It is composed of 15 women, all from the same village. They are either parents or friends. Aïssatou is the leader of the group. She is 36 years old. She is married and is the mother of four children.

She has been doing both agricultural work and sewing work for the past six years. The loan will allow her to purchase supplies (fabrics, thread, and groundnut seeds).

Her goal is to be able to pay for her children's education and cover a portion of daily expenses. The other members of the group do the same work.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fabric, and thread

loans.name: Serigne Bara Group

texts.fr: Le groupe a été créé le 17 mai 2010.IL est composé de 17 femmes issues du même village.Elles ont pour responsable Awa. Elle est âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et s'occupe de 04 enfants dont une soeur. Elle fait du commerce de légumes. Elle pratique ce type d'activité depuis plus de 02 ans et demi. Son prêt va lui permettre de s'approvisionner en marchandises (légumes) Son objectif est de participer à ma prise en charge de la famille et renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
The group was created on May 17, 2010. It is composed of 17 women, all from the same village. Awa is the group leader. She is 37 years old, married, and takes care of four children, one of whom is her sister.

She has been selling vegetables for over two and a half years now. The loan will allow her to buy vegetables.

Her goal is to be able to contribute to supporting her family, and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Gabar Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe Gabar a été crée le 14 mai 2010. Il est composé de 27 femmes issues de la même localité. Elles exercent les mêmes activités qui sont le commerce et l'agriculture. Khady (Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 33 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle fait le petit commerce de poisson. Avec son prêt reçu, elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement en poisson pour augmenter sa vente en vu de satisfaire sa clientèle. Ses bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The Gabar group was created on May 14, 2010. It is composed of 27 women, all from the same area. They all work in agriculture and trade. Khady (standing on the right-hand side of the photo with her hand raised) is the group leader. She is 33 years old, married, and has five children.

She is a small-scale fish retailer. With the loan, she will increase her supply of fish in order to increase her sales and satisfy her customers. Her profits will allow her to help her husband support the family.

loans.use: to buy fish intended for sale

loans.name: Binta

texts.en: This is 27 year-old Binta. She is married, and has 3 children aged 12, 8 and 13yrs. She has 1 additional dependent, who lives with her because due to the death of her elder sister.  In 2009, Binta established her Provisions and drinks business. She began her business because she never went to school and she was brought up by her mother who taught her who to do business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Binta requires a loan in order to buy sardine, milk, sugar, mayonnaise, luncheon meat and soft drinks for her business. In the future, Binta plans to become an international business woman.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy sardine, milk, sugar, mayonnaise, luncheon meat and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Oyuntsetseg, 51, is a nurse in the hospital which is located in Kherlen, a boundary town in Mongolia. She has been doing her job for 31 years and lives with her grandson in a house that was built in the early 1980’s. Lately her house has been becoming damaged and she needs to make repairs to it. She especially needs to make renovations to the windows and roof. All of the wall insulation has been removed fully. Therefore she needs to purchase the building materials and hire the workers who will make the renovations. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to make renovations to her house.

loans.use: to make renovations to her house.

loans.name: Unurbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Unurbayar, 33, is requesting a loan to cover the cost of new furniture for his home. He lives with his wife and his three children in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He works as an auto-engineer in a private company and has been doing his job for five years. His salary usually is not enough to provide his family's necessities.
 
Unurbayar decided to renovate his home furniture, which was purchased in early 1980, because all of it has been damaged and gotten old. Therefore, he wants to renovate some of it. He said it will be important to improve his living conditions step by step.

loans.use: To cover the cost of new furniture

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 29-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda and his personal goal is to educate his children. He has been practicing poultry farming for eight years and his major hardships are inadequate capital to purchase stock and poultry diseases. However, he has a vision of expanding his business into other areas and increasing the number of birds.The purpose of the loan is to buy poultry birds.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds

loans.name: Sipriano

texts.en: Sipriano is a 52-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda with personal goals of educating his children, building a permanent home and buying a car. He has been a farmer for 20 years after getting capital from the sale of cows given to him by his father. His major hardships are seasonal weather and inadequate capital to purchase modern farming equipment. However, he has goals of buying land to grow crops, hiring employees to help expand his business and moving his business to a more permanent location. The purpose of the loan is to weed his garden and buy a milling machine.

loans.use: to buy a milling machine.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 29-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His current business is motorcycle transportation, which he has been operating for the last four years. He started riding other people's motorcycles while he saved money and bought his own motorcycle. His challenge is price fluctuation and inflation. His dream is buying more motorcycles and building a permanent home. John needs the loan to buy a second hand motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a second hand motorcycle

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lillian is a 30-year-old hardworking lady with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her children. She has a bar and a boutique business and the major challenges are high fuel and transportation costs and increased rent. However, she has a goal of hiring employees to help expand businesses into new areas.The purpose of the loan is to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is a 52-year-old widow from Kagadi, Uganda who owns a restaurant in the same town. She started this business with 250,000 shillings but now her business is worth 3,000,000 shillings. With this business, she has been able to educate her 10 children and buy land. Inadequate capital is hindering her dream of expanding her restaurant. She also dreams of building a permanent house and starting up a wholesale business. Patricia wants a loan to buy soft drinks and food for the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and food for the restaurant

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a hardworking young man who is married with three children. They live in a semi-permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda. His family goal is to educate his children. He rides a motorcycle for someone and he has the challenges of poor roads, high fuel, and having to remit 70% of his daily earnings to his bosses. Amos needs the loan to buy his own motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a hardworking young single mother of four children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her family goal is educating her children to higher levels. Her current business is farming. She grows mainly maize and has been in that business for 10 years. Her challenge is price fluctuations, inflation and seasonal weather. Florence needs the loan to pay workers who are harvesting her maize.

loans.use: to pay workers who are harvesting her maize.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en: Herbert is a 34-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His current business is farming, which he started 15 years ago. His main hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and seasonal weather. His personal goals are educating his children, building a permanent home and buying a car. His business goal is buying land to grow crops and hiring employees to help expand his business. Herbert needs the loan to buy land to grow more bananas and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy land to grow more bananas and coffee

loans.name: Tuong's Group

texts.en:
Tuong was born in 1967. She lives in Co Duong village, Tien Duong commune. She has two children. She and her husband are farmers. Not only do they grow rice and vegetables but she also raises poultry. She has a monthly income of about 2.000.000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2006 and has always repaid loans punctually. The last time she borrowed 1.962.000 VND. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy fertilizer and poultry food.

About the other borrowers in her group.
Hue is 57 years old. She has four children. She would like to borrow 3.706.000 VND to buy pig food.
Ly is 48 years old. She would like to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy poultry food.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and poultry food.

loans.name: Tuyen's Group

texts.en:
Tuyen was born in 1977. She is a member of Co Duong cluster in SEDA. She has two daughters. She and her husband are farmers. Not only do they grow rice but she also breeds pigs. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 Vietnamdong (VND). This is the first time she has participated in SEDA. She would like to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy pig food. She is the leader of a 5-member group loan in SEDA.

About the other borrowers in her group:
Loan is 27 years old. She has two children. She sells fast food in the market. She would like to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy goods to make fast food to sell.
Hoan is 28 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 8.502.000 VND to buy poultry food.
Nhung is 31 years old. She has one child. She wants to borrow 6.758.000 VND to buy chicken food.
Phuong is 27 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy pig food

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 39-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan. She is the mother of seven children.

Hanan makes floral arrangements and she works from her home.

Hanan is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to to purchase materials needed in her business such as flowers and glue. 

Hanan is looking to increase her customer base and open a shop for her products.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed in her business such as flowers and glue.

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en:
Fadwa is a 31-year-old single lady from Aqaba, Jordan.

Fadwa is a tailor with a home-based business and she is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase materials needed in dress-making for trading purposes.

An aspiration of Fadwa is to open a shop for her products so that she can increase her customer base and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed in dress-making for trading purposes.

loans.name: Ameera

texts.en:
Ameera is a 34-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. She is the mother of two children.

Ameera sells clothes from her home and she is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

Ameera is looking to open her own shop to better display her clothes and increase her sales volume.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

loans.name: Kafa

texts.en:
Kafa is a 36-year-old married woman from Al Aqaba, Jordan. She is the mother of three children.

Kafa does Henna, traditional tattoos made with a plant called henna and used mostly at parties and for brides.

Kafa is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to purchase henna and some other materials needed.

Kafa is looking to to expand her project by opening a shop for her business so that she can improve her family's life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase henna and some other materials needed.

loans.name: Jumanah

texts.en:
Jumanah is a 30-year-old married woman from Sahab, Jordan. She is the mother of six children.

Jumanah is a tailor and she is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase thread, fabrics, etc.

Jumanah is looking to to train her children in tailoring to help her with an aspiration of increasing the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase thread, fabrics, etc.

loans.name: Hasaan

texts.en:
Hasaan is a 39-year-old married man from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan. He is the father of four children.

Hassan is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to do home maintenance with an aspiration of improving his house and renewing the appliances.

loans.use: to do home maintenance.

loans.name: Sheekha

texts.en:
Sheekha is a 67-year-old widow from Madaba, Jordan, and a mother of seven children. 

Sheekha produces dairy products such as cheese and yogurt, and she is requesting a loan of 800 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase milk for their production. 

Sheekha's home-based business is considered as one of the biggest home-based projects in the area she lives in and she is looking to use some land she has to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase milk for producing dairy products

loans.name: Nihad

texts.en:
Nihad is a 45-year-old married woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children. 

Nihad is trading in clothes and many other things, she is requesting a loan of 400 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase more clothes for trading purposes. She is looking to increase her capital and open her own shop. 

An aspiration of Nihad is to help her daughters by financing their education at university.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for trading purposes

loans.name: Banan

texts.en:
Banan is a 48-year-old woman who is married with three sons. Her husband has a low pension salary that is not enough to cover his family's needs.

Banan has had a cosmetics store for two years, and it is the only source of income for the family. She wants to purchase necessary accessories that are missing from her store and for which she has a good demand from the customers, such as perfumes, creams for different uses, makeup, etc.

Because her store is new, and the income she has is low and isn't enough to pay for all of this purchase, she needs to take a loan from FATEN in the amount of $3,000. When Banan gets the loan, she will be able to purchase a collection of accessories to resell that will enable her to compete with other stores well and increase her sales, and so increase her income to create better living conditions for her family. 

Banan is a conservative woman, so her son is photographed in the store instead.

loans.use: To purchase a collection of accessories for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to start selling rice at whole sell price.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
This is Delia, 51, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Armando, a contractor and father to her children. Delia, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Delia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages to residents of the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy a packet of shampoo, a few pesos' worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting her inventory at wholesale prices and then retailing them by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products she sells in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Delia hopes her business will grow into a mini-grocery. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence used the previous loan to buy wheat, cooking oil, and sugar for making confectioneries to sell. However, her challenge is price fluctuations, inflation, and seasonal customers. Her personal goals are educating her children and renovating her house. Her business dream is to have a well-known super confectionery business in town. Florence needs the loan to buy a pressing machine and sealing machine to use in packaging

loans.use: to buy a pressing and sealing machine used in packaging.

loans.name: Faraja - Ilela Group

texts.en:
Amos is 33 years old and a father of two children. He has been growing coffee, maize, cassava and beans for over 25 years. He is facing farming problems, such as lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.

Amos needs funds to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. Also, he has a vision for five years to come to expand the scale of production from 5 to 12 acres in expectation to earn more income so that he can buy food, clothes, and cover medical expenses.
