“Tengo una cuadra de café que me bota 10 sacos de 70 kilos cada uno”, explica. Miguel vende sus granos de café a 10 soles el kilo, por ahora. En temporadas de gran demanda, como son los meses de abril a julio, su precio llega a costar hasta 14 soles. En el campo recibe el apoyo incondicional de Amelia y confía que, con los años sus hijos también aprendan de las labores.
Miguel confiesa que críar 3 hijos a su edad, no es sencillo, requiere mucho esfuerzo y dedicación y no lo podría hacer sin Amelia. Es por eso que seguirán trabajando para que ellos crezcan con valores y sin carencias básicas.  Miguel piensa alquilar más terrenos para ampliar sus sembríos. Sería la primera vez que Miguel accedería a un préstamo de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Él pertenece a “Los Claveles de Pachacutec”, su banco comunal, del que espera progreso en equipo.
Con el dinero del crédito podrá mandar a limpiar sus cultivos, contratando a personal operario, a quienes pagará diariamente de 30 a 35 soles.
texts.en:
Miguel, 25, is a young father of three children who are 9, 5 and 2 years old.  He has lived with Amalia for ten years.  This family lives in their own house located in the indigenous community of Pachacutec in Chanchamayo Province.  Miguel is a hardworking, enterprising man.  At his age he’s already responsible for a family that he supports.  At the beginning it wasn’t easy but thanks to help from his parents who gave him some plots of farmland he was able to start his own crops.  Now, he has coffee and achiote crops.

“I have a cuadra [about 3.8 acres] of coffee that produces ten sacks of 70 kilos each,” he explains.  Miguel sells his coffee beans for 10 soles a kilo for now.  In high demand seasons like April to July the price can reach up to 14 soles.  Amelia helps him in the fields and he confesses that in time his children will also learn the tasks.

Miguel admits that raising three children at his age isn’t easy.  It requires much effort and dedication and he couldn’t do it without Amelia.  Because of this they will continue working so that they will grow up with values and with their basic needs met.  Miguel plans to lease more land to expand his crops.

This will be the first time Miguel gets an MFP loan and he commits to be punctual with his monthly installment payments.  He belongs to the “Los Claveles de Pachacutec” (Pachacutec Carnations) communal bank and he expects them to make progress as a group.  He will use the money from the loan to clear his fields.  To do so he will hire day laborers that he’ll pay 30-35 soles daily.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es:
Estefania de 39 años convive con Isaías hace más de 20 años. En todo ese tiempo vieron nacer a 3 hijos, que ahora tienen 18, 14 y 8 años. Ella vive con los 2 menores en su casa propia en la comunidad nativa de Pachacutec, Chanchamayo. Estefanía creció en el campo. Vio a sus padres trabajar la tierra y por eso aprendió a desenvolverse con facilidad en sus propios terrenos. Ahora ella cuenta con 3 parcelas de terrenos cultivables, ahí siembra café, achiote, plátanos y maíz. Cada uno de estos productos es muy bien cuidado por Estefanía e Isaías. Ambos distribuyen su tiempo para dedicarse a la limpieza, abonamiento, y cosecha de sus cultivos.
Cuando es época de cosecha el trabajo es más intenso y tiene que contratar personal para apresurarlo. Una vez cosechado, traslada sus productos hacia la ciudad de Pichanaki y los ofrece por kilos, latas o cajones. Ahí los compradores ya la conocen. Ella está contenta con los resultados y espera multiplicar su producción, para ello deberá alquilar o comprar terrenos. Esas son metas más próximas. Sería la primera vez que Estefania obtendría un préstamo de MFP, por eso manifiesta ser responsable con el pago de las cuotas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Claveles de Pachacutec”, del que siente contenta y esperanzada.
Con el dinero del crédito comprará bolsas de abonos orgánicos para el café y con lo restante pagará a jornaleros para que limpien sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Estefanía, 39, has lived with Isaías for more than 20 years; they’ve had three children in that time who are now 18, 14 and 8 years old.  She lives with the two younger ones in her own house in the indigenous community of Pachacutec, Chanchamayo.  Estefanía grew up in the fields.  She watched her parents till the soil and learned how to easily work her own land.  Now, she has three parcels of farmland where she grows coffee, achiote, bananas and corn.  Each of these products is well cared for by Estefanía and Isaías.  They both divide their time between weeding, fertilizing and harvesting their crops.

When it’s harvest time and work is more intense she needs to hire staff to get it done more quickly.  Once harvested she transports her products to the city of Pichanaki and sells it by the kilo, can or case.  Buyers there already know her.  She’s happy with the results and expects to multiply her production.  To do so she must either lease or buy more land.  These are her most pressing goals.

This will be the first time Estefanía will get an MFP loan and she states that she will be responsible with her installment payments.  She’s belongs to the “Los Claveles de Pachacutec” (Pachacutec Carnations) communal bank and she feels happy and hopeful.  She will use the money from the loan to buy sacks of organic manure for the coffee and the rest of it to pay day laborers to do the weeding.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 26 años. Es una mujer soltera y cuida a Yameli de 10 años y a Yoselin de 7, sus hijos a quienes quiere como a nadie. Ellos viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa de Pucharini, provincia de Chanchamayo. Yameli y Yoselin significan el motor para su emprendimiento. Yolanda se dedica a los negocios. Desde que se separó del padre de sus hijas, instaló una tienda en su casa. Ahí expende comestibles como: dulces, gaseosas, cervezas, chupetes, helados, frutas, etc. “Es rentable el negocio, especialmente los fines de semana”, menciona.
Antes no podía ser una mujer independiente, por falta de capital para iniciar una actividad, pero gracias a al apoyo de sus familiares ahora puede estar segura que camina hacia el desarrollo.
Más adelante quisiera consolidar su establecimiento como una bodega de abarrotes, donde no falten productos para satisfacción de sus clientes. Sería la primera vez que Yolanda recibiría un crédito de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Se siente contenta de formar parte de “Los Caciques de Menkoremón”, su banco comunal, por que confía que sus resultados serán favorables para su crecimiento.
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 26, is single and cares for Yameli, 10, and Yoselin, 7, her children who she loves like no one else.  They live together in their house located in the indigenous community of Pucharini in Chanchamayo Province.  Yameli and Yoselin are the motivating force behind her enterprise.  

Yolanda is a merchant.  Since she separated from the father of her daughters, she opened a store at home.  She sells foodstuffs like candy, soft-drinks, beer, lollipops, ice-cream, fruit, etc.  “The business is profitable, especially on weekends,” she mentions.

Before, she wasn’t able to be an independent woman for lack of capital to start a business but thanks to support from family members she’s now sure that she’s on her way to success.  Later on, she’d like to consolidate her business into a grocery store where no products will be lacking to meet customer demand.  

This will be the first time Yolanda receives an MFP loan and she commits to be punctual with her installment payments.  She feels happy to be part of the “Los Caciques de Menkoremón” communal bank because she’s confident that results will be favorable for her growth.  She will invest the money in the purchase of groceries and basic need items to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix de 43 años, convive con Carmen con quien tiene a sus 6 hijos cuyas edades oscilan entre 20 y 3 años. Esta numerosa familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa de Pachacutec en la provincia Chanchamayo.  Félix es un hombre que trabaja sin descanso, es que no tiene alternativa. Su anhelo de superación por el bienestar de su familia es su motor principal. 
Es así que, en su parcela y media de terrenos de cultivo siembra café y achiote. Una vez cosechado traslada sus productos hacia la ciudad de Pichanaki, ahí vende los frutos al menudeo en un puesto de venta que instala en el mercado. “Cuando hay suerte los compradores vienen hacia Pachacutec y se llevan la mercadería”, menciona Félix, señalando como uno de sus inconvenientes lo tedioso que es movilizar su producción hacia la ciudad.
En el trabajo recibe la ayuda de su esposa quien además de cuidar su hogar, destina parte de su tiempo a las labores del campo. Sus hijos también aportan sus energías para agilizar el trabajo. Muchas veces se ahorró el dinero del pago a operarios por trabajar con ellos.
Félix anhela comprarse más terrenos para aumentar su producción. Sería la primera vez que él recibiría un crédito de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. “Los Claveles de Pachacutec” es el nombre de su banco comunal, menciona que será constante y participativo en las actividades del grupo.
Félix está orgulloso de no usar abonos de ninguna clase. Por eso el dinero que obtenga lo destinará en el pago de personal para la limpieza de sus tierras, además iniciará otra siembra de café comprando plantitas.
texts.en:
Félix, 43, lives with Carmen; they have six children whose ages range between 20 and 3 years.  This large family lives in their own house located in the indigenous community of Pachacutec in Chanchamayo Province.  Félix is a man who works tirelessly; he has no alternative.  His desire to get ahead for his family’s wellbeing is his main motivating factor.

Thus he grows coffee and achiote on his one and a half parcels of farmland.  Once harvested, he transports his products to the city of Pichanaki where he sells the fruit at retail in a stand he sets up in the market.  “When there is luck, buyers come to Pachacutec and take the merchandise,” Félix mentions, pointing out as one of his inconveniences how tedious it is to have to transport his products to the city.

His wife helps him with his work in addition to caring for the home; she dedicates some of her time to work in the field.  His children also contribute their energy to make the work easier; many times the money that would have gone to pay laborers was saved thanks to being able to work with them.

Félix hopes to buy more land to increase production.  This would be the first time he gets an MFP loan and he commits to be punctual with his installment payments.  “Los Claveles de Pachacutec” (Pachacutec Carnations) is the name of his communal bank.  He mentions that he will be constant and participative in the group activities.

Félix is proud that he uses no manure of any kind.  Because of that, the money he gets will be used to pay labor costs for staff to clear his fields.  In addition, he will buy seedlings to start a new plantation.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Niger

texts.es:
Niger de 22 años es un joven soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres en la comunidad nativa de Pucharini, en el distrito de Perené, provincia de Chanchamayo. Niger a su edad piensa como todo un emprendedor. No quiere obstáculos para lograr sus metas, es decir, los hijos y esposa no son su prioridad. 
Por ahora quiere dedicarse de lleno a la agricultura. Gracias a sus padres cuenta con 2 parcelas de terrenos donde siembra café y plátanos. “Como recién empecé a sembrar el año pasado, estoy sacando como 5 sacos de 70 kilos de café, me conviene”, comenta.
A la vez se desempaña como asistente de supervisión de obras en una empresa de electrificación, gracias a sus estudios técnicos. Ahí labora 8 horas al día. Le va bien en su trabajo, pero no descuida el campo. El dinero que obtiene lo otorga a sus padres para sus gastos básicos y otro porcentaje entra para sus ahorros.
Una de las metas de Niger es comprarse un carro para el traslado de sus productos y su movilización para su centro de trabajo. Éste sería su primer préstamo de MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. “Los Caciques de Menkoremón”, es el nombre de su reciente grupo comunal, del que confía para lograr sus metas.
De adquirir el dinero, podrá pagar a los peones a quienes contratará para hacer limpiar sus sembríos. Gastará por persona 30 soles al día.
texts.en:
Niger, 22, is a single young man living in his parents’ house in the indigenous community of Pucharini in Perené District, Chanchamayo Province.  At his age, Niger thinks like an entrepreneur.  He does not want any obstacles to reach his goals.  That is, children and a wife are not his priorities.  For now, he wants to dedicate himself totally to farming.  Thanks to his parents he has two parcels of farmland where he grows coffee and bananas.  “Since I just started last year, I’m producing about five sacks of 70 kilos of coffee; it’s to my advantage,” he comments.

At the same time, he works as a job supervisor’s assistant in an electric grid installation firm thanks to his technical studies.  He works 8 hours a day.  He does well in his job but does not neglect the fields.  The money he earns he gives to his parents to cover basic expenses and a certain percentage of it goes to savings.

One of Niger’s goals is to buy a car to transport his products and to get back and forth from his job.  This will be his first loan from MFP and he takes on the responsibility of being very punctual with his monthly payments.  “Los Caciques de Menkoremón” is the name of his recent communal bank which he trusts will reach its goals.

If he were to get the money he will be able to pay day laborers that he’ll hire to clear his fields.  He will spend about 30 soles per person per day.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Dora Concepcion

texts.es: Dora, necesita fortalecer su negocio y por eso se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo préstamo, además que ha recibido una buena atención por parte del personal de la institución, ella considera que el préstamo anterior fue una gran ayuda para fortalecer el negocio y continuar brindando un buen servicio a los clientes,su compra sera en azucar, frijoles, arroz, pollo, embutidos,  espera mantenerse dentro de su buena condición y poder continuar también ayudando a su familia.
texts.en: Dora needs to strengthen her business so has decided to request a new loan.  Besides, she’s received good attention from the staff at the institution.  She believes that the prior loan was of great help to her to strengthen the business and continue to provide good service to her customers.  She will buy rice, beans, sugar, chicken and cured meats.  She hopes to continue in her good condition and to be able to continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar de 22 años es un joven soltero. Vive en la casa de sus padres con sus hermanos en la comunidad nativa de Pucharini en el distrito de Perené, provincia de Chanchamayo. Edgar trabaja en las tierras de sus padres. A su edad demuestra destreza en las labores agrícolas. Siembra café, plátanos y algo de yuca para su consumo personal. De su esfuerzo recibe una parte de la producción para iniciar su independencia.
Desde los 18 años trabaja impulsado por sus intereses de autosuperación. “Empecé alquilando un carro, y hacia servicio de transporte de Pichanaki y La Merced”, comenta.
Ahora realiza la misma ruta y viceversa pero con su propio auto, que logró adquirir gracias a estos años de trabajo.  Esta actividad es rentable, los días buenos gana de 80 a 100 soles muy aparte de la inversión en combustibles. 
Ahora sus metas son mayores. Está ahorrando para construirse una casa propia y consolidar su independencia, por el momento apoya con trabajo y económicamente a sus padres y hermanos. Es un joven ejemplar. Éste sería su primer préstamo de MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. “Los Caciques de Menkoremón”, es el nombre de su reciente grupo comunal. Se siente contento de pertenecerlo.
De obtener el dinero, podrá pagar el servicio de los jornaleros que trabajarán en sus tierras, pagará el mantenimiento de su vehículo y comprará un poco de combustible.
texts.en:
Edgar, 22, is a single young man. He lives in his parents’ house with his siblings in his hometown Pucharini, in the Perené district, Chanchamayo province. Edgar works on his parents’ land. At his age, he demonstrates skill in farming work. He sows coffee, plantains and some yucca for his personal consumption. For his effort, he receives a portion of the crops to start his independence.

Since he was 18, he has worked driven by interest in self-improvement. “I started renting a car and doing transportation service from Pichanaki and La Merced,” he comments.

Now he drives the same routes, but he uses his own car, which he was able to purchase thanks to his years of work. This activity is profitable. On good days, he earns from 80 to 100 Peruvian soles, apart from the investment in fuel.

His goals are larger now. He is saving to build himself a house and become more independent. For the moment, he supports his parents and siblings financially and by working. He is an exemplary young man. This will be his first loan through MFP so he has taken the responsibility of being punctual in making his repayments. “Los Caciques de Menkoremón” is the name of his new communal bank. He feels pleased to belong to it.

When he gets the money, he will be able to pay the day laborers who will work in his fields, pay for maintenance for his vehicle and purchase some fuel.

loans.use: to hire day laborers, do maintenance on his vehicle and purchase fuel.

loans.name: Zadith

texts.es:
Zadith de 40 años es una madre soltera de 4 hijos de 22, 20, 17 y 11 años. Ella vive con 4 de ellos en su casa propia en la comunidad nativa de Pucharini en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Zadith es una mujer de negocios. A sus 20 años inició con la compra y venta de frutas. Con el pasar del tiempo, probó con las carnes y pescados, dándole buenos resultados. Actualmente se dedica a la compra y venta de yucas y pescados. “Compro las yucas por arrobas y las vendo en los restaurantes cuando me hacen pedidos y si me sobran lo vendo por kilo en mi casa”, comenta. Zadith tiene una tienda instalada en su casa, ahí ofrece frutas surtidas a los visitantes de la zona.  
Le va bien en estas actividades, por que adquiere su mercadería en cantidades considerables para abastecer a sus compradores.  Gracias a su esfuerzo puede mantener a sus hijos, quienes a la vez la ayudan en el traslado y distribución de sus productos. Con el entusiasmo que la caracteriza, admite que varias veces perdió su inversión por no conocer bien a los clientes, pero como ya lleva años en el negocio, confía que no le volverá a pasar. Éste sería su primer préstamo de MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. “Los Caciques de Menkoremón”, es el nombre de su reciente grupo comunal, del que confía sus logros futuros.
De recibir el dinero, lo invertirá en la compra de arrobas de yucas para atender sus pedidos en los restaurantes, además de frutas para surtir su puesto venta.
texts.en:
Zadith, 40, is a single mother of four, aged 22, 20, 17 and 11. She lives with all four in her own home in the indigenous community of Pucharini, in Chanchamayo Province. Zadith is a business woman. When she was 22 years old, she started buying and selling fruit. With the passage of time, she tried meat and fish, with good results. Currently she engages in buying and selling cassava and fish. “I buy cassavas by the bushel and I sell them to restaurants on order. If there are left overs, I sell the remainder by the kilo from home,” she notes. She has a store installed in her house and there she also sells assorted fruit to visitors in the area.

Zadith is doing well with these businesses because she buys her merchandise in considerable quantities to meet the demands of her customers. Thanks to her efforts she is able to support her children who at the same time help her in transporting and distributing her products. With characteristic enthusiasm, she admits that several times she lost her investment because she did not know her customers well but now that she has been in the business for years, she is confident that this will not happen again. 

This will be her first loan with MFP and she is committed to being punctual in making her monthly payments. The name of her new communal bank is “Los Caciques de Menkoremón” and she is confident of its future success. Upon receiving the money, she will invest it in the purchase of bushels of cassava in order to fill restaurant orders, as well as fruit to stock her sales stall.

loans.use: to purchase cassavas and a variety of fruits.

loans.name: Rosa Mirian

texts.es:
Rosa, quiere realizar una mera inversión en este mes de diciembre, con la intención de mejorar sus ventas ella comprará bolsones con nuevos diseños y ropa como blusas, faldas, pantalones, para esta nueva temporada ya que muchos clientes invierten en este tipo de mercadería.
El efecto que Rosa tuvo con la administración del préstamo anterior fue muy buena ya que ha logrado incrementar el negocio y ganar un buen número de clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa wants to make a small investment in the month of December, with the goal of improving her sales. She will buy bags with new designs and clothing such as blouses, skirts, and pants for this new season since many customers invest in this kind of merchandise.

The results Rosa had with her investment of the previous loan was very good since she has succeeded in increasing her business and in attracting a good number of clients.

loans.use: to buy bags and clothing such as blouses, skirts and pants.

loans.name: Nataly

texts.es:
Nataly de 25 años, convive con Ofenio, con quien tiene 2 hijos: Darwin de 9 años y Jhens de 1 año. Esta unida familia habita en un hogar propio en la comunidad nativa de Pachacutec, en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Nataly es una mujer laboriosa, cuida a sus pequeños hijos ya atiende su casa. Así también se dedica a la agricultura. En sus 5 parcelas de terrenos de cultivos tiene sembrado café, yuca, maíz, frijol y achiote. 
“Variamos en la siembra, para que no nos falte en cualquier mes del año”, menciona.
Cada cosecha la expende en la ciudad de Pichanaki, para eso tiene que trasladar sus productos desde su comunidad. Sus ventas son inmediatas, ya que tiene compradores fijos, que adquirió en todos estos años de trabajo. Con la ayuda de Ofenio puede agilizar sus faenas, pero cuando son intensas recurre a jornaleros a quienes contrata cada día.
Nataly espera que sus hijos sean personas independientes y con vidas de mejores calidades, para ello les brindará la educación necesaria y los apoyará como lo hace ahora. Sería el primer préstamo que Nataly obtendrá de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Claveles de Pachacutec”, siente confianza de que trabajando en equipo tendrá mejores logros.
De recibir el dinero, podrá contratar el personal necesario para hacer limpiar sus cultivos de maíz, café y yuca.
texts.en:
Natalys, 25, lives with Ofenio, with whom she has two children: Darwin, 9, and Jhens, 1.This united family lives in its own home in the indigenous community of Pachacutec in Chanchamayo Province. Natalys is a hardworking woman who takes care of their small children and their house. She is also a farmer. She has planted coffee, cassava, corn, beans and annatto trees on their 5 plots of land.  “We vary the planting so that we are not lacking in any month of the year,” she states. They sell each harvest in the city of Pichanaki where they have to transport their products from their community. They make immediate sales to fixed buyers acquired during all these years of work. Ofenio helps Natalys to streamline the chores, however when these become overwhelming, she resorts to contracting day laborers 

Natalys hopes that her sons will become independent people who will have a better quality of life. To that end, she will provide them with the necessary education and support them as she is doing now.

This will be Natalys first loan from MFP and she is committed to being punctual in her payments. She belongs to “Los Claveles de Pachacutec” Communal Bank and feels confident that she will have greater success working with a team. Upon receiving the money, she will be able to hire the labor force necessary to clear her corn, coffee and cassava fields.

loans.use: to contract farm day laborers.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly de 27 años convive con Manaces, con quien tiene 4 hijos de 13, 11, 9 y 6 años. Toda esta familia vive unida bajo un techo propio en la comunidad nativa de Pachacutec en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Nelly está orgullosa con los resultados de sus esfuerzos y sacrificios. 
Ella y Manaces se dedican a al agricultura. Ellos saben que les conviene y como negociarlo. En todo este tiempo juntos aprendieron que el café y el achiote nunca deben faltar en sus terrenos de cultivo. Es así que cuentan con una parcela y media de café cultivado y otra parcela de achiote. Estas siembras están bien cuidadas y atendidas. “Hay días de duro trabajo, y las chacras están bien lejos, por eso contratamos personal, ahí se va casi todo nuestro capital”, menciona.
A pesar de eso, siempre les ha ido bien. Los días en que los precios bajan, son desfavorables, pero nunca llegaron a perder su inversión.
Los compradores ya conocen a Nelly y saben de calidad de sus productos por eso vende con facilidad sus productos, muchas veces en su propia comunidad. Espera iniciar más siembras adquiriendo más terrenos cultivables. Éste sería el primer préstamo que Nelly obtendría de MFP. Se siente emocionada por eso. Ahora forma parte del banco comunal “Los Claveles de Pachacutec”, del que se muestra entusiasmada.
De recibir el dinero, contratará el personal necesario para limpiar sus cultivos de café y achiote. Gastando por persona 30 soles, incluyendo la alimentación.
texts.en:
Nelly, age 27, lives with Manaces. They have 4 children, ages 13, 11, 9, and 6. This entire family lives together under their own roof in the native community of Pachacutec in the province of Chanchamayo. Nelly is proud of her efforts and sacrifices.

Nelly and Manaces are farmers. They know that farming suits them and how to carry out the business. In all their time together, they have learned that coffee and achiote never fail to grow on the land they cultivate. These plants are well cared for. “There are days of hard work, and the fields are far away. That’s why hiring labor takes almost all our capital,” she says. In spite of that they have always done well. Times when prices are low are unfavorable, but they have never lost on their investment. Buyers already know Nelly and know the quality of her products. That’s why she sells her products easily, often in her own community. She hopes to have more plants by acquiring more land.

This will be Nelly’s first loan with MFP. She feels excited about this. She is part of the “Los Claveles de Pachacutec” (Pachacutec Carnations) Communal Bank and shows a lot of enthusiasm for it. Upon receiving the money she will hire the personnel necessary to harvest her coffee and achiote crop, spending 30 soles per person, including meals.

loans.use: to hire laborers.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso de 39 años hace 17 años convive con Rosa, su incondicional pareja, con quien tiene a sus 3 hijos de 15, 11 y 6 años. Toda esta familia habita un hogar propio en la Comunidad Nativa de Pachacutec, en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Alfonso es un hombre ejemplar. Con su trabajo dedicado en la agricultura ha podido sacar adelante a su familia, y brindarles una educación digna a sus 3 hijos, a quienes quiere mucho y por quienes trabaja.
Desde niño aprendió a labrar la tierra y negociar los productos que le otorga la naturaleza. En los montes de su comunidad cuenta con 3 parcelas de terrenos de cultivos, en los que produce café.
“La cosecha es buena en mayo y junio por que el precio del café sube hasta 14 soles la lata”, comenta.
Alfonso está contento con sus resultados, de las 3 parcelas obtiene como 15 sacos de café de 60 kilos cada uno aproximadamente.
A la vez, cuenta con un pequeño negocio de comestibles y golosinas instalado en su casa. Ahí Rosa se encarga de atender a los clientes, mientras prepara los alimentos de sus hijos. Está familia es unida, a pesar de las muchas tareas del hogar, Rosa y Alfonso se turnan para trabajar la tierra, ya que necesita atenciones constantes.
Alfonso quiere ampliar su negocio en una bodega donde expenderá abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. Éste sería el primer préstamo que Alfonso obtendría de MFP. Se siente emocionado por eso. Ahora forma parte del banco comunal “Los Claveles de Pachacutec”, del que se muestra esperanzado.
De adquirir el crédito, podrá comprar 5 bolsas de abonos orgánicos con 600 soles. Y lo restante será para ampliar su negocio con la compra de mercaderías.
texts.en:
Alfonso is 39, and has been living with Rosa, his life partner, for 17 years. They have three children, ages 15, 11, and 6. The whole family lives in their own home in the native community of Pachacutec, in Chanchamayo province. 

Alfonso is an exemplary man. Through his dedicated work as a farmer, he has been able to raise his family, and provide a decent education to his three children, whom he really loves, and for whom he works. 

Since he was a child, he learned to work the land, and sell the products that nature grants him. In the hills near his community he has three parcels of agricultural land, on which he grows coffee. 

"The harvest is good in May and June because the price of coffee goes up to 14 soles a can," he says. Alfonso is happy about his results. From the three parcels he gets around 15 sacks of coffee, each one approximately 60 kilos. 

At the same time he has a small business selling foodstuffs and candy set up in his house. There, Rosa is responsible for serving the customers, while she prepares food for her children. This is a close-knit family. In spite of the many household chores, Rosa and Alfonso take turns working the land, as it needs constant care.

Alfonso wants to expand his business into a small store where he will sell groceries and basic staples. This would be the first loan that Alfonso would obtain from MFP. He feels excited about that. Now he is part of the "Los Claveles de Pachacutec" communal bank, which he is hopeful about. 

When he gets the loan, he will be able to buy five bags of organic fertilizer with 600 soles. The rest will be for expanding his business through the purchase of merchandise.

loans.use: To buy five bags of fertilizer, and products for his business.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es:
Elvis de 27 años convive con Eliana hace 5 años, con quien tuvo a Fernanda, su hija de 5 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa de Pachacutec, provincia de Chanchamayo. Elvis es un esposo y padre ejemplar. Todo su esfuerzo tiene como motor su familia. Desde pequeño aprendió las labores del campo, es así que inició con sus propios sembríos en parcelas de terrenos que su comunidad y sus padres le otorgaron. 
De esa manera ha podido surtir y equilibrar su producción. Él cultiva café, achiote, maíz y plátano.
“De mi parcela de café obtengo como 10 sacos de café, cada saco es de 50 a 60 kilos”, menciona. 
La siembra de achiote es rentable, para los comuneros de la zona, por los suelos y condiciones climáticas. Elvis produce 1000 kilos cada año y vende rápidamente para las empresas de condimentos y a otros compradores que se lo llevan como colorante.
Elvis quiere ampliar sus sembríos y aumentar su producción. Con eso quiere darle mejores condiciones de vida a su hija y esposa. Ésta sería la primera vez que Elvis obtendría un crédito de MFP, por tal razón da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Se siente emocionado por ser parte del banco comunal “Los Claveles de Pachacutec”. De recibir el dinero, podrá iniciar una siembra de plátanos, para ello comprará mamones de plátanos, cada uno a 50 céntimos. Necesitará 900 mamones con mínimo. Con lo restante comprará abonos orgánicos.
texts.en:
Elvis, age 27, has lived with Eliana for five years. They have a five-year-old daughter named Fernanda, and live in their own home in the native community of Pachacutec, in the Chanchamayo province. Elvis is a model husband and father, and his family is the motivation behind all his hard work. He learned farmwork at a young age, and started off his own crops on parcels of land that his community and parents gave him.
He has been able to improve his production, and he cultivates coffee, annatto, corn, and bananas.
"I've been able to get something like 10 bags of coffee from my coffee crop, each bag weighing 50 to 60 kilos," he says.
Annatto is a profitable crop for the local farmers because of the normal weather conditions. Elvis produces 1000 kilos each year, and it sells quickly to the seasoning businesses, and to other buyers who use it as a dye.
Elvis wants to expand his land and increase production. With the income from doing so, he wants to give his wife and daughter better living conditions. This will be his first loan with MFP, so he gives his word that he will be punctual in paying off his quotas. He is excited to be a part of the "Los Claveles de Pachacutec" communal bank. Upon receiving this money, he will be able to start sowing bananas. In order to do so, he will buy banana offshoots; each one costs 50 cents. He will need at least 900 offshoots. With the remaining money he will buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy 900 banana offshoots and bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Edin

texts.es:
Edín es un joven emprendedor. Tiene 28 años y es soltero. Vive con en la casa de sus padres, en la comunidad nativa de Pachacutec, provincia de Chanchamayo. Edín trabaja duro y parejo. A pesar de no tener hijos y esposa, sabe que mediante el esfuerzo puede conseguir lo que se propone. 
Gracias a sus padres aprendió como se trabaja la tierra, por eso Edín es un agricultor nato. En sus 2 cuadras de terrenos de cultivo tiene sembrado café y achiote. “El café es rentable, su venta es buena en junio. El achiote también se cosecha una vez al mes y es muy solicitado”, comenta.
De su parcela de achiote obtiene 400 kilos que ofrece a 3 ó 4 soles el kilo. 
Como es un hombre independiente, necesita el apoyo de jornaleros, a quienes paga por día, así agiliza su trabajo. Le gusta su trabajo, por que depende de él la buena o mala producción. Su reto, para más adelante es ampliar sus sembríos, para ello arrendará parcelas de terrenos para iniciar próximas siembras. Éste sería su primer crédito de MFP. Por eso se compromete a ser responsable con los pagos de las cuotas. Asimismo menciona sentirse emocionado al formar parte de “Los Claveles de Pachacutec”, su banco comunal.
De recibir el préstamo, podrá contratar personal operario para hacer trabajar sus tierras, ya que se inicia la etapa de limpieza y fertilización.
texts.en:
Edín is a young entrepreneur. He is 28 and single, and lives in his parents' home in the native community of Pachacutec, Chanchamayo province. He works hard and does his share. Although he does not have a wife or children, he knows that he can achieve anything through hard work.
He learned to work the land thanks to his parents; he is a born farmer. On his two blocks of land, he has sown coffee and annatto. "Coffee is profitable, and sales are good in June. Annatto is harvested once a month and it is in high demand," he says.
He harvests 400 kilos of annatto, which goes for 3 to 4 Soles per kilo.
Because he is an independent man, he needs the help of labourers whom he pays by the day. He enjoys his work, because the quality of the production depends on him. His goal for the future is to expand his crops; in order to do so, he will rent some plots of land for the next sowing. This will be his first loan with MFP, so he promises to be responsible with the payment of his quotas. He says that he is excited to be part of the "Los Claveles de Pachacutec" communal bank.
Upon receiving this loan, he will be able to hire labourers to work his land, since it is time to clear and fertilize.

loans.use: to hire labourers.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 30 años de edad. Cuenta con una vivienda propia en la comunidad nativa de Pachacutec, provincia de Chanchamayo. Ahí vive con su pareja, Wilson, con quien tiene 3 hijos de 12, 9 y 3 años. Todos los días son un reto para Julia. Se levanta muy temprano para preparar sus alimentos y alistar a sus pequeños hijos para la escuela. Sus labores no tienen descanso, pues tiene que ingeniárselas para distribuir su tiempo y dedicarse a la siembra. La agricultura es su actividad económica, de la que obtiene dinero suficiente para educar, alimentar y vestir a sus hijos.
Ella es propietaria de 2 parcelas de terrenos cultivables, en ellos siembra café, maíz y achiote.
Estos productos son rentables, dependiendo de cómo se negocien, y Julia sabe muy bien de eso.
“El achiote lo vendo a 5 soles el kilo y sale rápido por su demanda para preparar condimentos”, explica.
En este trabajo recibe la ayuda de su pareja y de personal operario a quienes contrata para limpieza, siembra y cosecha de sus tres productos.
Es consciente de que la venta es rentable, por eso quiere ampliar sus terrenos de cultivo y mejorar sus frutos. Ésta sería la primera vez que Julia obtendría un préstamo de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en los pagos y participativa dentro de su banco comunal “Los Claveles de Pachacutec”.
Con el dinero del crédito, podrá comprar bolsas de abono y pagar al personal que trabajará en sus tierras, cuyo precio es de 25 a 30 soles por cada uno el día.
texts.en:
Julia is 30. She has her own home in the Pachacutec native community, Chanchamayo province. She lives with her husband, Wilson, and their three children ages 12, 9 and 3. Every day is a challenge for Julia. She gets up very early to make food and get her little ones ready for school. She never gets a break, because she has to figure out how to divide her time and take care of their crops. She is a farmer, and she makes enough income from this to educate, feed, and clothe her children. She owns two parcels of fertile land where she plants coffee, corn and annatto. These products are profitable, depending on how one negotiates, and Julia knows how to negotiate.
"I sell the annatto for 5 Soles per kilo. It goes quickly because it is in demand for making seasoning," she explains.
Her husband helps her with the work, and they hire labourers for clearing, sowing and harvesting the land.
She knows that her sales are profitable. For this reason, she wants to expand her land and improve her crops. This will be her first loan from MFP, so she promises to be punctual with her payments and active in her communal bank, called "Los Claveles de Pachacutec".
With this loan, she will be able to buy bags of fertilizer and pay the labourers who will work her land; each one is paid 25 to 30 Soles per day.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hire labourers.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio de 62 años es un hombre viudo. Tiene 3 hijos: Yolina de 19, Lit de 17 y Sumit de 5 años. Todos ellos viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa de Pucharini, provincia de Chanchamayo. Eugenio es un padre  ejemplar. Su esposa falleció cuando Sumit tenía 8 meses de nacida. Desde entonces se convirtió en padre y madre para sus 3 hijas. Se las ingenió para cuidar se ellas y no descuidar sus actividades.
Él es un agricultor, especialista en el cultivo de plátanos. En sus 3 parcelas cultiva las variedades: seda, isla, largo y bizcochito. Las que comercializa en la ciudad de Yurinaki, para ello tiene que trasladar sus productos con una movilidad motorizada. Así también siembra café en media parcela, pero estos granos son vendidos en su misma comunidad, donde compradores de distintas empresas pagan un precio justo por la producción.
“Mi café es solicitado por que no utilizo abonos de ninguna clase”, menciona orgulloso. Eugenio piensa sembrar más café y plátanos en una parcela que aún no produce. Este plan requiere de trabajo arduo. Sería la primera vez que Eugenio accedería a un préstamo de MFP. Se responsabiliza de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Se siente contento de pertenecer al banco comunal “Los Caciques de Menkoremón”. De obtener el dinero, podrá comprar mamones de plátanos para iniciar una plantación. Además adquirirá plantas de café.
texts.en:
Eugenio, 62, is a widower. He has 3 children: Yolina, 19; Lit, 17; and Sumit, 5. They all live in a house he owns in his hometown of Pucharini in Chanchamayo province. Eugenio is an outstanding father. His wife died when Sumit was only eight months old. Since that time, he has been both father and mother to his 3 daughters. He has managed to care for them and not neglect his activities.

He is a farmer who specializes in the cultivation of plantains. In his 3 plots of land, he cultivates four varieties of plantains which he sells in the city of Yurinaki. In order to sell them, he has to transport his products by vehicle. He also plants half a plot of coffee, but these beans are sold in his own community where buyers from different companies pay a fair price for their production.

“My coffee is requested because I don’t use any type of fertilizers,” he mentions proudly. Eugenio is thinking of growing more coffee and plantains in a plot that doesn’t produce any more. This plan requires hard work. This will be the first time that Eugenio has obtained a loan from MFP. He takes responsibility for being punctual in his repayments. He feels pleased to belong to the “Los Caciques de Menkoremón” communal bank. When he obtains the money, he will be able to purchase plantain offshoots in order to start a plantation. Also, he will obtain coffee plans.

loans.use: to purchase plantain offshoots and coffee plants.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen de 41 años convive con Miguel hace más de 15 años, con él tiene a sus hijos de 15, 11 y 7 años, a quienes quiere mucho. Ellos viven juntos bajo un techo propio e la comunidad nativa de Pachacutec, en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Carmen es una madre y esposa ejemplar. Se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo atrás a la agricultura, actividad que aprendió de sus familiares y comuneros de la zona. 
Es así que cuenta con 4 parcelas de terrenos agrícolas. En ellos siembra café y achiote en las mismas cantidades, así asegura sus ingresos por ambas partes. “Sembrar café y achiote es más rentable en esta zona por su demanda, y nunca hay pierde”, comenta.
A la vez, instaló un pequeño negocio de abarrotes en su hogar, donde sus vecinos frecuentan para sus compras diarias. Carmen no se puede quejar, le va bien en ambas actividades.
El motivo de su esfuerzo son sus hijos, por ellos no duda en coger el machete y dirigirse a los montes donde se ubican sus terrenos para limpiarlos.
Mas adelante le gustaría, aumentar su producción y ampliar su negocio con la adquisición de más mercadería. Éste sería el primer préstamo que Carmen obtendría de MFP. Se siente emocionada por eso. Ahora forma parte del banco comunal “Los Claveles de Pachacutec”, del que se muestra esperanzada.
De recibir el dinero podrá comprar más mercadería para surtir su tienda y abastecer a toda su comunidad con productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Carmen is 41, and has been living with her partner Miguel for more than 15 years. They have children ages 15, 11, and 7, whom they love very much. They live together under their own roof in the native community of Pachacutec, in Chanchamayo province. 

Carmen is an exemplary mother and wife. She has been farming for a long time, a livelihood she learned from her family members and villagers in the area. So it is that she has four parcels of agricultural land. 

There she plants coffee and achiote (annatto seeds) in equal quantities; this way she makes sure she has income from both parts. "Growing coffee and achiote is very profitable in this area because of the demand, and there is never a loss," she says. 

At the same time, she set up a small grocery store in her home, where her neighbors go to make their daily purchases. Carmen can't complain; it's going well in both activities. The reason for her effort is her children; for them she doesn't hesitate to take the machete and head to the hills where her land is located, to do clearing. 

In the future, she would like to increase her production and expand her business with the acquisition of more merchandise. This would be Carmen's first loan from MFP. She feels excited about that. Now she is part of the "Los Claveles de Pachacutec" communal bank, which she is hopeful for. 

When she receives the money, she will be able to buy more merchandise to stock her store, and supply the entire community with basic staples.

loans.use: To buy basic staples for stocking her store.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris tiene 26 años. Convive con Henry con quién tiene 5 hijos de 7, 6, 4, 2 años y un pequeño de 2 meses de nacido. Ella y su familia viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa de San Pablo, en el distrito de Pichanaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Doris es una mujer experta en la siembra de café. En su parcela y media de terrenos de cultivo solo siembra los granos tan solicitados y comprados en su zona. 
Ella y Henry se dedican ala campo y destinan su tiempo en labores de la casa, del campo y la atención de sus hijos.  Doris ya está restablecida de su último parto y con la valentía y fuerza que la caracteriza cogió las herramientas de trabajo para cuidar su café.
“La cosecha es buena en mayo y junio por que el precio del café sube hasta 14 soles la lata, a veces vendemos por sacos de 60 o 70 kilos”, comenta. Añadiendo que no siempre los compradores suben hasta su localidad para adquirir su producto. Muchas veces tiene que invertir en el traslado de su cosecha hacia la ciudad de Pichanaki.
Ella espera que su familia se desarrolle en todos los ámbitos. Para ello seguirá trabajando para darles a sus hijos la calidad de vida necesaria para que vivan cómodos y no les falte nada. Éste sería el primer préstamo que Doris obtendría de MFP. Se siente emocionada por eso. Ahora forma parte del banco comunal “Los Norionkis de Alto San Pablo”, del que se muestra esperanzada.
Con el dinero podrá pagar a los jornaleros que contratará para la limpieza de sus tierras. La maleza y la mala yerba abundan en sus sembríos por eso, tiene que limpiarlo constantemente. Pagará 30 soles al día por operario.
texts.en:
Doris is 26. She lives with Henry and their five children ages 7, 6, 4, 2, and 2 months. They live in their own home in the native community of San Pablo, in the Pichanaki district, Chanchamayo province. Doris is an expert in coffee growing. On her land, she only sows the crops that are most in demand in the area.
She and Henry divide their time between the fields, housework, and taking care of their children. Doris has already recovered from her last birth, and the courage and strength that so define her have allowed her to keep working, caring for their coffee plantations.
"The harvest is good in May and June because the price of coffee goes up to 14 Soles per unit, and we sometimes sell it by the bag, 60 or 70 kilos," she says. She adds that the buyers do not always go to her community to buy her products. She often has to invest in transporting her harvest to the city of Pichanaki.
She hopes that her family does well in everything. In order to ensure this, she will keep working in order to give her children the necessary quality of life so that they can live comfortably without any lack. This will be Doris' first loan with MFP, and she is excited about it. She is now part of the “Los Norionkis de Alto San Pablo” communal bank, and she has high hopes for it.
With this money, she will be able to pay the labourers whom she will hire to clear their lands. The undergrowth and weeds are abundant, so she has to clear her land constantly. She will pay 30 Soles per day per labourer.

loans.use: to hire labourers.

loans.name: Nelly Fiorella

texts.es:
Nelly es una joven de 20 años de edad, es natural de 	Ica, Perú. Ica es una ciudad a la cual se le conoce como la “Tierra del sol Eterno”, porque en cualquier estación del año se puede tener el calor del sol, además es una ciudad en la cual habitan personas muy generosas y trabajadoras y cuya gastronomía es muy exquisita en especial por el riquísimo Chupe de pallares Verde y el picante de Garbanzo”, pero el plato por el cual Nelly se derrite es el riquísimo “ Lomo Saltado”, Nelly es convive con su pareja el cual la apoya mucho en todo lo que hace, así como también, el trabaja como mecánico y a pesar de lo agotador que es su labor, siempre se apoyan y dan la mano.

Nelly se dedica  a la venta de productos cosméticos por las calles de su barrio, le gusta mucho su negocio porque le encanta atender a sus clientas, ella le dedica a su negocio de 2 a 3 horas diarias, al día puede ganar hasta S/. 45 y en un muy buen día puede ganar hasta S/.180, con lo que le ayuda para los gastos adicionales de su hogar o también para invertir en su negocio, no solo trabaja vendiendo sus productos de belleza sino también trabaja como secretaria en el taller de su padre es una joven muy emprendedora y luchadora, ella cree que le va bien porque en primer lugar cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja el siempre le da ánimo para salir adelante y la apoya en todo lo que puede, es mas en algunas oportunidades la ha ayudado a mostrar sus productos, pero también ella nos dice que le va bien porque trata de manera amable a sus clientes, pero sobre todo porque ella tiene mucha fe en Dios y el nunca la abandona.

Actualmente está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio, con esta mejora podrá tener más variedad de productos, en especial por campaña de verano y con ello tendrá más ingresos para seguir ahorrando para también vender ropa y con ello poder cumplir su gran sueño:”Tener su local propios para la venta de sus Cosméticos y Ropa”
texts.en:
Nelly is a young woman who is 20 years of age and a native of Ica, Peru. Ica is a city known as the “Land of the Eternal Sun” because the heat is present in every season. In addition, the people who live there are very generous and hardworking. The local dishes are exquisite, especially the rich lima bean soup with spicy garbanzo beans. However, Nelly’s favorite dish is “lomo saltado” (Peruvian beef stir-fry).

Nelly lives with her partner who supports her in everything that she does. Even though he works tirelessly in his job as a mechanic, her partner always helps out and is willing to give her a hand. Nelly sells cosmetics by traveling through the streets of her neighborhood. She enjoys her business greatly because she likes attending to her customers. Nelly works two to three hours a day and can earn around 45 PEN. On a very good day, she can earn up to 180 PEN which helps to cover additional household expenses or fund additional investment into her business. Not only does she sell beauty products, but Nelly also works as an assistant in her father’s workshop. She is an enterprising and determined young woman. Nelly believes that she is doing well because she has the support of her partner, who always provides encouragement to press forward and helps out in every way he can. On some occasions, he will help demonstrate her products. However, she says that the friendly service she provides to her customers is also a reason for her success. Most of all, she has plenty of faith in God who will never abandon her.

At the moment, Nelly is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders for providing support so that she can buy more merchandise for her business. With this improvement, she will have a wider variety of products, especially for the summer season. With the additional income, Nelly can continue saving so that she can also sell clothes and fulfill her greatest wish of having her own stores where she can sells both cosmetics and clothing.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Chenisa

texts.en:
Chenisa is from Punta, Panaon Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old. Chenisa is married and has two infant-aged children. 

To make a living, Chenisa owns and operates a business venture, making and selling barbecue in the local community. Chenisa has been in her business for two years and earns 1,300 PHP a month for these activities.

Chenisa is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make barbeque. In 2011, Chenisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make barbeque

loans.name: Federita

texts.en:
Federita is from Punta, Panaon Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Federita is married. 

To make a living, Federita sells balut (boiled, fertilized eggs) in the local community. Federita has been in her business for three years and earns 1,500 PHP a month for these activities. Federita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. 

In 2011, Federita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Nut

texts.en: Mrs. Nut is 65 years old, a humble villager who lives in Takhmao town. She has five children, all of whom are already married. Mrs. Nut owns a few plots of farmland that can be used to grow her rice crops. Unfortunately, the farmland provides this family an unsatisfying output which is barely enough to use among the year. Mrs. Nut suggested her husband who used to be a mechanic to restart his business again in order to help their living needs. Therefore, Mrs. Nut wants to acquire some funds from our lenders to buy spare parts for motorcycles and to buy sets of tools for her husband to use to fix motorcycles. She is very pleased about the loan given to her to improve the business and her living standard.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools for fixing motorcycles

loans.name: Dung's Group

texts.en:
Dung was born in 1979. She lives in Van Loc village, Xuan Canh commune. She is a member of the Van Loc cluster. Her husband is staying in the army. She has a child. Mrs Dung sells clothes in the market. She has had this job for 4 years. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2010. The last time she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy more clothes to sell. She is the leader of a 6-member group loan in SEDA.

About other borrowers in her group:
 Cham is 41 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy food for poultry.
 Huong is 33 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to expand her restaurant.
 Doan is 25 years old. She has one child. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy food for pigs.
 Lan is 27 years old. She has one child. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to invest in her barbershop.
 Manh is 26 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy food for pigs and poultry.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen was born in 1951. She lives in Van Loc village, Xuan Canh commune. She is a member of the Van Loc cluster. Her husband has died. She has three children. Mrs Dung sells clothes in the market. She has had this job for 5 years. She has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 Vietnamdong(VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2007. The last time she borrowed 7,630,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,938,000 VND to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en: Mrs. Chhin, 47, is in this photo in front of her house in Kompong Cham province. She is a loving mother of four children and a single parent who is engaged in the agricultural business. Besides farming within the rainy season, Mrs. Chhin also works at home as a hammock weaver to generate additional income of $1.50 per day. Presently, two of her children are apprentice goldsmiths who now are training in one of the province markets, and they’ll finish their class soon. Mrs. Chhin realizes that her sons will need many types of tools and raw materials for this career if they start up their own business after the class. For this reason, Mrs. Chhin would like to ask for some funds from HKL and Kiva to purchase some types of tools and raw materials, which will be used in the process of making and fixing gold materials. She hopes that she will be able to pursue a better standard of living when her two sons’ business starts growing.

loans.use: to purchase some tools and raw materials, which will be used in the process of making and fixing gold materials.

loans.name: So

texts.en:
From the town of Takhmao, Mrs. So, age 55, a single mother, keeps very busy with her farming work from day to day. She grows both rainy-season rice and dry-season rice. Also, she grows vegetables for quick sale. She typically earns approximately $5.00 per day to support her family. She has been blessed with nine children: five of them are single and four of them are already married.

Mrs. So is looking for a loan from HKL to pay for the process of rice farming. She’ll buy things such as rice seeds, mineral fertilizers and pesticide to keep her crops growing well. In the future, she hopes to expand her farming business gradually. In addition, she will support her children until they finish high school.

loans.use: to buy things such as rice seeds, mineral fertilizers and pesticide to keep her crops growing well.

loans.name: Sodbileg

texts.en:
Mrs. Sodbileg, 29, has been running a cafe in rented space since last spring. Initially, her cafe was owned by her boss and she used to work as a cook, but now she is renting it with a contract of two years. 

She lives with her husband and her two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her cafe already has permanent customers, and there is a substantial increase of monthly income. 

Now Sodbileg needs to renovate her cafe equipment such as tables and chairs. It will influence well the satisfaction of her customers and the quality of service. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchase the new equipment to renovate her cafe.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment to renovate her cafe.

loans.name: Mend

texts.en: Mr. Mend is requesting a loan to purchase domestic animals and their feed to sell. He wanted to expand his sales volume for the good earnings. It is beneficial for substantially improving his business in the future. At first, he needs to purchase more domestic animals that he buys from his suppliers. He said that he will be opening a branch in another district within this year if he is successful.

loans.use: To purchase domestic animals and feed

loans.name: Chhneang

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhneang, 38, is a hard-working mother who has been residing in Krong Siem Reap. She works alongside her husband who is a construction worker from place to place. Sometimes she acts as a cook for the team and sometimes she acts as one of the laborers who is responsible for transporting sand and stone and doing some type of lighter work. She typically earns $2.00 per day, while her husband yields around $5.00. 

With the amount she has requested from HKL, she will buy a stock of rice to keep for her daily food for the entire year. This loan will better her living and keep her family from being hungry. She is grateful for the support.

loans.use: to buy rice for her daily food for the entire year

loans.name: Sokhi's Group

texts.en:
Sokhi is a 30-year-old single lady living in a rural area of the Prey Chhor district. She is a farmer in the village and also works for pay on others' rice fields. She has been in this business for 15 years to make her living. She currently can earn less than $4 USD per day and is able to save around $2 USD daily. 

This is her group's first loan with VisionFund. Sokhi and her member Phalla are requesting a loan. She plans to  use this entire loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farm. She hopes to make more rice and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 37-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children. He has been running a retail shop for the last two years, and the major hardships are: price fluctuations, inflation, and inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, he has a goal of moving his business to a more permanent location. The purpose of the loan is to buy soap, sugar, and matchboxes to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, and matchboxes to sell.

loans.name: Thou's Group

texts.en:
A mother of two dependent children who are both under school age, Thou is 29 years old and also a farmer in a village of the Cheung Prey district. She has been farming on her rice field as a primary business for six years. She also raises one cow and poultry (i.e. chicken and duck). She supplements her income by making hand-made chicken cages for sale. With her current business, she can earn less than $5 USD per day. 

Thou took her first loan from VisionFund in 2010, and she successfully paid back the loan with VisionFund. Now, she is able to have regular income and has some savings. Now applying for another loan with her group member who is just with VisionFund this loan cycle, Thou will use this entire loan to buy one more cow for plowing her farm. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow rice with full production capacity and earn more income so as to build on her savings to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy one more cow for plowing her farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 44 years old and married with four children living in Kagadi, Uganda. She has a retail business located in the same area in which she started 11 years ago with a capital of UGX 1,000,000. She has a stock of UGX 3,500,000 currently. It is through this business that she has been able to educate her children and expand her business. Inadequate capital is a hindering factor to the expansion of her business. Mary wants a loan to buy rice, maize flour, sodas, and other merchandise for resale.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize flour, sodas, and other merchandise for resale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a 34-year-old married lady with two children living in Kagadi, Uganda. She has a retail shop which she has operated for eight years now in the same area. She started with farming where she got the starting capital for the business. She has dreams of educating her children. The business is being affected by price fluctuations and inflation rates which are affecting her working capital. Maria wants the loan facility to purchase glasses, plates and flasks to sell.

loans.use: to purchase glasses, plates and flasks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sugar, plates, soap, salt and saucepans

loans.name: Munguntsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Munguntsetseg, 38, runs a grocery store in Kherlen, a boundary town in Mongolia. She has been running her business for 4 years and already has had permanent clients. She lives with her husband and her children in a ger, a Mongolian traditional tent.

Her store business has been running successfully for several years and last summer she bought a car with her earnings. Now Munguntsetseg wants to expand her store sales volume to improve her business. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchasing the groceries for her store.

loans.use: to purchase the groceries for her store

loans.name: Beatrace

texts.en:
Beatrace is a thirty-two-year old lady living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goals are to educate her children and build a permanent residential house. 

She has been running a retail shop for the last fourteen years and the major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and seasonal weather. However, she has goals of expanding her business into new areas. The purpose of the loan is to buy maize flour, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Saroeun is a 58-year-old mother of five children, four of whom are dependents: two work at a garment factory, one works in the family's rice field and one is still at school. She has been farming twice per year as her primary business to earn a living for twelve years. She also raises a cow on the farming site. She supplements her income by fishing and working for others. She currently earns more than five US dollars per day and is able to save only 3 US dollars daily. 

This is Saroeun's first loan with VisionFund. She will use this entire loan to buy one more cow for helping her farm. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow rice with full production capacity to increase her crop yield and also hopes to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow for her farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is a forty-year-old hardworking man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent house.

He has been a farmer for the last two years after starting with two acres of land and now he has four and a half acres. His major hardship have been price fluctuations, inflation, high fuel and transportation costs. However, he has a goal of diversifying his farm to include cattle rearing. The purpose for this loan is to pay workers who are weeding his garden and for buying pesticides.

loans.use: to weed and buy pesticides for his garden

loans.name: Paskali

texts.en:
Paskali is a forty-year-old hardworking man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent house. He has been a farmer for the last ten years and his major hardships are: price fluctuations, inflation and inadequate capital to purchase spraying chemicals. He has as an objective to hire employees to help expand his farming activities. 

The purpose of the loan is to weed his plantation and buy spraying chemicals for his garden.

loans.use: to weed his plantation and buy spraying chemicals for his garden.

loans.name: Delgermurun

texts.en:
Delgermurun, 40, is a taxi-driver in Kherlen, a boarder town. He lives with his son and wife in an old house which is located in the slum district. Just a year ago, he started a taxi business and already has a lot of permanent customers. 

Over the past several years, the condition of his house has been deteriorating and it now has much damage to all parts of it. For this reason, he is taking out a loan to purchase the building materials he needs to repair his old house before the cold winter.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to repair his old house before the cold winter.

loans.name: Melida

texts.en:
Melida is a hardworking forty-one-year-old lady with three children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goals are to educate her children and buy a car. 

She has been running a food store for the last ten years. Her major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and when customers do not pay on time. She has as a business goal to buy land to grow crops and expand her food store so as to serve a wider market.

The purpose of the loan is to buy cassava and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Nhoeng

texts.en:
A 38-year-old mother of four dependent children who are still in school, Nhoeung is a farmer in a village in the Thmor Koul district where rice farming is common. She has been in this business for six years. Her husband is a taxi driver. She can manage to earn seven U.S. dollars per day from her current business but can save less than five U.S. dollars daily. 

Nhoeng is in her first cycle with VisionFund and is requesting a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her rice field. She hopes to produce more rice which will allow her to improve her lifestyle and also to keep her children in school so they can continue to higher education.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her rice field.

loans.name: Rauben

texts.en:
Rauben is a hardworking forty-one-year-old man with two children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goals are to build a permanent house and save for his wedding. He has been farming for the last seven years and the major challenges are price fluctuations, inflation and seasonal weather. His goals are to diversify his farm to include livestock and to buy land to grow more crops.

The purpose of this loan is to pay the workers who are weeding his crops.

loans.use: to pay the workers who weed his crops.

loans.name: Naume

texts.en:
Naume is a forty-eight-year-old married lady with three children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goals are to educate her children and build a permanent home. 

For the last three years, she has been running a retail shop where she specializes in selling jerrycans. Her major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to purchase stock. However she has a goal to expand her business into new areas and move it to a more permanent location.

The purpose of this loan is to to buy jerrycans for resale.

loans.use: to buy jerrycans for resale.

loans.name: Phalen's Group

texts.en:
Phalen is a widow and the 51-year-old mother of six children: five daughters and one son. For a fee, she provides a rice milling service to her village which is in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She uses her profits to support her family. She has been in this business for five years. 

Phalen received her first loan from VisionFund in 2004. The previous loans have helped her with her daily living and also to make some savings. She currently earns about five U.S. dollars per day. She successfully repaid the loans with VisionFund. Now she is applying for another loan with her group member Malin who joined VisionFund for this loan cycle. 

Phalen plans to use this entire loan to repair her car which she uses for her rice milling service. She hopes she can provide full and fast service to the villagers and earn more income so she can set aside some money for house renovation and necessary household comforts.

loans.use: To repair the car which she uses for her rice milling service.

loans.name: Ageteraine Kitutu Group

texts.en:
Lipisa is a 41-year-old married lady with one child who runs a retail shop in Kagadi, Uganda. The business is now three years old. She started it with capital she got from farming. Price fluctuations and inflation is the major factor affecting her business. 

Lipisa's goal is to build a permanent home and to expand her business into new markets. She needs a loan to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and sodas to sell. Lipisa is a member of Ageteraine Kitutu where members guarantee each other in order to access a loan.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a 34-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His current business is farming which he started ten years ago. He grows coffee and pineapples. His challenges have been price fluctuations, inflation, an unreliable labour force and rats destroying the pineapples that are ready to be taken to market.

His dream is to educate himself and children and buy more land to grow crops. Vincent needs the loan to buy coffee seeds to plant.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds to plant.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 57 years old. She is married to Benson and they are blessed with five children. She has been selling cereals for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 30,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Amina will use the loan to buy a stock of dry maize, beans and wheat for her business. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to build a permanent store for her stocks.

loans.use: To buy a stock of dry maize, beans and wheat for her business

loans.name: Shourt

texts.en:
Shourt, 32, is the breadwinner for his nuclear family. He has one dependent child who is still under school age. He raises pigs and also runs a small grocery store to provide the main income to support his family. He has been in this business for seven years. 

Shourt has been a member of VisionFund for two years and he successfully paid back his last loan with VisionFund. The loans have improved his living standards. He now can earn ten U.S. dollars per day from his business. 

Following the growth of his business, he is now applying for his third loan with VisionFund. The loan will be used to buy more ducks for resale, and US$250 will be used to buy a pig. He hopes to increase his business and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy ducks for resale and a pig.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 52 years old, married to Naomi, and they are blessed with two children. He has been selling cereals for the past ten years with a monthly income of Kes 30,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Francis will use the loan to buy a stock of dry maize, beans and wheat for his business. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to build his own store for his stocks of cereals.

loans.use: To buy a stock of dry maize, beans and wheat for his business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 38 years old, married to John, and they are blessed with five children. She has been selling cereals for the past ten years with a monthly income of Kes 30,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Irene will use the loan to buy a stock of dry maize, beans and wheat for her business. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to build a store for her stocks of cereal.

loans.use: To buy a stock of dry maize, beans and wheat for her business.

loans.name: Hoeu

texts.en:
Hoeu is a 46-year-old widow with three dependent daughters who are working as garment factory workers. To make a living, she has been farming on her rice paddy for five years. In addition to rice farming, she also runs a small grocery store selling food, cake, vegetables etc. in front of the garment factory where her daughters work, and she also raises poultry (chickens and ducks) for additional income. 

Hoeu has been a member of VisionFund for one year. She completely paid back her first loan with VisionFund. Now her family's condition has been gradually improved and she can earn nine U.S. dollars per day but is able to save only $3 daily. After her successful first loan, she is applying for another loan with VisionFund. She will use the loan to buy more grocery items to sell and a portion to buy animal feed. She hopes to increase her business to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell and animal feed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to set up a heating machine in his house.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a 44-year-old single lady with two children. She has been operating a beauty salon as a primary activity for the last two years and also sells second-hand clothes alongside the beauty salon, where earns a monthly income of KES 8,600.

She is requesting her first loan with KADET Ltd. and she will use the funds to purchase stocks of beauty accessories (weaves, hair clips, hair extensions, etc.) and clothes for resale in her salon. With the anticipated profits, she will grow her business and educate her children to college level.

loans.use: to buy salon accessories and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Khi

texts.en:
Khi is a married women residing in a village in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She has no children. 

She has been farming on her own farm for 18 years to earn a living while her husband is a construcion worker. With her current business, she earns less than $4 U.S. per day and is able to save only $1 U.S. daily. 

This is Khi's first loan with VisionFund. She plans to use this entire loan to buy fertilizer and hire labor to plow her rice field. She hopes to grow more rice and earn more income to make a better living and also to set aside some money for the future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire labor to plow her rice field.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Zilly

texts.en:
Zilly is 48 years old, married to Maube, and they are blessed with five children. She has been operating a grocery stall for the last 21 years, earning a monthly income of KES 5,700. 

She is requesting her first loan with KADET Ltd. of KES 20,000, which she will use to add more stock of onions, tomatoes and kale for her grocery store. With the anticipated profits, she plans to pay school fees for children.

Her hope is to educate her children to college level.

loans.use: To buy stock of onions, tomatoes and kale.

loans.name: Dulamdorj

texts.en:
Dulamdorj is a 47-year-old woman who has three children, age 13 to 24, and lives with her family in an outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia, without basic infrastructure. Her two daughters attend local high school while her son and his spouse work as a machinist and a builder. 

Since 1995, she has been operating a clothing sales business in the second largest outdoor market of Mongolia. She a sells wide range of clothes imported from Beijing and Ereen, a border city of China, where she travels once or twice in a month. 

She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes to sell for the upcoming season in order to increase her current working capital.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Khorn
