texts.en:
Khorn is 46 years old and a married mother of three dependent children, two of whom work as bakers for pay while the last one is at home helping with housework. 

To support her family, she has been farming for 15 years and she supplements her income by raising chickens, ducks and pigs. She currently earns about 8 U.S. dollar per day and is able to save around 3 U.S. dollars daily. 

This is Khorn's first loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy animal feed for her poultry and also to buy one cow to raise as farming labor. 

She hopes to feed her poultry to be fat and increase her crop production so as to improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and buy one additional cow for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 51 years old, married to Benson, and they are blessed with two children. She has been in a quarry business for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 10,000. which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Margaret will use the loan to buy a quarry ground. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to buy a lorry for transporting the stones, which will increase her income and help her improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy a quarry ground.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn is a father of two dependent children who are still in school. His primary sources of income are from rice farming and sugar making. He has been in this business for ten years to make a living. He currently earns less than 8 U.S. dollars per day. 

Now Sorn is applying for his first loan with VisionFund. He plans to use this loan to buy fertilizer for his rice paddy and to buy some necessary items for his sugar making business such as a bamboo container for sugar palm juice. He hopes to increase his business and improve his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and materials for his sugar making business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is a 51-year-old married woman living in a permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda. Her family goal is to educate her children and construct commercial houses on her plot.

She has a poultry and livestock business that she started two years back. Her challenge has been the low prices of both milk and eggs and her dream is to venture into rearing broilers.

Viola needs the loan to buy birds for poultry keeping.

loans.use: to buy birds for poultry keeping.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district, Mom is a 36-year-old mother of three dependent children, one daughter and two sons, who are still in school. 

She is a farmer who has been farming on her two-hectare farmland to earn a living and sometimes she works for others for extra income. With her current business, she is able to earn less than 10 U.S. dollars per day and save less than 2 U.S. dollars daily. 

This is Mom’s first group loan with VisionFund. She and her co-member, Khoet, who has been with VisionFund for three years, are requesting a loan for their farming businesses. Mom will use this loan to hire a combine harvester to harvest her rice paddy. She hopes to harvest more rice and make her daily living better.

loans.use: to hire a combine harvester to harvest her rice.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 58 years old married to Teresia, and they support a family of 10 people, He has been operating a hotel business for last 14 years earning a monthly income of KES 80,000. (In Africa, the word "hotel" often refers to a cafe.) 

He is borrowing his fifth loan with KADET Ltd. of KES 60,000, which he will use to pay school fees. With the anticipated profits from the business, he will repay the loan.

His hopes and dreams are to educate his children to university level.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Kiwambi Umoja Mbangamao Group

texts.en:
Denis, standing left, is a 42 year-old married man with four children, all attending secondary education. He is has been working hard producing maize, beans and rice for over four years. He has farming problems due to crop diseases and lack of fertilizers.

Denis is looking for financial support to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. In the five years to come he has a vision to boost the scale of production from 15 to 45 acres in expectation of earning more income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Chansokun's Group

texts.en:
Chansokun is 32 years old, married and has two dependent children, one son and one daughter, who are too young to attend school. She is a farmer who has been farming on her two-hectare farmland to make a living for ten years and she supplements her income by selling Chinese noodle and rice soup in the village. 

Chansokun received a loan from VisionFund five years ago. The previous loan from VisionFund have helped her make a living better. She earns more than US$25 per day but is able to save less than five U.S. dollars daily. With her business growth, she and her co-member in the group, who has also been with VisionFund for five years, are applying for another loan. She wants to buy ingredients, kitchen ware etc. for her business. This loan will enable her to run her business well and she hopes to buy necessary comforts for her family and send her children to school and keep them there.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, kitchen ware, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is 32 years old and married to Jackylne and they have been blessed with two children. He sells second-hand clothes and  has been in business for six years, earning a monthly income of Kes 10,000.

He is requesting his first loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 5,000 which he intends to use to purchase additional stock for the business. He plans to open another shop with the anticipated profit from the business.

His hopes and dreams are to expand his business beyond his locality by opening new branches.

loans.use: To add more stock to the business.

loans.name: Clare

texts.en:
Clare is 40 years old single and a mother of three children. She owns and runs a beauty salon in Bombolulu- Mombasa for the past three years. 

This is her second loan from KADET ltd of kes 40,000.She plans to use the loan to purchase new hair dryers, blow dryers, towels and hair chemicals for her salon. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and use the rest of the profits for the gradual expansion of her salon. 

She hopes open another branch and be successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase new hair dryers, blow dryers, towels and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Srurn's Group

texts.en:
A rural dweller in a village of the Ponhea Krek district, Srurn is a 47-year-old father of three dependent children who all work at the family's rice farm. To make a living, he has been farming on his farmland for almost thirty years and he supplements his income by raising chickens and producing palm sugar and juice to better support his family. 

Srurn is on his third loan with VisionFund while his group members have been with VisionFund for one or two years. The two loans have helped him have sufficient food and improve his living. Now he leads his group of five members to apply for a loan with VisionFund. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer for his farm and use a portion for his palm sugar business. He hopes to increase his crop yield and palm sugar and juice business to improve his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farm and use a portion for his palm sugar business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 41 year old married and has three children. He sells charcoal in Shanzu, Mombasa and has been doing this business for the last two years successfully. 

He is requesting for his second loan from KADET of Kes 60, 000, he intends to use the loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal to resell to his customers in Shanzu. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase a motorcycle which he will use for public transport to supplement his income. 

He hopes to be own a fleet of motorcycles and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Review-Stephen Kamande

texts.en:
Stephen Kamande is 25 years old and married with a child. For the past five years, he has been selling clothes in Voi and he is doing great. Stephen was recently introduced to KADET.

Stephen is requesting his first loan to purchase more bales of shirts, trousers, and skirts to sell to the residents of Voi. He will use the anticipated profit from his loan to purchase his own plot of land and build a business premises. Stephen hopes to have a more profitable business and thus be able to live a happier, comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, trousers, and skirts

loans.name: Lourn

texts.en:
Lourn is 38 years old and is a widowed mother with four dependent children, three of whom work in a casino to earn a living. She is originally from a village located in the Ponhea Krek district. For the past five years, Lourn has been planting cassava on her farmland. She earns more than 10 USD each day and is able to save more than 5 USD daily. 

Lourn is requesting her first loan with VisionFund to buy a plot of land in her village to create a financial asset. Her loan will enable her to have another plot of land for her family, especially her children.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land in her village

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah used her previous loan to buy craft items to sell. However, she still faces the business challenges of price fluctuations, inflation, and customers not paying on time. Sarah's personal goals are to educate her children and build a permanent house. Her business goal is to own an art gallery. 

Sarah is requesting a loan to buy more craft items to sell.

loans.use: to buy crafts to sell

loans.name: Saranchimeg

texts.en:
Saranchimeg is a 46-year-old married entrepreneur who lives with her family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, which is an area without basic infrastructure. Her husband works at a court organization while their children attend local university and high school. 

Saranchimeg has supported her family since 1999 by operating a children's clothing business and a grocery store. Currently, she sells clothes at the second largest outdoor market of Ulaanbaatar city. December is a very busy shopping month, so entrepreneurs need more products or working capital after December of each year. 

Saranchimeg is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes to sell for the upcoming season in order to increase her working capital. She is a very trusted client of Transcapital Co Ltd.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell in the upcoming season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Tsogzolmaa

texts.en:
Tsogzolmaa is a 49-year-old widow who lives with her three children, ages 15 to 29.  They live in a small apartment, which she rents from others. One of her children attends the local high school, one attends the local university, and her elder daughter operates a small shoe selling business near their home. 

Since 2005, Tsogzolmaa has been operating a shoe selling business.  When she first began her business, she had no stall, but now she owns a small stall. She sells a wide range of shoes, which she imports from Ereen, a border city of China. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) to purchase more shoes for the upcoming season. 

Also, she is one of our company’s trusted clients.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to resell.

loans.name: Hoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Hoeurn is 59 years old, widowed, and has one son who works for others to earn a living. She lives in a rural village located in the Thmor Koul district of Cambodia. She has been farming on her rice farm as her primary business for thirty years and she supplements her income by planting cassava. 

Hoeurn has been with VisionFund since 2009, and the loans have helped her have a regular income. Now she earns around US $7 per day but saves only US $1.50 daily. She leads a group of two female members, and they are applying for another loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, and wood to renovate her house. She hopes to have a decent and improved house to live.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for her house renovation.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 33-year-old and single. He runs a retail shop business in Mshomoroni, Mombasa for the past six years with great success. 

He is requesting for his first loan with KADET ltd of kes 20,000. He plans to purchase  stock of cooking oil, rice, baking flour, maize flour, and washing powders for his shop. He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and gradually expand his shop. 

He hopes to expand his retail shop into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of cooking oil, rice, baking flour, maize flour, and washing powders.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 32 years old, married to Katunge, and has one child. He has been in the farming business for the last seven years and he earns a monthly income of KES 4,000.

He is applying for his third loan of KES 15,000, which he will use to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides. He repaid his previous loan well and in good time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

In the future, he hopes to buy a new water pump and a piece of land for large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides.

loans.name: Thoeurn's Group

texts.en:
A widower from a village of the Thmor Koul district, Thoeurn is 32 years old and has no children. He is a farmer and he has been farming on his 1.5 hectare farmland for nearly twenty years to earn a living. Also, he buys and sells rice and cassava to better support his family. 

Thoeurn has been with VisionFund since 2008. The loans have helped him to make a living better. With his current business, he earns more than US$20 per day but is able to save only US$2.50 daily. Now Thoeurn and his co-member Kunthea who has been with VisionFund for five years are applying for another loan. He will use his entire share of the loan to hire workers to harvest his rice crop. He hopes that his rice crop will be harvested on time and available for sale. He also hopes to buy necessary comforts and renovate his house.

loans.use: To hire workers to harvest his rice crop.

loans.name: Chamrat's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Thmor Koul district, Chamrat is a 39-year-old mother of four dependent children, two daughters and two sons, who all are still in school. She started farming on her two-hectare rice farm twelve years ago and she supplements her income by selling Chinese noodle and rice soup in the village. 

Chamrat received a loan from VisionFund five years ago. The previous loan helped her make a living better. She earns more than US$25 per day but saves less than four U.S. dollars daily. She successfully paid back her loan with VisionFund.

 Now she and two other members in the group, namely Leng and Saovry, are applying for a loan. She will use her entire share of the loan to hire workers to harvest her rice crop and also to buy ingredients and other stuff for her business. She hopes to run her business well and earn more income to set aside some money to buy necessary comforts and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: To hire workers to harvest her rice crop and expand her business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a hardworking married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a drug shop in town and faces a challenge of price fluctuations and inflation plus high taxes and other fees. His dream is to educate his children and diversify his business into a private hospital.

John needs the loan to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet used the previous loan to complete her house. However, she changed from the transportation sector and now owns a retail shop. Her challenge in this business is price fluctuations and inflation and customers not paying on time. Her dream is to educate her children and diversify her business to a renowned wholesale shop. Harriet needs the loan to buy sugar and soap to sell and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap to sell and renovate her house.

loans.name: Mzungu

texts.en:
Mzungu is 25-year old married and a father of two children.He operates  "boda boda" (motorcycle) transport business  in Kilifi. He has done this business for the last 1 year and he is doing great. 

This marks his third loan from KADET ltd of Kes 30,000 .He plans to use the funds to purchase another motorcycle. With the anticipated profits he will repay his loan and educate his children. 

His hopes are to own a taxi and become successful in his business.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos used the previous loan to buy a cow for milk production.  He also distils a local brew, from which he has managed to earn a living. He started by producing 5 jerrycans but now he has increased to 7.  In spite of his progress, Amos faces a challenge of high costs of labor. His business dream is to set up a ranch and to increase his output of local brew per month, as the demand is high.  He needs the loan for bananas for making the local brew.

loans.use: to buy bananas for making local brew.
